title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
description: DescriptionOne of the largest national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering services. Our projects range in size and scope, and we are always striving to grow our presence in our communities.The Orange County office is looking for structural engineers who are eager to start their careers in structural engineering. We give many opportunities to young engineers to experience firsthand the many facets of structural engineering while working alongside seasoned professionals in a collaborative environment.Desired Education And Experience B.S. degree in Civil/Structural Engineering from an accredited university, M.S. degree with a specialty in Structural Engineering preferred  E.I.T. certification preferred  0-2 years of experience in building design Ideal Candidate Desires to develop a breadth and depth of knowledge in the field  Communicates clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing  Excels in collaborative environments  Is familiar with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of building projects located in California  Is familiar with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RISA-3D, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, SAFE, SP Concrete Design) Structural Engineer Responsibilities Prepare calculations and construction documents under the supervision of the Project Manager  Perform construction administration services under the supervision of the Project Manager  Interface with clients on project specific issues  Quality control of technical content  Grow in technical knowledge through attendance of in-house education opportunities

title: Engineering-Civil-Entry-Level (SF)
description: DescriptionAre you just out of school, or about to graduate? Our talented crew of civil engineers is looking for new team members!What Makes KPFF SF An Awesome Place To Work Work amongst a diverse team doing ACTUAL design work on some of the most challenging projects in the region  Comprehensive mentorship from smart, enthusiastic, experienced engineers  Generous benefits, a competitive salary and pay for every hour you work  Interaction with clients and our design and construction partners  A Fun and Wellness committee who organize great social activities, involve us in the community and encourages a healthy lifestyle  Multi-disciplinary office in downtown San Francisco with a killer view  forefront lifelong career support providing technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement  Resources and support of national 1,200+ person firm founded in 1960 Some of the things you might do in collaboration with other experienced engineers: Prepare site development construction drawings  Analyze of water, sewer, and storm drain systems  Review permit applications associated with a variety of project types  Design of bioswales, flow-through planters, and other stormwater treatment facilities to meet and exceed local stormwater quality requirements  Assist project team in design of rainwater reuse systems and LEED credit documentation  Research/data collection from public agencies and local municipalities  Geometric roadway design and site layout  Preparation of project specifications  Design of site grading and utility systems from master planning through construction  Communicate with design consultants and contractors in a design-build environment  Attend site visits to review construction of civil site improvements What You Bring To The Table Degree in Civil Engineering  Prior civil engineering internships a plus  Experience in or passion for AutoCAD Civil 3D  A desire to part of a smart and fun team who really like what they do Our supportive and fun work environment allows for work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF has more than 1,200 team members, 20 offices and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.KPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers designing innovative solutions for private and public projects of all types and scales. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized and our commitment to our clients and employees. Firm wide KPFF has been in business since 1960, growing from a single office in Seattle to become a nationally recognized firm.Learn More About UsKPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Bridge Engineer (0-4 years)
description: DescriptionEngineer – Bridge Engineer (0-4 years) One of the largest and most diverse and respected national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers is growing in Spokane!Consider joining our Spokane team and enjoy the benefits of our excellent reputation, cohesive team, flexible working environment, and people-based culture.We Are Seeking Entry-Level Structural Engineers To Join Our Bridge/Civil Structures Group. This Position Will Provide The Opportunity For You To Design And Manage a Diverse Array Of Public And Private Sector Projects In a Team Environment AndPerform design and inspection/field work that does not require previous experience Perform structural analyses and prepare design sketches. Project types include new structures, structural rehabilitations, and/or seismic analysis and design  Assist in preparation of plans, specifications and cost estimates  Collaborate with draftspersons to develop contract plans  Participate in technical and project discussions with the design team  Grow to lead design tasks, participate in project management and new staff mentoring. We are passionate about developing great engineers and project managers and do so by offering a variety of opportunities and experiences, along with informal mentoring. Join us and become part of a team that works on transformative projects with exceptional public and private sector clients.Minimum Qualifications BSCE with emphasis in Structural Engineering, MSCE in Structural Engineering preferred  Engineer In Training Certification preferred, but not required  Strong communicator and collaborator  Self-motivated  Strong technical and organizational abilities BenefitsBenefits provided by KPFF include: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Civil Engineer, Entry-Level
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 20 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers.Job DescriptionLearn more about our company at our website:We are seeking motivated and energetic entry-level civil engineers to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to develop your engineering skills while supporting a variety of engineering projects. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, are excellent communicators, and have effective collaboration skills. As an entry-level Civil Engineer, you’ll work with other engineers in a team setting on a variety of site development projects.The ideal candidate will have some experience in site development and AutoCAD Civil 3D, however more importantly we seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver the highest quality work to our clients.Minimum Qualifications B.S. degree in Civil Engineering.  E.I.T. certification preferred.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  AutoCAD/Civil 3D experience is highly desirable.  Ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Strong technical and organizational abilities. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical Insurance Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Dental Insurance – with a no-premium option  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Comp Time Program  Flexible Working Hours  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Structural Engineer Entry-Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Want to start your career at an engineering firm with diverse projects, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture? Consider KPFF! We are a national civil and structural firm designing some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front.We are looking for an entry-level structural engineer who enjoys working with teams to accomplish big goals. You’ll be a valued member of our team with training and development opportunities to grow your skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who doesn’t just have the technical skills to succeed, but also has the communication skills (listening, empathy, conveying ideas concisely) to work with internal teams and clients.A Day in the Life Might Include… Creating structural drawings supported by a calculation package  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Referring to applicable building codes for appropriate loads, analysis procedures, and requirements  Discussing the best load path for a safe and efficient building design with your project team  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Supporting a project manager to prepare, allocate, and track a project workplan and budget  Collaborating with architects, contractors, and others on your design team to solve problems and deliver a successful project Qualifications Strong communication skills  Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  EIT Certification  Previous internship experience is preferred Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce

title: Bridge Engineer (0-4 years)
description: DescriptionBRIDGE ENGINEER (0-4 YEARS)DescriptionKPFF’s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Entry-Level Structural Engineers to join the Bridge/Heavy-Civil group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from a career at KPFF:The Bridge/Heavy-Civil Team consists of structural engineers working in a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil design fields such as highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves. We pride ourselves on our collaborative approach to consulting, working with clients from all across the industry, including small local agencies, transportation departments, architects, and contractors. At KPFF there is always something new to learn and endless opportunities to innovate.Our core values at KPFF are Stability, Trust, Excellence, Relationships, and Passion. We are dedicated to helping every individual grow as a professional by working closely together on challenging and exciting projects. This position will allow you to participate in the engineering design and management of a wide range of transportation projects while working with a variety of public and private sector clients.TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES May Include The Following Perform design and inspection/field work that does not require previous experience.  Perform structural analysis and prepare design sketches. Project types could include new structures, structural rehabilitations of existing structures, and/or seismic analysis and design.  Assist in the preparation of plans, specification, cost estimates, or reports for new construction and/or evaluation of existing structures.  Instructs draftspersons on design drawings.  Participate in technical and project discussions within the design team.  Keeps Project Managers informed of workload and changes to project scope/efforts.  As your experience grows, you will also begin taking part in project management tasks, such as monitoring budgets and schedules, interacting with clients, and leading junior engineers. KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Minimum Qualifications BSCE with emphasis in Structural Engineering  0-4 years of experience Preferred Qualifications MSCE or MSE with emphasis in Structural Engineering  EIT  Strong communicator and collaborator  Self-motivated  Eager to develop and grow as a structural engineer  Passionate about providing exceptional client services  Strong technical and organizational abilities BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical insurance  Dental insurance – with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Engineering-Structural- Entry-Level (SD)
description: DescriptionKPFF San Diego is looking to hire entry-level structural engineers to support the continuous growth of our office.Minimum Qualifications BS Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  3.0 or above Cumulative GPA in Bachelor’s coursework  Previous internship, or up to 1 year full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  Strong understanding of structural engineering fundamentals (free body diagrams, P/V/M diagrams, etc.) Highly Preferred Qualifications  Master’s degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  EIT Certification  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Statics and Dynamics  Steel Design  Concrete Design  Wood Design  Seismic Analysis and Design  In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts:  Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? If you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume and references (2-3). If you are a recent graduate, please also attach your transcript. Qualified applicants only.Company OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, contractors, and industry innovators to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with passion, integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF offers a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive, well-rounded benefits package that includes 401k matching, flex time and paid family leave.www.kpff.com

title: Structural Engineer (0-4 years)

We pride ourselves on our collaborative approach to consulting, working with clients from across the industry, including architects, owners, and public agencies. title: Construction / Project Management Internship
description: Description Construction Project Management – Internship (Special Projects)  Construction Project Management Intern  – KPFF Special Projects may be seeking a full-time CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGEMENT INTERN in our Seattle office.ResponsibilitiesKPFF may be seeking a motivated Junior or Senior level Construction Management, Project Management, Architectural or Engineering student for a summer internship in the Seattle Office of KPFF Special Projects.The Construction Project Management Summer Internship would be approximately 40 hours a week for up to 90 days. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual intern, but generally include the following: Assist with Construction Project Management tasks in the office and in the field. Perform office duties such as construction administration, assisting with reports, contract document management, cost estimating, scheduling, coordination of sub-consultant teams, coordination of testing and inspection resources. Assist with project site visits. The applicant may be required to navigate through a jobsite and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the jobsite.KPFF Special Projects’ Pacific Northwest offices are located in Westlake Tower in Seattle and along the Ruston Way Waterfront in Tacoma. These offices are part of a dynamic 110+ person group that provides planning, civil and structural engineering, machinery design, and project management services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Current Project Types And Potential Work Includes Container terminal design and construction support. Airport terminals and tenant improvements including infrastructure upgrades. Trails and public facility improvements. Roadway upgrades and utility installations. Transit Facilities.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Suite. Experience using BlueBeam Revu. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required. Expectation to function effectively as part of a team. Must demonstrate self-motivation and dependability. Ability to understand and follow directions. Good time management and organizational skills.Education And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors in Construction Management, Project Management, Architecture or Civil Engineering.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Bridge Engineer (0-3 years)
description: DescriptionOne of the largest and most diverse Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers is growing in Boise!What We’re Looking ForWe are seeking an Entry-Level Structural Engineer to join our Mountain West Bridge Group. This position will provide opportunities to: Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams while developing design skills and project management capabilities.  Work on interesting and challenging projects, from planning through design and construction  Perform structural analyses and prepare design sketches. Project types include new structures, structural rehabilitations, and/or seismic analysis and design.  Assist in preparation of plans, specifications and cost estimates.  Collaborate with draftspersons to develop contract plans.  Participate in technical and project discussions with the design team.  Grow to lead design tasks, participate in project management, interact with clients, and mentor new staff.  The Position You will work in a fun and dynamic team to produce a range of deliverables from planning studies to construction documents and provide support to our clients during construction. Our group’s projects are primarily in the public works sector, with a broad range of project types.We are passionate about developing great engineers and project managers and do so by offering a variety of experiences, including mentorship and coaching. Join us and become part of a team that works on transformative projects with exceptional clients.Qualifications BS in Civil Engineering  MS in Structural Engineering  EIT Certification preferred  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (optional), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation, and sick time. We also provide a 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Graduate Structural Engineer
description: DescriptionAt KPFF, formerly Saul Engineering, we are focused on engineering excellence. With numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning and teaching, we rigorously develop our staff’s careers and passions. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your professional growth. We seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver efforts of the highest quality.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients.In Your Submission Please Include Cover letter  Resume  Transcripts, we accept unofficial transcripts Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Able to work in a team environment effectively  Strong technical skills  Strong organizational skills  Good written & verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate succinctly and effectively  Good understanding of English  Excellent interpersonal, planning, documentation and problem solving skills  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research and information gathering skills Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  Masters Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures is strongly preferred  EIT Certification  Previous engineering internship or office experience is preferred Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Des Moines office is located downtown. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Civil 0-3 Yrs.
description: DescriptionCivil Engineer – KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking an entry level full-time CIVIL ENGINEER in our Seattle office.KPFF Special Projects currently has an entry level position available in its Seattle office for interested and qualified graduates with a degree in Civil Engineering. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and modeling skills and assist with production of engineering plans, specifications and estimates as a part of a team. We are looking for candidates who are interested in developing their project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service. Field work is expected for site investigation and construction support services.Position Requirements BS in Civil Engineering  Engineer In Training (EIT) Certificate – or in process of obtaining  Ability to work collaboratively with project team members and clients on a variety of projects  Detail oriented and desire for continued learning  Clear communication and writing skills  General understanding of stormwater hydrology and hydraulics basics  General understanding of AutoCAD and Civil 3D Preferred/Desired Skills AutoCAD and Civil3D proficiency  Familiar with modeling software like EPA SWMM, WWHM/MGSFlood, WaterCAD, Autodesk SSA or other similar hydrology/hydraulics software Typical Project Types And Potential Work Includes Ports, harbors and light industrial related projects on the waterfront for a variety of public and private  Environmental cleanup and habitat restoration  Container terminal infrastructure design  Ferry terminals  Waterway dredging  Stormwater conveyance and treatment and design  Fisheries Engineering; hatchery building and pond design, diversion, and intake structures; Fish passage replacement  Rail infrastructure  Marinas About UsKPFF's Special Projects Seattle office, located in the retail core of downtown Seattle, WA, providing project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development. The Seattle Civil Team is 20+ person group of diverse backgrounds and experience levels. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle, WA, Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.In KPFF We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust  and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.AboutWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: The Position Want to start your career at an engineering firm with diverse projects, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture? Consider KPFF! We are a national civil and structural firm designing some of the most iconic structures in Boise and the Treasure Valley.We are looking for an entry-level structural engineer who enjoys working with teams to accomplish big goals. You’ll be a valued member of our team with training and development opportunities to grow your skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who doesn’t just have the technical skills to succeed, but also has the communication skills (listening, empathy, conveying ideas concisely) to work with internal teams and clients.A Day In The Life Might Include Creating structural drawings supported by a calculation package  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Referring to applicable building codes for appropriate loads, analysis procedures, and requirements  Discussing the best load path for a safe and efficient building design with your project team  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Supporting a project manager to prepare, allocate, and track a project workplan and budget  Collaborating with architects, contractors, and others on your design team to solve problems and deliver a successful project Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is preferred  EIT Certification  Strong communication skills  Previous internship experience is preferred  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Bridge Engineering Internship
description: Description BRIDGE ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP DescriptionKPFF’s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Structural Engineering Interns for the Bridge/ Civil-Structural Group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF:We proudly take part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job—we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are excited to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. We give interns real problems to solve and real designs to complete. Job responsibilities vary by group, and every intern walks away with real engineering experience and a unique story to tell.KPFF typically hires interns during the summer and begins reviewing resumes the fall prior. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire interns at certain levels in their college careers. Structural engineering interns are typically graduating undergraduate seniors or above (with 90+ credits).The Bridge/Civil-Structural Group consists of structural engineers working in on a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil projects such as, highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves. This internship would focus on bridge projects but may include opportunities to work on other types of projects in the group.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Minimum Requirements Current enrollment in a BSCE/MSCE program  Completion of 90+ credits, including two or more design courses (concrete, steel, wood, or masonry), by the start of the 2024 summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong communicator and collaborator  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Ability to work in-person in our downtown Seattle office KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Transportation Engineering Internship
description: Description TRANSPORTATION ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP Must Apply On-line To Be ConsideredKPFF’s Washington Division is located in Downtown Seattle and is seeking Transportation Engineering Interns for Summer 2024.Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF: .DescriptionIf you are looking for a civil engineering summer internship program to build your professional foundation which places you in the middle of challenging and exciting public sector projects within the Puget Sound Region, KPFF’s Transportation Engineering Internship program is where you want to be.Interns are active members on real projects with engaged team members ready to share their professional experience as you work together.Interns work on real projects and develop solutions and skills needed to thrive in a rapidly changing world.Each internship is unique and rewarding.The Transportation Group delivers design projects largely in the public realm, including roadways, mass transit, habitat restoration, trails, bridges, stormwater and utilities.We deliver solutions to communities and the public.In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire interns at certain levels in their college careers.Students are typically in their junior year or above to be considered for the Transportation Engineering Internship.We are proud to support young engineers beginning their professional career.Join us for an exciting and valuable summer experience!Minimum Qualifications Current enrollment in a BSCE program Completion of junior year by the start of 2024 summer internship Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals Effective written and verbal communication Ability to work effectively in a team environment Strong technical and organizational abilitiesKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Civil Engineering Internship
description: Description Civil Engineering Internship About UsKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and have been in practice for over 60 years. We work with architects, developers, contractors, and public agencies. Join us to be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the sort of projects we work on and who we are as people:Job DescriptionWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!You will work within a fun, dynamic, and diverse team and will have the opportunity to engage on projects from the beginning planning stages through construction documents, and during construction. Civil engineering project types vary from site development to utility infrastructure to regional stormwater facilities in the Pacific Northwest and beyondOur welcoming and newly renovated Seattle office offers collaboration space where you can brainstorm with your team and mentors, an individual workspace where you can dive deep into your design, and large kitchens where you can escape for lively lunchtime conversation. Use your KPFF subsidized ORCA pass to have light rail deliver you directly to our building, or for a sustainable Metro bus commute to our downtown office. To incorporate some exercise into your commute, join the many cyclists in our office and take advantage of bicycle storage and lockers on each floor.When interning with us, you will go beyond getting a glimpse into your future civil engineering career. We will integrate you into our teams and we are excited to share our professional experience as we work on projects together. You will work on real problems to solve and designs to complete.In your resume and/or cover letter, please indicate how and where you obtained the qualifications we have outlined below. We look forward to getting to know you!Qualifications And Skills Current enrollment in a BSCE program  Completion of junior year by the start of the 2024 Summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Ability to work effectively in a team environment  Strong technical and organizational abilities Responsibilities And Duties Alongside and with the supervision of your teammates, you will:  Travel to project sites to observe existing conditions.  Research jurisdictional codes and manuals to determine design requirements.  Participate in brainstorming sessions about sustainable civil engineering solutions.  Perform calculations to support the design of stormwater conveyance, water quality, flow control, and green stormwater systems.  Perform vehicular turning studies using software such as AutoTurn.  Prepare exhibits for inclusion with reports and/or presentations.  Prepare drafts of drainage reports and feasibility studies.  Work with CAD staff to develop exhibits and progress design plans.  Attend site visits to observe construction of the systems we design. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Bridge Engineer - Entry Level - Structural
description: DescriptionKPFF LA Structural has an opening for a Structural Engineer in our Los Angeles office. We are seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence and eager to develop design and project management skills. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work focuses on structural design on infrastructure projects, including bridges, waterfront infrastructure, and other horizontal construction projects on the West Coast region.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who receive their PE or SE at KPFF will receive a bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Licensed PE's and SE's receive a cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Qualifications Include B.S. in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  M.S in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  EIT is required  Concrete, steel, and timber coursework and /or design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic coursework and/or design experience  Familiarity with non-linear analysis  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members If you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes submitted elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2355Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Examples Of Projects Bridges  Wharves and Piers  Water Treatment Infrastructure  Physical Demands and Work Environment  Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated.  Our Employees Are valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Civil-0-2 Yrs Exp - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionEntry Level Civil EngineerKPFF is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic entry-level civil engineers to work in San Diego. We continuosly accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and transcripts (unofficial copies are fine).Job QualificationsIdeally, candidates should have some experience in site development, however more importantly we seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver the highest quality work to our clients.This position requires a B.S. degree or higher and preferably relevant internship experience and Engineer-in-Training (EIT) Certification.Excellent Communication And Teamwork Skills Are Essential.Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and envision potential scope of work requirements.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen.Ability to apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgement, independent decision making, and prolonged focus.Candidates will work on a wide variety of demanding projects with growth opportunities based upon their responsiveness, skills, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Civil Engineer Intern
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with architects, developers, contractors, and public clients to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including Preliminary Design Reports, Full Project Management, Project Budgeting, Permitting Coordination, and Subconsultant Management. We act on behalf of the owner to ensure a smooth start, guided process, and successful project completion, excel at creative engineering, and design sustainability into projects by helping our clients make "green" choices. We have been in business since 1960 and have an excellent reputation, a great team and flexible working environment. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.Job DescriptionCivil Engineering InternWe provide civil engineering services to both private and public sectors. Our clients are mainly Property Owners, Developers, Architects, Contractors, and Public Agencies. Our projects are primarily in the following market sectors: Commercial, Retail, Mixed-Use, Hospitality, Multi-Family Housing, Parks & Recreational Facilities, Health Care, K-12 Schools, Higher Education, Military, Transportation, and Public Agencies.The scope of our services may include site assessment, due diligence, master planning, entitlement, grading & drainage design, hydrology study, storm water quality design, utility improvements, street improvement plans, public utilities, and technical studies for environmental impact reports. In addition we provide project management and prime contract work.We are seeking motivated and energetic Civil Engineering Interns that is seeking to learn more about the civil engineering profession and KPFF. The intern will have opportunities to learn codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California as well as to work with computer software programs, such as AutoCAD, Civil3D, Hydrology, Hydraulic, Flowmaster.Minimum Job Qualifications Currently enrolled and pursuing Bachaler's or Master's degree in civil engineering at accredited university or college and have completed minimum 2 years of engineering coursework. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to function effectively in a teamwork environment. Excellent time management and organizational skills. E.I.T. certificate or previous intern experience preferred. Proficiency with Excel for Windows and Word for Windows and capable of working with AutoCAD, Civil3D, and other engineering software.

title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
description: DescriptionOne of the largest national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering services. Our projects range in size and scope, and we are always striving to grow our presence in our communities.The Orange County office is looking for structural engineers who are eager to start their careers in structural engineering. We give many opportunities to young engineers to experience firsthand the many facets of structural engineering while working alongside seasoned professionals in a collaborative environment.Desired Education And Experience B.S. degree in Civil/Structural Engineering from an accredited university, M.S. degree with a specialty in Structural Engineering preferred  E.I.T. certification preferred  0-2 years of experience in building design Ideal Candidate Desires to develop a breadth and depth of knowledge in the field  Communicates clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing  Excels in collaborative environments  Is familiar with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of building projects located in California  Is familiar with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RISA-3D, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, SAFE, SP Concrete Design) Structural Engineer Responsibilities Prepare calculations and construction documents under the supervision of the Project Manager  Perform construction administration services under the supervision of the Project Manager  Interface with clients on project specific issues  Quality control of technical content  Grow in technical knowledge through attendance of in-house education opportunities

title: Engineering-Civil-Entry-Level (SF)
description: DescriptionAre you just out of school, or about to graduate? Our talented crew of civil engineers is looking for new team members!What Makes KPFF SF An Awesome Place To Work Work amongst a diverse team doing ACTUAL design work on some of the most challenging projects in the region  Comprehensive mentorship from smart, enthusiastic, experienced engineers  Generous benefits, a competitive salary and pay for every hour you work  Interaction with clients and our design and construction partners  A Fun and Wellness committee who organize great social activities, involve us in the community and encourages a healthy lifestyle  Multi-disciplinary office in downtown San Francisco with a killer view  forefront lifelong career support providing technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement  Resources and support of national 1,200+ person firm founded in 1960 Some of the things you might do in collaboration with other experienced engineers: Prepare site development construction drawings  Analyze of water, sewer, and storm drain systems  Review permit applications associated with a variety of project types  Design of bioswales, flow-through planters, and other stormwater treatment facilities to meet and exceed local stormwater quality requirements  Assist project team in design of rainwater reuse systems and LEED credit documentation  Research/data collection from public agencies and local municipalities  Geometric roadway design and site layout  Preparation of project specifications  Design of site grading and utility systems from master planning through construction  Communicate with design consultants and contractors in a design-build environment  Attend site visits to review construction of civil site improvements What You Bring To The Table Degree in Civil Engineering  Prior civil engineering internships a plus  Experience in or passion for AutoCAD Civil 3D  A desire to part of a smart and fun team who really like what they do title: Structural Engineer Entry-Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Want to start your career at an engineering firm with diverse projects, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture? Consider KPFF! We are a national civil and structural firm designing some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front.We are looking for an entry-level structural engineer who enjoys working with teams to accomplish big goals. You’ll be a valued member of our team with training and development opportunities to grow your skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who doesn’t just have the technical skills to succeed, but also has the communication skills (listening, empathy, conveying ideas concisely) to work with internal teams and clients.A Day in the Life Might Include… Creating structural drawings supported by a calculation package  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Referring to applicable building codes for appropriate loads, analysis procedures, and requirements  Discussing the best load path for a safe and efficient building design with your project team  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Supporting a project manager to prepare, allocate, and track a project workplan and budget  Collaborating with architects, contractors, and others on your design team to solve problems and deliver a successful project Qualifications Strong communication skills  Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  EIT Certification  Previous internship experience is preferred Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce

title: Engineering-Civil Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionCivil Engineering InternshipKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are ready to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. Job responsibilities vary by groups, and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.KPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic civil interns. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. We typically hire interns during the summer, and begin reviewing resumes during the spring. Internship opportunities also arise during other times of the year, in which case we will review all applications. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire Civil interns who are Juniors or above, including students pursuing their master’s degree.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and document potential scope of work  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to learn and apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Airport terminals and tenant improvements including infrastructure upgrades. Trails and public facility improvements. Roadway upgrades and utility installations. Transit Facilities.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Suite. Experience using BlueBeam Revu. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required. Expectation to function effectively as part of a team. Must demonstrate self-motivation and dependability. Ability to understand and follow directions. Good time management and organizational skills.Education And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors in Construction Management, Project Management, Architecture or Civil Engineering.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.
