title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionAutoCAD Civil Engineering Drafting Internship - Future OpportunityKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic AutoCAD Drafting Interns. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job QualificationsKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. This is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work either full-time or part-time on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. AutoCAD Drafting Interns work in a close knit team environment in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. These teams contribute to the professional growth of our Interns by sharing professional experience.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Candidates should have excellent communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative, team environment. Seeking candidates who have a degree in computer drafting and design, or are currently pursuing their degree. High School Diploma or GED required. Some Civil CAD experience preferred. Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Company ProfileCompany offers an excellent benefits package.KPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Roadway Engineer (0-3 years)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to make a positive impact on Idaho's transportation infrastructure!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do. We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: www.kpff.comWhat We’re Looking ForKPFF’s Mountain West Transportation Team is located Boise, Idaho. We are seeking a Roadway Engineer with 0 to 4 years of experience designing roadway projects. This position will provide opportunities to: Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams while developing project management capabilities  Work on interesting and diverse projects  Engage with clients  Build our business in Idaho We are passionate about developing great engineers and project managers and do so by offering a variety of experiences, including with mentorship and coaching. Join us and become part of a team that works on transformative projects with exceptional clients. The Position You will work in a fun and dynamic team to produce a range of deliverables from planning studies to construction documents and provide support to our clients during construction. Our group’s projects are primarily in the public works sector, with a broad civil engineering skillset required to design grading, drainage, utilities, paving, and horizontal control. Experience in road and/or utility infrastructure is a plus.Qualifications 0-4 years of experience, focused on transportation design  B.S. in Civil Engineering  EIT Certification or PE License  Familiarity with AutoCAD Civil 3D and/or MicroStation, InRoads, and OpenRoads  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Civil Engineering Internship
description: DescriptionResponsibilitiesKPFF is seeking a motivated Civil Engineering student pursuing their BSCE to work as an engineering technician in the KPFF Lacey office. The position being offered is approximately 40 hours a week for 2.5 to 4 months depending on candidate’s availability. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual, but generally include the following: Assist with Civil site development and transportation projects, including quantity take-off calculations, design layout, AutoCAD drafting and assistance on survey crews.  Assist in office duties such as making copies, assisting with reports, and permit applications.  The applicant may be required to navigate through a job site and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the job site. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Minimum QualificationsNonePreferred RequirementsWorking towards bachelor’s in civil engineering.Job Qualifications Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Programs.  Computer Aided Drafting experience is desired (AutoCAD and Civil 3D).  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Functions effectively as part of a team.  Dependability  Ability to understand and follow directions.  Good time management and organizational skills. Lacey Office CultureKPFF Lacey’s vision statement is to provide experiences that create a lasting positive impact on our people, clients, and community. We are passionate about providing a collaborative, playful, and positive environment for our employees. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a small office. We work in a fast-paced environment that will provide opportunities to work with our staff of civil engineers and surveyors on a variety of project types and sizes requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively.About KPFFWe believe that people are at their best when they have a purpose and are self-motivated from the core of their ideology. KPFF gives individuals the opportunity to pursue and develop an area of expertise and practice that follows their passion and improves our team and culture. We believein supporting these pursuits both professionally and personally. This belief is at the core of our employees and KPFF’s success. KPFF utilizes forefront, a program that provideslifelong career support in technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers a number of growth opportunities and social events.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, competitive rates, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, and much more.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. KPFF participates in the E-Verify program to determine the eligibility of our employees to work in the United States.

title: Revit Modeler- Birmingham
description: DescriptionKPFF Birmingham Structural is currently seeking Revit Modelers to join our firm. Responsibilities would include developing an engineer’s concepts and sketches into accurate parametric models and drawings on a wide range of state-of-the-art projects such as high-rise office buildings, historic renovations, airports, bridges, K-12 schools, higher education, retail, parking garages, hotels, and residential.KPFF is leading the way in the AEC industry in terms of Revit/BIM and advanced virtual technology. We are dedicated to providing you with on-the-job training to encourage your professional growth. At KPFF we work in dynamic teams with strong mentorship and our modeling staff are valued team members. If you are interested in growing in your career and working in a supportive environment that offers a competitive salary and generous benefits, this is the place for you.Desired Experience 3 Years of experience with Revit/Revit Structure. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer

title: Transportation Engineering Internship
description: Description TRANSPORTATION ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP  MUST APPLY ON-LINE TO BE CONSIDERED One of the largest and most diverse and respected national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers is growing in Spokane! We are seeking a Summer 2024 intern for our transportation team. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF: .DescriptionThe KPFF Spokane transportation team is collaborating with fantastic clients on rewarding projects that are transforming and improving our community!KPFF’s internship program is a quality experience where you will engage with project teams to work on public projects and gain valuable experience and knowledge directly from engineering professionals.Our diverse array of transportation projects includes all types of roadways and pathways, transit, bridge, and aviation. Transportation planning and design projects routinely employ civil engineering disciplines, including transportation geometrics, stormwater hydrology and hydraulics, and utilities. We pride ourselves on providing creative solutions that endure the test of time.We are passionate about developing great engineers and do so by offering a variety of opportunities, experiences and mentoring.We are proud to support engineers beginning their professional career.Join us for an exciting and valuable summer experience!Minimum Qualifications Current enrollment in a BSCE program Completion of junior year by the start of 2024 summer internship Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals Effective written and verbal communication Ability to work effectively in a team environment Strong technical and organizational abilitiesKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who is dynamic – there’s nothing wrong with technical savvy, but technical can be trained. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day in the Life Might Include… Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  Master’s degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Utah PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting - Structural Revit Modeler
description: DescriptionModeling/Drafting – Structural Revit ModelerKPFF St. Louis is looking for a capable and motivated Structural Revit Modeler to work in our growing St. Louis office. This is not a remote position.KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF employees are committed to the success of the client, and their reward is a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive and well-rounded benefits package.KPFF’s St. Louis office opened in 2002 and provides structural engineering services locally and nationally. With a staff of 35, our office culture is entrepreneurial and collaborative. We strive to incorporate our core values of Relationships, Stability, Passion, Trust, and Excellence in everything we do.Minimum Technical Requirements Proficiency with Revit Structure and AutoCAD 2018 or higher, with a thorough understanding of applications, tools, and function.  Revit family use.  Tagging and annotation.  Ability to read and understand architectural and structural drawings.  Understanding structural framing and elements of a building.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, light-gage metal, and masonry.  Ability to generate complete and finished drawings from marked prints, engineer notes, and written/verbal instructions.  Good communication and teamwork skills Job Responsibilities Develop engineers’ concepts and sketches into accurate parametric models and drawings.  Manipulate annotative and detail component families, updating tags, and maintenance of live schedules.  Maintenance of views associated with multiple linked Revit models.  Manage drawing issues and daily housekeeping in terms of both digital and hard copy project file storage. Qualities Be an active member of the design team, communicating and coordinating confidently, accurately, and professionally.  Have a positive and practical attitude towards problem solving and working as part of a team.  Use creative thinking to meet building design and drawing production challenges.  Possess strong detailing capabilities.  Have a desire to keep up with software and hardware innovations.  Be willing to work overtime as required.  Able to handle heavy workload with tight deadlines.  Comfortable with communicating with clients via phone, email, and in person, representing KPFF in a positive way. Additional Skills Microsoft Office experience  Bluebeam experience

title: Modeling / Drafting -- Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician - MicroStation
description: Description Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician (Special Projects - Seattle) KPFF Special Projects is seeking a talented and driven Civil/Structural Drafter, motivated to join a team environment in our Seattle office.As a civil/structural drafter, you will work within a team of engineers and drafters alike and become a vital key to producing construction documents that will become a part of our real-world infrastructure. Many of these projects will include civil site plans, bridges, retaining walls, underground structures, and marine structures such as piers, wharves, dolphins, floating structures, and ferry terminals.KPFF is a large, stable company with local control of all engineering and client decisions.The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Qualities Experience drafting in MicroStation and AutoCAD as well as setup of and compliance with various client or agency standards in MicroStation and AutoCAD.  Willingness to learn and become proficient in unfamiliar CAD software.  Good communication and teamwork skills.  Prepare plans, profiles, sections, and details from rough sketches, verbal instruction, and engineers redlines.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, masonry, and a basic understanding of the construction process.  Prepare final drawings ensuring that all work (line work, blocks, etc.) conforms to the applicable CAD standards. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience preferred  Proficiency in MicroStation V8i/Connect and AutoCAD  Proficiency in managing external references within MicroStation AND AutoCAD environments  Associate degree in computer-aided drafting, and/or equivalent experience and training About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, paid family leave, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineering Intern
description: DescriptionKPFF offers an internship program designed to provide qualified candidates with an opportunity to learn the day-to-day knowledge and skills necessary to become a structural engineer. Internships also provide KPFF with the opportunity to get to know potential future KPFF employees. In the KPFF Portland office, many internships turn into full-time engineering positions.Our interns gain valuable consulting experience ranging from structural engineering design tasks, drawing coordination tasks, construction site visits, and construction administration services. An intern's job duties will vary by team, but every intern will work alongside experienced structural engineers committed to developing future engineers.Qualifications Strong desire to be a structural engineer upon completion of their education.  Completed a Bachelor of Science degree in civil engineering with emphasis in structural engineering and continuing on for a Master of Science degree in structural engineering (or similar). Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Strong grasp of basic engineering fundamentals.  Effective written and verbal communication.  Strong technical and organizational abilities.  Strong research and information gathering skills.  Application Instructions To be considered for an internship position, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave and other benefits; however, we do not provide accommodations.This opportunity will require an in-office presence and will not be a remote internship.KPFF is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Project Manager
description: DescriptionProject Manager – Industrial GroupKPFF is seeking a Project Manager to lead and oversee projects within our Industrial Group at our downtown Seattle office location. T he type and scope of the projects vary but typically involve manufacturing facilities and related infrastructure. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in project management and operations, collaborating with principals, project managers, and other external team members to drive the successful delivery of industrial projects for manufacturing and private-sector clients. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring projects are executed within scope, schedule, and budget, while also contributing to the growth and efficiency of the team.The ability to establish and maintain productive and professional relationships with members of the Industrial Group, other KPFF staff, clients, and subconsultants is vital to success in this position.We are committed to developing our staff and providing opportunities to pursue their passions in a supportive business environment. We’re a group focused on project leadership who work directly with high profile, nationwide clients, who are driving innovation in the US economy.Job OverviewWe are seeking a self-driven and proactive team leader who can effectively undertake a diverse range of responsibilities to ensure the successful execution of projects and the delivery of client and subconsultant deliverables. The ideal candidate will be adept at confidently handling tasks similar in nature to the followingResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Management: Lead and manage all phases of project delivery, from initial schematic design through construction support and project closeout.  Collaborate with and lead multi-disciplinary design teams to establish project goals, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop and execute project plans, budgets, and schedules.  Monitor project progress and identify and mitigate risks.  Oversee and manage the QA/QC processes related to project submissions.  Ensure the delivery of high-quality projects within scope and budget constraints. Client Engagement And Relationship Building Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with industrial clients, serving as the main point of contact.  Lead project meetings with team members and clients.  Understand client needs and objectives and align project strategies accordingly.  Communicate project progress, issues, and solutions effectively to clients.  Identify opportunities for additional services and client satisfaction. Financial Management Oversee project budgeting, cost tracking, and financial performance.  Review and approve change orders, amendments, and project expenditures.  Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and billing to clients. Team Collaboration And Leadership Foster a positive workplace culture within the Industrial Group.  Collaborate with project teams and provide leadership and guidance.  Mentor and develop junior staff members.  Contribute to the development of best practices and process improvements. Strategic Planning And Business Development Assist in developing business strategies and identifying growth opportunities.  Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends and potential clients.  Collaborate with leadership to create and execute business development initiatives. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in project management, engineering, or a related field.  At least 7 years of experience in engineering design, project management, construction management, or a combination of relevant experience.  Understanding of complex projects integrating architecture, structural, civil, mechanical, and electrical disciplines.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word and Excel.  Strong organizational and time management skills.  Excellent leadership and communication skills.  Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with team members, clients, and subconsultants. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in project management within the industrial sector.  Strong understanding of project finance and budgeting.  Proficiency in project management software and tools.  PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Benefits Benefits provided by KPFF include:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays  10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service.  10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members.  Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year.  Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Structural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience
description: Position SummaryStructural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience DescriptionKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills  Minimum Qualifications   BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete  Steel or Wood Design  At least one year of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required   Preferred Qualifications   3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2348Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD - AutoCAD Drafter - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionEntry Level AutoCAD DrafterKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated entry level AutoCAD Drafters. We continuously accept and review applications for positions when they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job QualificationsThis is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. AutoCAD Drafters work in a close knit team environment with growth opportunity in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. Company offers an excellent benefits package.Candidates should have excellent communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative, team environment. Seeking candidates from entry level up to four years of CAD experience. High School Diploma or GED required. Associate’s Degree preferred. Civil CAD experience preferred.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Candidates will work on a wide variety of challenging projects with growth opportunities based upon their competency, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Structural Design Intern--Summer 2024
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including preliminary design reports, full project management, project budgeting, permitting coordination, and sub-consultant management. We act on behalf of the owner to ensure a smooth start, guided process, and successful project completion. Weexcel at creative engineering and incorporating design sustainability into projects by helping our clients make "green" choices. We have been in business since 1960 and have an excellent reputation, a great team and flexible working environment. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.Position DescriptionAs a structural engineering intern in our Orange County office, you will get the opportunity to gain some real world engineering experience on a wide range of project types and sizes and to learn skills to help take your future career where you want it to go. You will also get to work with some amazing people and learn from other engineers with a deep and diverse skill set while being actively engaged in a fun, collaborative office environment.Minimum Position Qualifications At least 3 years progress towards Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering with Structural emphasis or equivalent. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to function well in a team environment. E.I.T. certificate or previous intern experience preferred. Successful completion of classes in steel design, concrete design and structural analysis required. Classes in wood design and/or masonry design preferred. Familiarity with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California. Familiarity with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, RISA-3D, SAFE, Microsoft Office).

title: 2024 Structural Engineering Internship
description: Description What are you doing next summer? KPFF San Francisco needs Structural Interns! The Highlights Working among a diverse team doing ACTUAL project work on some of the most challenging projects in the region  Comprehensive mentorship from thoughtful, enthusiastic, experienced engineers  Construction administration, including site visits  Interaction with clients and our design and construction partners  Multi-disciplinary office in downtown San Francisco  Opportunities for social interaction, team building, and fun!  Walk away with a unique story to tell KPFF has an award-winning, tremendously diverse portfolio including projects of all scales and in all kinds of materials. We collaborate with our clients utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our office employs Lean Design and Construction tools and participates in a variety of project delivery methods in order to further integrate design and construction.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Our encouraging and fun work environment allows for work/life balance. As a nationwide firm with global projects, an extensive presence across 27 U.S. offices, and professional registrations in all 50 states, KPFF provides ample opportunities for career advancement and global exposure. Our San Francisco office was founded in 1992 and is strongly established in the Bay Area and primarily focuses on local projects within California.Applicants must be motivated and possess excellent written and verbal skills. Internships are 30 to 40 hours per week and typically last 2.5 to 6 months depending upon the candidate's availability. This is an in-person role with our team in the San Francisco office. Job responsibilities vary by group and each intern. Learn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our

title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (Entry Level - 2 yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. We have all the benefits of a large, stable firm but none of the red tape that comes with it. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we're about. KPFF is experiencing solid growth and continues to innovate and adapt to better serve our clients. We are a group of dedicated, friendly, collaborative, hard-working engineers and are looking for exceptional engineers to join us.Position SummaryAs a Structural Project Engineer specializing in protective design, you will work individually and collaboratively in the design and analysis of federal and local government, infrastructure, and private 'high-risk' projects with an emphasis on blast engineering, physical security design, progressive collapse and hostile vehicle mitigation. You will work closely with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, security consultants, and client teams. The preferred candidate will have experience in dynamics, blast engineering, protective design consulting, and high-fidelity modeling, in addition to the following qualifications and skills: Master of Science Degree with emphasis in structural engineering  Up to 2 years of experience in structural/blast engineering  Advanced structural modeling  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Creative, proactive, and detail-oriented KPFF provides a wide range of personal and career benefits that accentuate our 'employee focused' company attitude including: An excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Competitive Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Relocation Benefits  Employer-paid engineering society membership  Employer contributed commuter benefit  Performance based bonus based on profitability and contributions of the employee to its success.  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting - Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 22 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers and drafters.Learn more about our company at our website: www.kpff.comJob DescriptionWe are seeking motivated Civil CAD Designers with AutoCAD Civil 3D experience, preferably in site development, to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to use your experience to play a key role in the production of civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D. You will collaborate with our team of engineers, drafters, and surveyors, guided by a Project Manager and with the support of other team members. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, who have effective technical and communication skills to work with internal teams and clients. You’ll collaborate with internal team members and be responsible for the overall presentation and drawing appearance.Our typical scope of services includes preparing civil engineering plans and technical specifications, grading plans, drainage plans, storm water quality design, sustainable design, utility improvements, roadway infrastructure design, and ADA code compliance assessments.As a Civil CAD Designer, you may be responsible for: Creating civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D  3D Modeling of civil engineering design for grading and utilities  Applying established CAD standards  Preparing and editing plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Maintaining organization of project drawing files  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Opportunity to train other team members in AutoCAD and Civil 3D Minimum Qualifications 3 years of relevant CAD experience, preferably in site development.  Good communication skills, and ability to function effectively in a team environment.  Basic knowledge of industry CAD standards and civil engineering plans.  Effective time management skills and the ability to concurrently manage multiple priorities.  Associate’s Degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting (CAD), or similar field.  Working knowledge of typical computer software programs used for civil engineering design (AutoCAD, Civil3D, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, etc.).  Willingness to mentor entry-level engineers, drafters and interns in AutoCAD.  Experience creating or modifying AutoCAD styles and LISP routines a plus. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical Insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Dental Insurance – with a no-premium option  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Comp Time Program  Flexible Working Hours  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Louisville
description: Description Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Louisville Reports To: Team Leader - Josh Bullington, Josh White or Visnja Davidovic Reporting Center:  Louisville, KY Position Location(s):  Louisville, KY Status:  Full-Time Summer Position (Temporary) Classification:  Non-Exempt Travel Required:  N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. Incorporating our interns into an actual production schedule creates an environment where everyone, from principals to project engineers, are ready to share their professional experience and work together as a team. Job responsibilities vary by group and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates  Learn modeling software, Revit  Generate Construction Documents  Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards  Any and all other duties assigned by your Team Leader Qualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university -AND- with a structural engineering focus  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred  Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members  Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design  Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English  Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material  OUR TEAM MEMBERS Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Indianapolis office is located in the heart of downtown, right on Monument Circle, and close to many fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Civil CAD Technician
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. We offer a non-bureaucratic environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, outstanding coworkers, and competitive pay and benefits. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the projects we work on and who we are as people:Our Civil Engineering team in Boise is seeking full-time Civil Drafters and CAD Technicians to support our group. We are looking for team members that will be responsible for supporting multiple projects and teams by creating, managing, updating, and maintaining a variety of drawings, with an eye for presentation and attention to detail. We want team members that are excited and interested in making a difference in the world and communities we live and work in, are effective communicators, and enjoy working on a team and with different people. Bring your attention to detail, enthusiasm, and creative skills to KPFF to make a difference to our team and projects.Responsibilities Creation of project drawings and exhibit deliverables  Applying established company, jurisdiction, and/or project CAD standards  Maintain organization of project drawing files  Prepare and edit plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Plotting and scanning of drawings  Complete drawings and project responsibilities within anticipated timeline  Attributes:  The ability to work both independently and as part of a team  Self-motivated, hardworking, dependable employee  Be detail oriented, organized and have good follow-through skills  Develop excellent working relationships with team members  Minimum Qualifications  0 – 2 years’ experience or completion of a CAD technical education program  Proficiency in AutoCAD and/or Microstation  Basic knowledge of Civil 3D, InRoads, and/or OpenRoads a plus  Our Company KPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to public agencies, architects, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?
description: DescriptionJoin a Structural Engineering Firm that Puts People First.Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits. Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Super Keeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Greater Indianapolis Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Indianapolis office who desires to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Indiana and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat.Why KPFF?KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,400+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “ Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”.Why you will LOVE KPFF GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications More than 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in IN or nearby surrounding states  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion Office EnvironmentWe are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our Firm ProfileKPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “ forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky
description: DescriptionJoin a Structural Engineering Firm thatPuts People First.Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits.STRUCTURAL ENGINEER: Stuck and Looking for Sky?KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Super Keeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Greater Cincinnati Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Cincinnati office who is desiring to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Ohio and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat.Why KPFF?KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with almost 30 offices, 1,300+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”.Why you will LOVE KPFF GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications More than 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Architectural Engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in OH, IN, KY, and/or TN  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion Physical Demands Maintaining the same position for several hours  Moving through office or site visits  Operate a computer, calculator, and various other essential office tools  Kneeling, climbing, crawling, squatting, reaching  Lifting and moving up to 50 pounds Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.Office EnvironmentWe are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our Firm ProfileKPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. The firm encourages innovation and continuous quality improvement in our work that is unencumbered by bureaucratic behavior.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity EmployerLearn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our website at

title: Civil Design Engineer (3-6 Years)
description: DescriptionKPFF Lacey is looking for motivated and passionate civil engineers who are eager to expand their design and project management skills. We are accepting applications to fill positions immediately. Applications should include a resume and cover letter.Job QualificationsB.S. Degree or higherEIT Certification P.E. License in Washington (preferred)AutoCAD and Civil 3D experience Knowledge of codes, regulations, and standards applicable to the design and construction of major site development projects in WashingtonExcellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essentialCompetency, accountability, and personal commitment to deliver quality work to our clientsJob DescriptionOur engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. We encourage decision-making at the closest level to the issue to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients and promote professional growth for our staff. This position provides opportunities to work on a variety of projects for both public agencies and private developers which include:Commercial Site DevelopmentParks and Recreation FacilitiesMulti-family / Residential DevelopmentWater SystemsSewer Lift Stations Roadway InfrastructureMunicipal InstitutionsWe Provide The Opportunity For Our Engineers To Take Part In All Aspects Of The Design Process And Look For Candidates Who Want To Be Challenged And Stretch Outside Their Comfort Zone. General Project Tasks That Our Engineers Perform Are As FollowsSite planningPrepare construction drawingsAnalyze and design water, sewer, and storm systemsSite grading and stormwater management designPrepare technical reports Prepare project specificationsPrepare project cost estimatesReview and submit permit applications Provide construction administration supportCommunicate with design consultants, municipalities, contractors, and clientsAttend site visitsLacey Office CultureKPFF Lacey’s vision statement is to provide experiences that create a lasting positive impact on our people, clients, and community. We are passionate about providing a collaborative, playful, and positive environment for our employees. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a small office. We work in a fast-paced environment that will provide opportunities to work with our staff of civil engineers and surveyors on a variety of project types and sizes requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively.About KPFFWe believe that people are at their best when they have a purpose and are self-motivated from the core of their ideology. KPFF gives individuals the opportunity to pursue and develop an area of expertise and practice that follows their passion and improves our team and culture. We believe in supporting these pursuits both professionally and personally. This belief is at the core of our employees and KPFF’s success. KPFF utilizes forefront, a program that provides lifelong career support in technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers a number of growth opportunities and social events.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, competitive rates, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, and much more.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. KPFF participates in the e-Verify program to determine the eligibility of our employees to work in the United States.

We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive, well-rounded benefits package that includes 401k matching, flex time and paid family leave.www.kpff.com
