We do this by incorporating them into teams that are ready to share their professionals experience as they work on projects together. Job responsibilities may vary, but each intern walks away with a unique story to tell. We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!About KPFFKPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession. KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development.About KPFF SacramentoThe KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.We provide engineering services to both private and public sectors with projects in a vast market sector including Commercial, Retail, Mixed-Use, Hospitality, Multi-Family Housing, Parks & Recreational Facilities, Health Care, K-12 Schools, Higher Education, Military, Transportation, and Public Agencies.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Project Manager
description: DescriptionProject Manager – Industrial GroupKPFF is seeking a Project Manager to lead and oversee projects within our Industrial Group at our downtown Seattle office location. T he type and scope of the projects vary but typically involve manufacturing facilities and related infrastructure. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in project management and operations, collaborating with principals, project managers, and other external team members to drive the successful delivery of industrial projects for manufacturing and private-sector clients. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring projects are executed within scope, schedule, and budget, while also contributing to the growth and efficiency of the team.The ability to establish and maintain productive and professional relationships with members of the Industrial Group, other KPFF staff, clients, and subconsultants is vital to success in this position.We are committed to developing our staff and providing opportunities to pursue their passions in a supportive business environment. We’re a group focused on project leadership who work directly with high profile, nationwide clients, who are driving innovation in the US economy.Job OverviewWe are seeking a self-driven and proactive team leader who can effectively undertake a diverse range of responsibilities to ensure the successful execution of projects and the delivery of client and subconsultant deliverables. The ideal candidate will be adept at confidently handling tasks similar in nature to the followingResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Management: Lead and manage all phases of project delivery, from initial schematic design through construction support and project closeout.  Collaborate with and lead multi-disciplinary design teams to establish project goals, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop and execute project plans, budgets, and schedules.  Monitor project progress and identify and mitigate risks.  Oversee and manage the QA/QC processes related to project submissions.  Ensure the delivery of high-quality projects within scope and budget constraints. Client Engagement And Relationship Building Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with industrial clients, serving as the main point of contact.  Lead project meetings with team members and clients.  Understand client needs and objectives and align project strategies accordingly.  Communicate project progress, issues, and solutions effectively to clients.  Identify opportunities for additional services and client satisfaction. Financial Management Oversee project budgeting, cost tracking, and financial performance.  Review and approve change orders, amendments, and project expenditures.  Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and billing to clients. Team Collaboration And Leadership Foster a positive workplace culture within the Industrial Group.  Collaborate with project teams and provide leadership and guidance.  Mentor and develop junior staff members.  Contribute to the development of best practices and process improvements. Strategic Planning And Business Development Assist in developing business strategies and identifying growth opportunities.  Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends and potential clients.  Collaborate with leadership to create and execute business development initiatives. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in project management, engineering, or a related field.  At least 7 years of experience in engineering design, project management, construction management, or a combination of relevant experience.  Understanding of complex projects integrating architecture, structural, civil, mechanical, and electrical disciplines.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word and Excel.  Strong organizational and time management skills.  Excellent leadership and communication skills.  Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with team members, clients, and subconsultants. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in project management within the industrial sector.  Strong understanding of project finance and budgeting.  Proficiency in project management software and tools.  PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Benefits Benefits provided by KPFF include:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays  10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service.  10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members.  Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year.  Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust  and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.AboutWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: The Position Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Boise and the Treasure Valley over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who is dynamic – there’s nothing wrong with technical savvy, but technical can be trained. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day In The Life Might Include Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Idaho PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience
description: Position SummaryStructural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience DescriptionKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills  Minimum Qualifications   BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete  Steel or Wood Design  At least one year of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required   Preferred Qualifications   3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2348Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer
description: KPFF Portland Structural is looking for Entry-Level Structural Engineers (0-3 years) who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about the freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a diverse spectrum of projects in locations around the globe: from mass timber buildings to complex, non-linear analyses of high-rise structures. We have all the benefits of a large, stable company but operate day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we are all about.We are a group of dedicated, friendly and hard-working engineers looking for exceptional engineers to join us. At KPFF you will be trusted to work individually and collaboratively in the design and construction process with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, support staff, and client teams for a wide array of intriguing projects.Our current projects include:AirportsArenas + StadiumsLong-Span StructuresBridgesGovernment FacilitiesCommercial DevelopmentsHigh-Rise StructuresMixed-Use DevelopmentsCorporate CampusesHealthcare + Medical FacilitiesEducation Facilities (K-12 & Higher Ed)Museum + Convention Centers In addition to being creative, proactive, and detail-oriented, the preferred candidate will have:MS or MEng degree (preferred)Strong verbal and written communication skills.To be considered, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave, and other benefits. U.S. work authorization required, we do not sponsor. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Structural Design Intern--Summer 2024
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including preliminary design reports, full project management, project budgeting, permitting coordination, and sub-consultant management. We act on behalf of the owner to ensure a smooth start, guided process, and successful project completion. Weexcel at creative engineering and incorporating design sustainability into projects by helping our clients make "green" choices. We have been in business since 1960 and have an excellent reputation, a great team and flexible working environment. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.Position DescriptionAs a structural engineering intern in our Orange County office, you will get the opportunity to gain some real world engineering experience on a wide range of project types and sizes and to learn skills to help take your future career where you want it to go. You will also get to work with some amazing people and learn from other engineers with a deep and diverse skill set while being actively engaged in a fun, collaborative office environment.Minimum Position Qualifications At least 3 years progress towards Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering with Structural emphasis or equivalent. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to function well in a team environment. E.I.T. certificate or previous intern experience preferred. Successful completion of classes in steel design, concrete design and structural analysis required. Classes in wood design and/or masonry design preferred. Familiarity with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California. Familiarity with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, RISA-3D, SAFE, Microsoft Office).

title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (Entry Level - 2 yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. title: Modeling/Drafting - Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 22 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers and drafters.Learn more about our company at our website: www.kpff.comJob DescriptionWe are seeking motivated Civil CAD Designers with AutoCAD Civil 3D experience, preferably in site development, to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to use your experience to play a key role in the production of civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D. You will collaborate with our team of engineers, drafters, and surveyors, guided by a Project Manager and with the support of other team members. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, who have effective technical and communication skills to work with internal teams and clients. You’ll collaborate with internal team members and be responsible for the overall presentation and drawing appearance.Our typical scope of services includes preparing civil engineering plans and technical specifications, grading plans, drainage plans, storm water quality design, sustainable design, utility improvements, roadway infrastructure design, and ADA code compliance assessments.As a Civil CAD Designer, you may be responsible for: Creating civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D  3D Modeling of civil engineering design for grading and utilities  Applying established CAD standards  Preparing and editing plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Maintaining organization of project drawing files  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Opportunity to train other team members in AutoCAD and Civil 3D Minimum Qualifications 3 years of relevant CAD experience, preferably in site development.  Good communication skills, and ability to function effectively in a team environment.  Basic knowledge of industry CAD standards and civil engineering plans.  Effective time management skills and the ability to concurrently manage multiple priorities.  Associate’s Degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting (CAD), or similar field.  Working knowledge of typical computer software programs used for civil engineering design (AutoCAD, Civil3D, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, etc.).  Willingness to mentor entry-level engineers, drafters and interns in AutoCAD.  Experience creating or modifying AutoCAD styles and LISP routines a plus. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical Insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Dental Insurance – with a no-premium option  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Comp Time Program  Flexible Working Hours  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Louisville
description: Description Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Louisville Reports To: Team Leader - Josh Bullington, Josh White or Visnja Davidovic Reporting Center:  Louisville, KY Position Location(s):  Louisville, KY Status:  Full-Time Summer Position (Temporary) Classification:  Non-Exempt Travel Required:  N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. Incorporating our interns into an actual production schedule creates an environment where everyone, from principals to project engineers, are ready to share their professional experience and work together as a team. Job responsibilities vary by group and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates  Learn modeling software, Revit  Generate Construction Documents  Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards  Any and all other duties assigned by your Team Leader Qualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university -AND- with a structural engineering focus  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred  Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members  Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design  Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English  Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material  OUR TEAM MEMBERS Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Indianapolis office is located in the heart of downtown, right on Monument Circle, and close to many fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Civil CAD Technician
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. We offer a non-bureaucratic environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, outstanding coworkers, and competitive pay and benefits. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the projects we work on and who we are as people:Our Civil Engineering team in Boise is seeking full-time Civil Drafters and CAD Technicians to support our group. We are looking for team members that will be responsible for supporting multiple projects and teams by creating, managing, updating, and maintaining a variety of drawings, with an eye for presentation and attention to detail. We want team members that are excited and interested in making a difference in the world and communities we live and work in, are effective communicators, and enjoy working on a team and with different people. Bring your attention to detail, enthusiasm, and creative skills to KPFF to make a difference to our team and projects.Responsibilities Creation of project drawings and exhibit deliverables  Applying established company, jurisdiction, and/or project CAD standards  Maintain organization of project drawing files  Prepare and edit plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Plotting and scanning of drawings  Complete drawings and project responsibilities within anticipated timeline  Attributes:  The ability to work both independently and as part of a team  Self-motivated, hardworking, dependable employee  Be detail oriented, organized and have good follow-through skills  Develop excellent working relationships with team members  Minimum Qualifications  0 – 2 years’ experience or completion of a CAD technical education program  Proficiency in AutoCAD and/or Microstation  Basic knowledge of Civil 3D, InRoads, and/or OpenRoads a plus  Our Company KPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to public agencies, architects, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?
description: DescriptionJoin a Structural Engineering Firm that Puts People First.Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits. Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Super Keeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Greater Indianapolis Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Indianapolis office who desires to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Indiana and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat.Why KPFF?KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,400+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “ Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”.Why you will LOVE KPFF GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications More than 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in IN or nearby surrounding states  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion Office EnvironmentWe are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our Firm ProfileKPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “ forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. The firm encourages innovation and continuous quality improvement in our work that is unencumbered by bureaucratic behavior.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity EmployerLearn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our website at

title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 3 students for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Portland, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for people who want to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to inclusion and diversity in the workplace.

title: Survey - Land Surveyor - 0-3 Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionEntry Level Land SurveyorThe Civil Division of KPFF Los Angeles is actively hiring for the position of Entry Level Land Surveyor. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to work in the field learning and utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks Job DescriptionKPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth in a learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and multiple projects at once. This fast paced environment will provide opportunity to work with our staff of surveyors and engineers on designs that will include grading, utility, roadway, and drainage design requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate very effectively. Surveyors will have the opportunity to work in many unique and challenging environments.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering and surveying services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth from within a constantly learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and several projects at once. It’s a fast paced environment that will provide opportunity to work with our staff of civil engineers, structural engineers, and in-house surveyors on small and large design projects requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively. Our survey teams work directly with clients on a wide range of projects and are often viewed as the face of the company. This position provides opportunities to work in many unique and challenging environments. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Structural Investigator
description: DescriptionKPFF Consulting Engineers provides engineering services to private and public clients worldwide and is seeking a motivated person to provide structural investigation, material testing and special inspection services. Investigations, material testing and inspections services are complementary to KPFF's core structural engineering services and involve the use of a variety of technical equipment. You will work with a team of other structural investigators and structural engineers to provide structural investigative services on Kpff projects.Desired QualificationsThe ideal candidate will possess sufficient education and/or experience to seamlessly collaborate with KPFF's engineering staff to investigate structural systems, provide inspections, and immediately support as many of the job responsibilities listed as possible. Because this list is broad, KPFF will provide additional future training as needed.Minimum Qualifications Ability to read and understand construction plans and specifications.  Ability to understand and comply with safety standards and building codes.  Must possess a valid Oregon Driver’s License and have an acceptable driving record.  Must be able to pass a Federal background check.  High school diploma or GED plus a minimum of three (3) current special inspection qualifications (ICC or WABO) and two (2) years of special inspection experience. -OR-Associates Degree in an engineering-related field plus two (2) years of experience in engineering and/or construction inspection or EIT certification.-OR-Bachelor's Degree in science or engineering plus one year of experience in engineering or construction inspection. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Job Conditions & Physical Requirements Frequently outdoors and construction site visits in all weather conditions.  Work schedules are variable and may be project dependent.  Some work may be above ground, using elevated platforms, or in confined spaces.  Frequent lifting, walking on rough terrain, stooping, and bending is required.  Must be able to lift 30 pounds.  Work may involve occasional travel. Structural Investigation Responsibilities Conduct as-built structural surveys to map out existing structures.  Conduct steel corrosion surveys.  Collaborate with structural engineers to evaluate structural damage to existing structures.  Provide resistograph investigation of wood structures.  Utilize ground penetrating radar (GPR) to investigate reinforcing concrete, post-tensioned concrete and masonry.  Load test assemblies and components using hydraulics and load cells.  Work with state of the art software to document investigation results.  Utilize Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) to investigate concrete and steel components. Special Inspection Responsibilities Provide special inspections of structural steel construction, reinforced concrete construction, post-tensioned concrete construction, structural masonry construction, structural wood framing, proprietary anchor installations, and seismic anchorage of mechanical and electrical components.  Provide NDT of welds including magnetic particle, penetrant, and ultrasonic test methods.  Provide ASTM tests related to each field of special inspection.  AWS certified weld inspection. Compensation & BenefitsKPFF offers competitive salary and a generous benefits package. Please submit your resume through this website. No phone inquiries, please. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Structural CAD/Drafter Technician
description: Description Structural CAD/Drafter Technician Role OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are actively looking for a meticulous and highly motivated Structural CAD/Drafter Technician to join our Bridge/and Marine Transit Consulting Group (MTCG) groups in our downtown Seattle location. You will play a pivotal role in our team, contributing to the creation of comprehensive construction documents utilizing CAD software in adherence to diverse agency standards. You will demonstrate a keen ability to interpret and translate complex structural and civil layouts, sections, and intricate details from initial rough sketches. Collaborating seamlessly with multiple engineering disciplines, you will actively participate in both small and large-scale projects, drawing on their expertise in general engineering design and construction, with a specific focus on Bridge and Marine structures. The role necessitates efficient task planning and prioritization, ensuring the timely and successful management of intricate, deadline-driven projects. Exceptional verbal and interpersonal communication skills are crucial for fostering a cohesive team environment. Proficiency in AutoCAD is a must, while experience with MicroStationV8i is highly desirable, underscoring the adaptability to various CAD software platforms.Responsibilities Utilize CAD software to develop comprehensive and accurate construction documents in compliance with relevant agency standards. Interpret and translate preliminary sketches into detailed structural Bridge and Marine layouts, sections, and specific project details. Coordinate and collaborate effectively with various engineering disciplines, contributing to the seamless execution of both small and large-scale projects. Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of general engineering design and construction principles, with a specialized focus on Bridge and Waterfront Marine structures. Efficiently manage and prioritize tasks, ensuring the timely completion of complex projects within strict deadlines. Cultivate and maintain strong verbal and interpersonal communication skills to facilitate seamless collaboration within the team and with external stakeholders.Qualifications Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a CAD Operator with proficiency in AutoCAD. Knowledgeable with MicroStation V8i is greatly desired. Experience with Project Wise, SharePoint, and C3D is a plus. CAD certification in Engineering/Construction technology or equivalent experience and training is desired.BenefitsBenefits provided by KPFF include: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions Medical insurance Dental insurance, with a no-premium option Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option Dependent care FSA option Employee Assistance Program Group life insurance Short-term disability insurance Long-term disability insurance Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays 10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service. 10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members. Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year. Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave Travel accident insurance Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Survey - Project Surveyor
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs a talented Project Surveyor. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East.Where We Stand Out We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more.  Opportunities to work on a wide variety of project types in unique and challenging environments.  Lifelong learning is emphasized to ensure we continue to deliver the highest quality of work for our clients.  Specialized training programs and technical seminars unite people in small groups to advance individual skillsets and delve further into navigating a successful career.  Utilization of cutting edge technology and the latest tools and equipment. Responsibilities Calculates and analyzes field boundary data, assists field survey crews on complex survey engagements, performs survey research.  Preparation of various survey deliverables such as ALTA’s, Subdivision Maps, Legal Descriptions, Construction Staking Calculations, and Condominium Plans.  Provide support to various Project Managers within the firm, provide coordination and support to the field crews, and work closely with Clients.  Deliver projects on time and within budget. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and give direction to field crews for completion of survey tasks  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. Our scope includes construction staking, ALTA land title surveys, boundary, topographic and aerial surveys, Condominium Plans, Vertical Airspace Maps, Parcel Maps, Tract Maps, legal descriptions and laser scanning services. Our team provides high quality surveying solutions to engineers, developers, architects, contractors, individuals, title companies, mortgage companies and public agencies.KPFF provides surveying, civil and structural engineering to architects, public agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has 25 offices across the US.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please apply via our website https://www.kpff.com/job-details/395/.

title: Structural Engineering Project Manager
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:We are looking for experienced structural engineers to partner with us to build our growing team. Our ideal candidate is collaborative, ambitious, smart, and entrepreneurial, with the drive to be a leader within our practice and the industry. A Day in the Life Might Include...  Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Protective Design Engineer - PDX (Entry Level - 2 yrs)

title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Eugene Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 1 student for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Eugene, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for someone who wants to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to inclusion and diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering-Structural 5+ Yrs. (Special Projects)
description: DescriptionStructural Engineer – KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time STRUCTURAL ENGINEER.The offices of KPFF’s Special Projects Group are seeking qualified Structural Engineers that are ready to take their career to the next level. The successful candidate(s) will have the opportunity to be directly involved in a wide variety of challenging projects including port developments, marine engineering, ferry terminals, shipyards, fish & wildlife facilities, naval facilities, small boat marinas, municipal structures, floating structures, and design-build infrastructure. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.Structural Engineers within KPFF’s Special Projects Group enjoy the freedom of being the prime consultant on most of our projects. We use a holistic approach to project management that requires you as the Structural Engineer to not just provide structural engineering services, but to SOLVE your client’s PROBLEM. This approach puts you in the role of project manager and allows you to see the big picture on every project. This is a rewarding and enjoyable place to be, giving you direct access to the client and owner.Ideal Qualifications Include BS in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  MS in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  PE is required, SE preferred  Concrete, steel, and timber design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic design experience  Familiarity with performance-based seismic design, non-linear push-over analysis, and soil-structure interaction analysis  Knowledge of ASCE 61-14, AASHTO, IBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI, and NDS  Proficiency in SAP2000, L-Pile, MS Excel, and VBA is preferred  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  An interest in working on a wide variety of non-building related project types KPFF's Special Projects Structural Group, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group in the Pacific Northwest and Long Beach California that provides project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Engineering - Civil Transportation Engineer 4+ Years
description: Description Civil Transportation Engineer 4+ Yrs. Exp.   –   KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time Civil Transportation Engineer (InRoads/OpenRoads) in our Seattle or Tacoma office. KPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil roadway engineer in our Seattle or Tacoma office. We are seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence and experience delivering roadway and transportation improvements on design-build projects. This position will provide the opportunity to work with a variety of clients and contractors delivering diverse public works infrastructure projects including fish passages and major transportation improvements.Additional project work could include heavy civil, waterfront site improvements, stormwater improvements and natural resource improvements throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.Key Responsibilities (or) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Produce civil design plans and specifications for roadway projects including: roadway alignment and profiles, sections, grading and paving, stormwater, wet utility plans, signing/striping and maintenance of traffic  Create and model roadway plans/profiles/sections using MicroStation and InRoads  Provide construction support and provide guidance to support consultants including geotechnical, electrical/comm. and ITS.  Conduct site visits and assist with documenting findings  Prepare project proposals, interface and coordinate with clients  Work independently and occasionally co-locate with Contractors to accomplish design work  Ability and proficiency to lead a team of engineers and drafters to achieve common goals and schedules as a key member of a collaborative team  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team of engineers  Willingness to work on a variety of projects  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members Example Of Projects Design-Build Transportation Infrastructure  Road and Highway Design  Fish Passage/Culvert Replacement Projects  Railway Infrastructure  Ports and Industrial Site Developments  Industrial Stormwater Treatment Basic Qualifications Minimum of 4 years of civil design experience with a PE in the State of Washington or ability to get reciprocity  B.S. in Civil Engineering  Advanced MicroStation, InRoads, and OpenRoads design experience is required.  ArcGIS, AutoCAD, Civil3D and other engineering design software proficiency is a plus  Proficient in MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint  Strong knowledge of construction means, methods and techniques  Experience and ability to prepare roadway/transportation design documents and specifications is required  Additional experience on waterfront and industrial site infrastructure is desirable.  Familiarity with WSDOT Standard Plans and Standard Specifications and Design Manual With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineer - Design Engineer 3-4 Years Experience
description: Position SummaryStructural Engineer - Design Engineer 3-4 Years Experience DescriptionKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who receive their CA PE or SE while working at LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! title: Survey - Survey Crew Chief
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs an experienced, licensed Survey Project Manager. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF Consulting Engineers supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East. Where We Stand Out  We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more.  Opportunities to work on a wide variety of project types in unique and challenging environments.  Lifelong learning is emphasized to ensure we continue to deliver the highest quality of work for our clients.  Specialized training programs and technical seminars unite people in small groups to advance individual skillsets and delve further into navigating a successful career.  Utilization of cutting-edge technology and the latest tools and equipment. Responsibilities Under limited supervision - organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects for public and private clients.  Calculates and records field data and leads survey crew on complex survey engagements.  Proficiently performs training, data collection, and quality checks for survey field work.  Organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to work in the field utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. Our scope includes construction staking, ALTA land title surveys, boundary, topographic and aerial surveys, Condominium Plans, Vertical Airspace Maps, Parcel Maps, Tract Maps, legal descriptions and laser scanning services. Our team provides high quality surveying solutions to engineers, developers, architects, contractors, individuals, title companies, mortgage companies and public agencies.KPFF provides surveying, civil and structural engineering to architects, public agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has 25 offices across the US.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
