title: Roadway/Civil Engineer (2-6 years) for Transportation Group
description: DescriptionROADWAY/CIVIL ENGINEER 2-6 YEARSAboutKPFF has been an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering for over 60 years, working with public agencies architects, developers, and contractors. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:KPFF’s Washington Division is located Downtown Seattle. Our Transportation team is seeking a Roadway/Civil Engineer with a minimum 2 years of experience designing civil engineering projects. This position will provide the opportunity for you to design a diverse array of projects in a team environment and: Collaborate with multidiscipline teams while developing project management capabilities  Work on stimulating and challenging multi-disciplinary projects, from planning through design and construction  Engage with clients  Build our business in Washington State We are passionate about developing great engineers and project managers and do so by offering a variety of opportunities and experiences, along with informal mentoring. Join us and become part of a team that works on transformative projects with exceptional public and private sector clients.Minimum Qualifications 2 years’ experience with civil engineering projects (site development and/or transportation)  Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering (BSCE)  Engineer-In-Training (EIT) Certification or Professional Engineering (PE) Registration  Working proficiency in AutoCAD and Civil 3D, Bonus Points for MicroStation and OpenRoads (InRoads, GEOPAK)  Excellent written and verbal communication  Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment  Passionate about providing exceptional client service BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical insurance  Dental insurance – with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Civil Engineering Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Civil Engineering Internship – 2024 We are on the search for three incredible people to join us for our Summer Internship program. Our standard summer internships run from May to August or June to September, depending on your school schedule. We are looking for students who want to be challenged, are ready to join a team, and dive into project work, problem solve and ask questions. Our teams of PE’s, EIT’s and Civil Designers are happy to show you the ropes and get you up to speed on Civil3D, which you will be using from day one. You will have opportunities to design, produce plans, research, and go on site visits. Additionally, you will have access to our monthly KPFF-U continuing education presentations, vendor lunch and learns, and our Intern training program.Our offices operate on a hybrid schedule with an expectation of 3 days a week in-office and the flexibility to work from home 2 days, but you are welcome to work in the office every day.Qualifications Currently enrolled in a BSCE program and at a junior or senior level with a focus in civil engineering Available for the entire 3-month duration Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective written and verbal communication Able to work effectively in a team environment and on an individual basis Strong organizational and time management abilitiesCompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in mid-January to schedule interviews, with the goal of finalizing internship decisions by the end of February. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.  All applications must be completed through this on-line process. [No phone inquiries, please]  KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering-Structural-3+ Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionKPFF Portland Structural is looking for experienced structural engineers who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a diverse spectrum of projects in locations around the globe: from mass timber buildings to complex, non-linear analysis of high rise structures. We have all the benefits of a large, stable company but operate day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we are all about.We are a group of dedicated, friendly and hard-working engineers looking for exceptional engineers to join us. At KPFF you will be trusted to work independently as well as collaboratively in the design and construction process with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors and client teams for a wide array of intriguing projects.Our Current Projects Include Airports  Arenas + Stadiums  Long-Span Structures  Bridges  Government Facilities  Commercial Developments  High-Rise Structures  Mixed-Use Developments  Corporate Campuses  Healthcare + Medical Facilities  Education Facilities (K-12 & Higher Ed)  Museum + Convention Centers In addition to being creative, proactive and detail-oriented, the preferred candidate will have: 3-8 years of structural engineering experience  PE and MS or MEng degree (preferred)  Strong verbal and written communication skills KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Civil 3-5 Yrs. Exp
description: Description Civil Engineer –   KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time CIVIL ENGINEER with 3-5 years’ experience in our Seattle office. KPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil engineer in our Seattle office. We are a team of 20+ individuals seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work leans toward heavy civil, design-build transportation, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.Key Responsibilities (or) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Produce design and construction drawings incorporating information from project lead, research data and consultants for various projects including land development grading, utility, drainage, paving plans, etc.  Construction support, cost estimating, geotechnical coordination  Research materials and assemblies for design and construction drawings  Conduct site visits and assist with documenting findings  Interface and coordinate with clients  Perform analysis of Storm, water, and sewer systems  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team of engineers  Willingness to work on a variety of projects  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members Example Of Projects Ports  Dredging, Environmental Cleanup, and Marine Habitat Mitigation sites  Industrial Site Developments  Ferry Terminals  Shipyards  Industrial Stormwater Treatment  Fisheries Engineering  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Airports and Fixed Base Operator Developments  Design-Build Transportation Infrastructure Basic Qualifications Minimum of 3-5 years of civil design experience  B.S. in Civil Engineering  Advanced AutoCAD Civil 3D  ArcGIS, MicroStation and other engineering design software proficiency is a plus  Proficient in MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint  Strong knowledge of construction means, methods and techniques  Ability to prepare civil engineering documents for projects  Ability to read redlines and modify drawings accurately  Ability to work independently and in a team environment  Design experience related to civil infrastructure is required. Additional experience on waterfront and industrial site infrastructure is desirable About UsKPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil engineer in our Seattle office. We are a team of 20+ individuals seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work leans toward heavy civil, design-build transportation, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.Benefits / CompensationBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office, access to light rail within building) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.

title: Civil Project Manager
description: DescriptionCivil Project ManagerJob DescriptionWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!You will work within a fun, dynamic, and diverse team to produce deliverables for clients who represent a wide variety of industries. You will have the opportunity to manage projects from the beginning planning stages through construction documents, and support clients during design and construction. Project types vary from site development to utility infrastructure to regional stormwater facilities in the Pacific Northwest and beyond.The option for a hybrid work from home/office environment provides the best of both worlds. Our welcoming and newly renovated office offers collaboration space where you can brainstorm with your team and mentors, an individual workspace where you can dive deep into your design, and large kitchens where you can escape for some lively lunchtime conversation. Two years in a pandemic taught us the value of a flexible work environment and the importance of our time together. We will work with you to establish a home/office balance that addresses your individual scheduling needs. Use your KPFF subsidized ORCA pass to have light rail deliver you directly to our building, or for a sustainable Metro bus commute to our downtown office. To incorporate some exercise into your commute, join the many cyclists in our office and take advantage of bicycle storage and lockers on each floor.In your resume and/or cover letter please indicate how and where you obtained the qualifications we have outlined below. We look forward to getting to know you!Qualifications And Skills Bachelor’s Degree in civil (preferred) or environmental engineering.  Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certification.  Washington State Professional Engineer (PE) license in civil engineering (preferred).  5+ years of experience working under the supervision of a licensed professional civil engineer  Ability and experience to effectively lead and motivate a team to deliver projects  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Desire and ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Working knowledge of AutoCAD and Civil 3D.  Coursework and/or familiarity with stormwater hydrology modeling (preferred). Responsibilities And DutiesAlongside, and with the supervision of a principal and/or associate, you will: Manage and lead the technical and/or logistical elements of a project.  Engage with clients, contractors, and design team members to coordinate and facilitate effective design solutions.  Travel to project sites to observe existing conditions and construction activities.  Review and support team members with jurisdictional code and manual research to confirm design requirements.  Drive and present sustainable civil engineering solutions.  Perform and/or review calculations to support the design of stormwater conveyance, water quality, flow control, and green stormwater systems.  Perform and/or review vehicular turning studies using software such as AutoTurn.  Prepare and/or review project specifications for your project design work.  Prepare and/or present design reports and give design presentations.  Prepare and/or review drainage reports and feasibility studies.  Work with design and project engineers, and CAD staff to develop permit and construction plans that may include erosion control, site demolition, stormwater facility design, site utility design, pavement design, and site grading.  Help train and develop interns, design engineers, and project engineers.  Prepare proposals and scopes of work.  Develop relationships with clients and design team members. Salary And Benefits $87,500+ salary  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Engineering - Civil Transportation Engineer - 4+ Yrs. Exp.
description: Description KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time Civil Transportation Engineer (InRoads/OpenRoads) in our Seattle or Tacoma office. KPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil roadway engineer in our Seattle or Tacoma office. We are seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence and experience delivering roadway and transportation improvements on design-build projects. This position will provide the opportunity to work with a variety of clients and contractors delivering diverse public works infrastructure projects including fish passages and major transportation improvements.Additional project work could include heavy civil, waterfront site improvements, stormwater improvements and natural resource improvements throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.Key Responsibilities (or) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Produce civil design plans and specifications for roadway projects including: roadway alignment and profiles, sections, grading and paving, stormwater, wet utility plans, signing/striping and maintenance of traffic  Create and model roadway plans/profiles/sections using MicroStation and InRoads  Provide construction support and provide guidance to support consultants including geotechnical, electrical/comm. and ITS.  Conduct site visits and assist with documenting findings  Prepare project proposals, interface and coordinate with clients  Work independently and occasionally co-locate with Contractors to accomplish design work  Ability and proficiency to lead a team of engineers and drafters to achieve common goals and schedules as a key member of a collaborative team  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team of engineers  Willingness to work on a variety of projects  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members Example Of Projects Design-Build Transportation Infrastructure  Road and Highway Design  Fish Passage/Culvert Replacement Projects  Railway Infrastructure  Ports and Industrial Site Developments  Industrial Stormwater Treatment Basic Qualifications Minimum of 4 years of civil design experience with a PE in the State of Washington or ability to get reciprocity  B.S. in Civil Engineering  Advanced MicroStation, InRoads, and OpenRoads design experience is required.  ArcGIS, AutoCAD, Civil3D and other engineering design software proficiency is a plus  Proficient in MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint  Strong knowledge of construction means, methods and techniques  Experience and ability to prepare roadway/transportation design documents and specifications is required  Additional experience on waterfront and industrial site infrastructure is desirable.  Familiarity with WSDOT Standard Plans and Standard Specifications and Design Manual With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF .KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Engineering-Structural-1-5 Yrs Experience-TX
description: Engineering-Structural-1-5 Yrs Experience-TX DescriptionThe KPFF San Diego office is accepting applications for talented structural engineers in our new Austin, TX office. As a valued employee, you will be fully supported by our West Coast and Texas teams with the option of a hybrid work schedule.Minimum Qualifications BS Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  1 year full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  Understanding of structural engineering mechanics and behaviors Highly Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree in Structural Engineering, or Civil/Architectural Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  PE Licensure In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome  Who has most influenced you and why? If you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume and references (2-3). If you are a recent graduate, please also attach your transcript. Qualified applicants only.Company OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, contractors, and industry innovators to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with passion, integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF offers a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive, well-rounded benefits package that includes 401k matching, flex time and paid family leave.www.kpff.com

title: Construction Project Manager 5+ yrs Exp.
description: Description Job Title Construction Project Manager (Special Projects - Seattle) Added 2023 Salary Range $82,800-$144,000 Reporting Center Special Projects City Seattle, WACompanyKPFF Consulting EngineersJob Description Construction Project Manager (Special Projects - Seattle)  Construction Project Manager –  KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking an experienced CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER in our Seattle office. KPFF Special Projects currently has Construction Manager position available in its Seattle office for interested and qualified candidates with a degree in Construction Management, Architecture, Engineering or similar. We are looking for ambitious, experienced and independent thinkers who are eager to practice construction and project management and who are motivated to provide exceptional client service.Position Requirements Bachelors Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture or similar  Demonstrated past experience in a Construction Project Management position  Ability to work in team environment including co-location on client work sites  Willingness to pursue and complete a variety of project types and sizes  Demonstrated ability to work dynamically and independently with clients and project team members KPFF's Special Projects Seattle office, located in the retail core of downtown Seattle, WA, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group that provides construction project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,300 employees nationwide, KPFF  is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust  and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, paid family leave, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide a 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law. Min. Experience -  5 yrs of Construction Project Management or similar Min. Education -  Bachelor's Degree Job Type -  Permanent

title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
description: DescriptionOne of the largest national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering services. Our projects range in size and scope, and we are always striving to grow our presence in our communities.The Orange County office is looking for structural engineers who are eager to start their careers in structural engineering. We give many opportunities to young engineers to experience firsthand the many facets of structural engineering while working alongside seasoned professionals in a collaborative environment.Desired Education And Experience B.S. degree in Civil/Structural Engineering from an accredited university, M.S. degree with a specialty in Structural Engineering preferred  E.I.T. certification preferred  0-2 years of experience in building design Ideal Candidate Desires to develop a breadth and depth of knowledge in the field  Communicates clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing  Excels in collaborative environments  Is familiar with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of building projects located in California  Is familiar with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RISA-3D, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, SAFE, SP Concrete Design) Structural Engineer Responsibilities Prepare calculations and construction documents under the supervision of the Project Manager  Perform construction administration services under the supervision of the Project Manager  Interface with clients on project specific issues  Quality control of technical content  Grow in technical knowledge through attendance of in-house education opportunities

title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level Design Engineer
description: DescriptionPosition SummaryKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills Minimum Qualifications BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete, Steel, or Wood Design  No full-time work experience is required Preferred Qualifications  3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures is preferred  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role is preferred  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2349Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. A cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering-Civil-Entry-Level (SF)
description: DescriptionAre you just out of school, or about to graduate? Our talented crew of civil engineers is looking for new team members!What Makes KPFF SF An Awesome Place To Work Work amongst a diverse team doing ACTUAL design work on some of the most challenging projects in the region  Comprehensive mentorship from smart, enthusiastic, experienced engineers  Generous benefits, a competitive salary and pay for every hour you work  Interaction with clients and our design and construction partners  A Fun and Wellness committee who organize great social activities, involve us in the community and encourages a healthy lifestyle  Multi-disciplinary office in downtown San Francisco with a killer view  forefront lifelong career support providing technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement  Resources and support of national 1,200+ person firm founded in 1960 Some of the things you might do in collaboration with other experienced engineers: Prepare site development construction drawings  Analyze of water, sewer, and storm drain systems  Review permit applications associated with a variety of project types  Design of bioswales, flow-through planters, and other stormwater treatment facilities to meet and exceed local stormwater quality requirements  Assist project team in design of rainwater reuse systems and LEED credit documentation  Research/data collection from public agencies and local municipalities  Geometric roadway design and site layout  Preparation of project specifications  Design of site grading and utility systems from master planning through construction  Communicate with design consultants and contractors in a design-build environment  Attend site visits to review construction of civil site improvements What You Bring To The Table Degree in Civil Engineering  Prior civil engineering internships a plus  Experience in or passion for AutoCAD Civil 3D  A desire to part of a smart and fun team who really like what they do Our supportive and fun work environment allows for work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF has more than 1,200 team members, 20 offices and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.KPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers designing innovative solutions for private and public projects of all types and scales. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized and our commitment to our clients and employees. Firm wide KPFF has been in business since 1960, growing from a single office in Seattle to become a nationally recognized firm.Learn More About UsKPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Strong technical and organizational abilities. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. title: Structural Engineer Entry-Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Want to start your career at an engineering firm with diverse projects, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture? Consider KPFF! We are a national civil and structural firm designing some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front.We are looking for an entry-level structural engineer who enjoys working with teams to accomplish big goals. You’ll be a valued member of our team with training and development opportunities to grow your skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who doesn’t just have the technical skills to succeed, but also has the communication skills (listening, empathy, conveying ideas concisely) to work with internal teams and clients.A Day in the Life Might Include… Creating structural drawings supported by a calculation package  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Referring to applicable building codes for appropriate loads, analysis procedures, and requirements  Discussing the best load path for a safe and efficient building design with your project team  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Supporting a project manager to prepare, allocate, and track a project workplan and budget  Collaborating with architects, contractors, and others on your design team to solve problems and deliver a successful project Qualifications Strong communication skills  Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  EIT Certification  Previous internship experience is preferred Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce

title: Bridge Engineer (0-4 years)
description: DescriptionBRIDGE ENGINEER (0-4 YEARS)DescriptionKPFF’s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Entry-Level Structural Engineers to join the Bridge/Heavy-Civil group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from a career at KPFF:The Bridge/Heavy-Civil Team consists of structural engineers working in a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil design fields such as highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves. We pride ourselves on our collaborative approach to consulting, working with clients from all across the industry, including small local agencies, transportation departments, architects, and contractors. At KPFF there is always something new to learn and endless opportunities to innovate.Our core values at KPFF are Stability, Trust, Excellence, Relationships, and Passion. We are dedicated to helping every individual grow as a professional by working closely together on challenging and exciting projects. This position will allow you to participate in the engineering design and management of a wide range of transportation projects while working with a variety of public and private sector clients.TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES May Include The Following Perform design and inspection/field work that does not require previous experience.  Perform structural analysis and prepare design sketches. Project types could include new structures, structural rehabilitations of existing structures, and/or seismic analysis and design.  Assist in the preparation of plans, specification, cost estimates, or reports for new construction and/or evaluation of existing structures.  Instructs draftspersons on design drawings.  Participate in technical and project discussions within the design team.  Keeps Project Managers informed of workload and changes to project scope/efforts.  As your experience grows, you will also begin taking part in project management tasks, such as monitoring budgets and schedules, interacting with clients, and leading junior engineers. KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Minimum Qualifications BSCE with emphasis in Structural Engineering  0-4 years of experience Preferred Qualifications MSCE or MSE with emphasis in Structural Engineering  EIT  Strong communicator and collaborator  Self-motivated  Eager to develop and grow as a structural engineer  Passionate about providing exceptional client services  Strong technical and organizational abilities BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical insurance  Dental insurance – with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive, well-rounded benefits package that includes 401k matching, flex time and paid family leave.www.kpff.com

title: Engineering-Civil Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionCivil Engineering InternshipKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are ready to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. Job responsibilities vary by groups, and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.KPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic civil interns. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. We typically hire interns during the summer, and begin reviewing resumes during the spring. Internship opportunities also arise during other times of the year, in which case we will review all applications. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire Civil interns who are Juniors or above, including students pursuing their master’s degree.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and document potential scope of work  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to learn and apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Construction / Project Management Internship
description: Description Construction Project Management – Internship (Special Projects)  Construction Project Management Intern  – KPFF Special Projects may be seeking a full-time CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGEMENT INTERN in our Seattle office.ResponsibilitiesKPFF may be seeking a motivated Junior or Senior level Construction Management, Project Management, Architectural or Engineering student for a summer internship in the Seattle Office of KPFF Special Projects.The Construction Project Management Summer Internship would be approximately 40 hours a week for up to 90 days. Airport terminals and tenant improvements including infrastructure upgrades. Trails and public facility improvements. Roadway upgrades and utility installations. Transit Facilities.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Suite. Experience using BlueBeam Revu. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required. Expectation to function effectively as part of a team. Must demonstrate self-motivation and dependability. Ability to understand and follow directions. Good time management and organizational skills.Education And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors in Construction Management, Project Management, Architecture or Civil Engineering.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. title: Bridge Engineering Internship
description: Description BRIDGE ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP DescriptionKPFF’s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Structural Engineering Interns for the Bridge/ Civil-Structural Group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF:We proudly take part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job—we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are excited to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. We give interns real problems to solve and real designs to complete. Job responsibilities vary by group, and every intern walks away with real engineering experience and a unique story to tell.KPFF typically hires interns during the summer and begins reviewing resumes the fall prior. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire interns at certain levels in their college careers. Structural engineering interns are typically graduating undergraduate seniors or above (with 90+ credits).The Bridge/Civil-Structural Group consists of structural engineers working in on a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil projects such as, highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves. This internship would focus on bridge projects but may include opportunities to work on other types of projects in the group.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Minimum Requirements Current enrollment in a BSCE/MSCE program  Completion of 90+ credits, including two or more design courses (concrete, steel, wood, or masonry), by the start of the 2024 summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong communicator and collaborator  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Ability to work in-person in our downtown Seattle office KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Civil Engineering Internship
description: Description Civil Engineering Internship About UsKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and have been in practice for over 60 years. We work with architects, developers, contractors, and public agencies. Join us to be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the sort of projects we work on and who we are as people:Job DescriptionWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!You will work within a fun, dynamic, and diverse team and will have the opportunity to engage on projects from the beginning planning stages through construction documents, and during construction. Civil engineering project types vary from site development to utility infrastructure to regional stormwater facilities in the Pacific Northwest and beyondOur welcoming and newly renovated Seattle office offers collaboration space where you can brainstorm with your team and mentors, an individual workspace where you can dive deep into your design, and large kitchens where you can escape for lively lunchtime conversation. Use your KPFF subsidized ORCA pass to have light rail deliver you directly to our building, or for a sustainable Metro bus commute to our downtown office. To incorporate some exercise into your commute, join the many cyclists in our office and take advantage of bicycle storage and lockers on each floor.When interning with us, you will go beyond getting a glimpse into your future civil engineering career. We will integrate you into our teams and we are excited to share our professional experience as we work on projects together. You will work on real problems to solve and designs to complete.In your resume and/or cover letter, please indicate how and where you obtained the qualifications we have outlined below. We look forward to getting to know you!Qualifications And Skills Current enrollment in a BSCE program  Completion of junior year by the start of the 2024 Summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Ability to work effectively in a team environment  Strong technical and organizational abilities Responsibilities And Duties Alongside and with the supervision of your teammates, you will:  Travel to project sites to observe existing conditions.  Research jurisdictional codes and manuals to determine design requirements.  Participate in brainstorming sessions about sustainable civil engineering solutions.  Perform calculations to support the design of stormwater conveyance, water quality, flow control, and green stormwater systems.  Perform vehicular turning studies using software such as AutoTurn.  Prepare exhibits for inclusion with reports and/or presentations.  Prepare drafts of drainage reports and feasibility studies.  Work with CAD staff to develop exhibits and progress design plans.  Attend site visits to observe construction of the systems we design. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

We continuosly accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and transcripts (unofficial copies are fine).Job QualificationsIdeally, candidates should have some experience in site development, however more importantly we seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver the highest quality work to our clients.This position requires a B.S. degree or higher and preferably relevant internship experience and Engineer-in-Training (EIT) Certification.Excellent Communication And Teamwork Skills Are Essential.Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and envision potential scope of work requirements.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen.Ability to apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgement, independent decision making, and prolonged focus.Candidates will work on a wide variety of demanding projects with growth opportunities based upon their responsiveness, skills, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Civil Engineer Intern
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with architects, developers, contractors, and public clients to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including Preliminary Design Reports, Full Project Management, Project Budgeting, Permitting Coordination, and Subconsultant Management. We act on behalf of the owner to ensure a smooth start, guided process, and successful project completion, excel at creative engineering, and design sustainability into projects by helping our clients make "green" choices. We have been in business since 1960 and have an excellent reputation, a great team and flexible working environment. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.Job DescriptionCivil Engineering InternWe provide civil engineering services to both private and public sectors. Our clients are mainly Property Owners, Developers, Architects, Contractors, and Public Agencies. Our projects are primarily in the following market sectors: Commercial, Retail, Mixed-Use, Hospitality, Multi-Family Housing, Parks & Recreational Facilities, Health Care, K-12 Schools, Higher Education, Military, Transportation, and Public Agencies.The scope of our services may include site assessment, due diligence, master planning, entitlement, grading & drainage design, hydrology study, storm water quality design, utility improvements, street improvement plans, public utilities, and technical studies for environmental impact reports. In addition we provide project management and prime contract work.We are seeking motivated and energetic Civil Engineering Interns that is seeking to learn more about the civil engineering profession and KPFF. The intern will have opportunities to learn codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California as well as to work with computer software programs, such as AutoCAD, Civil3D, Hydrology, Hydraulic, Flowmaster.Minimum Job Qualifications Currently enrolled and pursuing Bachaler's or Master's degree in civil engineering at accredited university or college and have completed minimum 2 years of engineering coursework. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to function effectively in a teamwork environment. Excellent time management and organizational skills. E.I.T. certificate or previous intern experience preferred. Proficiency with Excel for Windows and Word for Windows and capable of working with AutoCAD, Civil3D, and other engineering software.

title: Civil Designer - Entry-Level *FUTURE OPPORTUNITY*
description: Description KPFF Portland Civil + Survey  Entry-Level Civil Designer (0-4 yrs experience) *FUTURE OPPORTUNITY* If you would like to be considered for an  Entry-Level Civil Designer position in the near futurein our  Portland, OR  office, apply now and your resume/application will remain in our database . A successful candidate will be self-motivated and interested in working in KPFF’s unique entrepreneurial environment, is interested in working on a variety of project types (not pigeon-holed or constrained within a strict, defined box), and wants to be challenged to stretch outside their comfort zone. At KPFF, we believe that engineers should be able to practice with a minimum of organizational restriction. Based on this philosophy, our employees experience the opportunity for growth that is based on their own competency, passion, and commitment.We are passionate about developing great engineers! We'll provide a supportive and positive environment to start your engineering career. We offer generous benefits, competitive salary and pay you for every hour you work.Qualifications BSCE  EIT certification (preferred)  Effective written and verbal communication skills  AutoCAD/Civil 3D experience is highly desirable CompanyThe Portland Civil + Survey office (including satellite offices in Eugene and Washington DC) consists of 100 employees including 35 PEs and 3 PLSs. We champion public transportation by paying 50% of monthly transit passes and providing secured bike parking at no charge. We believe in promoting health – Portland employees have free access to a gym facility with locker rooms and showers in our building and we also offer a free Yoga class on Tuesdays led by a certified trainer. We like to have fun too – join our Summer Co-Ed Softball team, Hood-to-Coast Relay Race Team, annual ALA Stair Climb Team, participate in our annual golf tournament and get involved in numerous volunteer opportunities benefiting our community.Our office has transitioned into a hybrid work environment. The expectation is that employees will work in-office 3 days/week with flexibility to work remotely 2 days.We work on a wide variety of project types, serving public and private clients in land development, transportation, and municipal projects. This includes architectural-led projects for higher ed campuses, sports facilities, schools, medical campuses, and mixed-use housing. In addition, we work on parks, trails, master planning, and include stormwater management and a sustainability focus in everything we do. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. We have a great group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.Founded in Seattle in 1960, KPFF Consulting Engineers is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm in a family-friendly, business casual environment. KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering-Structural-0-3 Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionKPFF Portland Structural is looking for Entry-Level Structural Engineers who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a diverse spectrum of projects in locations around the globe: from mass timber buildings to complex, non-linear analysis of high rise structures. We have all the benefits of a large, stable company but operate day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we are all about.We are a group of dedicated, friendly and hard-working engineers looking for exceptional engineers to join us. At KPFF you will be trusted to work individually and collaboratively in the design and construction process with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, support staff, and client teams for a wide array of intriguing projects.Our Current Projects Include Airports  Arenas + Stadiums  Long-Span Structures  Bridges  Government Facilities  Commercial Developments  High-Rise Structures  Mixed-Use Developments  Corporate Campuses  Healthcare + Medical Facilities  Education Facilities (K-12 & Higher Ed)  Museum + Convention Centers In addition to being creative, proactive and detail-oriented, the preferred candidate will have: Strong verbal and written communication skills.  MS or MEng degree (preferred) Candidates with an undergraduate degree may pursue a master’s degree and receive full tuition reimbursement. KPFF offers a flexible work schedule while pursuing your master’s degree.To be considered, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave and other benefits.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Structural 0-3
description: DescriptionThe Seattle, WA office of KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking qualified Structural Engineers that are ready to take their career to the next level. The successful candidate(s) will have the opportunity to be directly involved in a wide variety of challenging projects including port developments, marine engineering, ferry terminals, shipyards, fish & wildlife facilities, naval facilities, small boat marinas, municipal structures, floating structures, and design-build infrastructure. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.Structural Engineers within KPFF’s Special Projects Group enjoy the freedom of being the prime consultant on most of our projects. We use a holistic approach to project management that requires you as the Structural Engineer to not just provide structural engineering services, but to SOLVE your client’s PROBLEM. This approach puts you in the role of project manager and allows you to see the big picture on every project. This is a rewarding and enjoyable place to be, giving you direct access to the client and owner.Ideal Qualifications Include BS in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  MS in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  EIT is required  Concrete, steel, and timber coursework and/or design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic coursework and/or design experience  Familiarity with performance-based seismic design, non-linear push-over analysis, and soil-structure interaction analysis  Knowledge of ASCE 61-14, AASHTO, IBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI, and NDS  Proficiency in SAP2000, L-Pile, MS Excel, and VBA is preferred  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  An interest in working on a wide variety of non-building related project types KPFF's Special Projects Seattle office, located in the retail core of downtown Seattle, WA, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group that provides project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide,KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.
