title: Engineering-Structural- Internships (SD)
description: DescriptionCompany ProfileKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.We are accepting applications for our Summer 2024 program, with the possibility to continue through the year. KPFF offers our interns a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We are committed to teaching our interns how to become skilled engineers and will provide in house, hands-on training, mentorship, and opportunities to work on a variety of projects. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life, This position is flexible and depends on mutual scheduling needs as well as the individual's work performance. Interns will be entitled to paid holiday and personal/sick time off.Minimum QualificationsCurrent student who has completed as least 3 years of BS Degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering with an emphasis in structuresMinimum 3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s courseworkUnderstanding of structural engineering fundamentals (free body diagrams, P/V/M diagrams, etc.)Preferred Qualifications BS Degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering and in-process of obtaining Master’s degree in Civil/StructuralPrevious internship experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering roleCandidates with transcripts showing completed coursework in:Structural Statics and DynamicsSteel DesignConcrete DesignWood DesignSeismic Analysis and DesignIf you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume, references and your transcript(s) . Qualified applicants only. No phone calls please.In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts:Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?Who has most influenced you and why?

title: Engineering - Civil Internship
description: Description Civil Engineer Intern–  KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time CIVIL ENGINEER INTERN in our Tacoma office. KPFF is seeking a motivated Junior or Senior level Civil Engineering student for a summer internship in the Tacoma Office of our Special Projects Group.ResponsibilitiesKPFF has devoted a great deal of time and resources into our intern program to create a “best in class” internship experience for students pursuing careers in the AEC industries. Over the past 10 years we’ve honed our summer intern program into an Internship Experience that incorporates structured cross-discipline engineering work with multiple relevant site visits, professional development and technical training opportunities, and social/networking events that facilitate collaboration and interpersonal sharing among interns and KPFF staff alike. The 2023 Civil Engineering Summer Internship being offered is approximately 40 hours a week for 2.5 to 4 months depending on candidate’s availability. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual intern, but generally include the following: Assist with Civil project design. Assist with project site visits. The applicant may be required to navigate through a jobsite and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the jobsite.KPFF's Special Projects Group Tacoma office is located along the Ruston Way Waterfront. This office is part of a dynamic 100+ person group that provides planning, civil and structural engineering, machinery design, and project management. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Current Project Types And Potential Work Includes Parks and Recreational Facility site development with emphasis on stormwater design. Ports; rail infrastructure, terminal operations buildings, wharf design, waterway dredging. Container terminal, ferry terminals, and marina infrastructure design and construction support.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Programs Computer Aided Drafting experience is desired (Autocad and/or Civil 3D) Strong written and verbal communication skills Functions effectively as part of a team Dependability Ability to understand and follow directions Good time management and organizational skillsEducation And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering.About KpffWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF . KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.Reworked this in alignment with Tacoma projects.

title: Structural Engineer (Entry Level - 3 yrs)
description: DescriptionAbout KPFF San FranciscoKPFF San Francisco is a leading structural design firm that specializes in delivering innovative design solutions for a diverse portfolio of projects across various materials, including steel, concrete, wood (including CLT), masonry, light gauge metal, and FRP. We foster a collaborative and dynamic work environment, encouraging creativity and continuous professional development.Responsibilities Engage in design and analysis tasks under the guidance of experienced engineers.  Contribute to the creation of structural design drawings and BIM models for new and existing building projects.  Collaborate with project teams, including owners, architects, and contractors, to ensure successful project delivery.  Demonstrate a strong commitment to excellence and innovative problem-solving in all aspects of the job.  Maintain clear and effective communication through well-organized verbal and written interactions.  Embrace the iterative design process and actively participate in the integration of design and construction methodologies.  This position is primarily an in-person role, with a minimum expectation of four days per week working with the team in the San Francisco office. Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Structural or Civil Engineering.  E.I.T. certification preferred.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Revit experience is highly desirable.  Ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Strong technical and organizational abilities.  Strong self-motivation and a passion for achieving professional excellence.  Ability to think critically and creatively in developing structural solutions.  A proactive attitude towards teamwork, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. Benefits And CultureAt KPFF, we are dedicated to the growth and development of our team members. Our supportive work environment fosters a healthy work/life balance, allowing for personal and professional fulfillment. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and compensation for every hour worked. As a nationwide firm with global projects, an extensive presence across 27 U.S. offices, and professional registrations in all 50 states, KPFF provides ample opportunities for career advancement and global exposure. Our San Francisco office was founded in 1992 and is strongly established in the Bay Area and primarily focuses on local projects within California.BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include: 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contribution (regardless of employee contribution)  Medical insurance (two plans available to choose from)  Dental insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contribution  Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution  Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  Life insurance  KPFF Paid Family Leave  Short-term and Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating Holidays)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Bay Area Commuter Benefits Program (Commuter Check)  Engineering License fee renewals and financial support for PE/SE license applications and examinations. In addition, KPFF provides a bonus program for employees based on the profitability of their Reporting Center and the contributions of the employee to its success.Join our team and be a part of an organization that values your individual contributions and is committed to driving continuous quality improvement without the constraints of bureaucracy.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description: About KPFFKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. At KPFF, our purpose is to engineer opportunities. We focus on solving problems, delivering excellence, helping our communities, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, clients, and profession. We realize sustainable success at KPFF by respecting and empowering personal potential.Position OverviewWe are excited to welcome an Accounts Payable Specialist to our team in Seattle. The Accounts Payable Specialist will experience independence and autonomy in a stable environment at KPFF while enjoying the benefits of collaborating with a supportive accounting team. Monitoring and maintaining effective financial processes to support KPFF’s long-term growth will be an important focus of the Accounts Payable Specialist in addition to executing a variety of accounting duties. The ideal candidate is passionate about numbers and brings a positive and customer-focused attitude.ResponsibilitiesVendor Relations and Invoice Processing:Foster communication with the Controller and AP team for seamless collaboration on vendor relations and invoice processing.Ensure accurate A/P invoice and expense report processing with diligent discrepancy resolution.Efficiently manage check runs and ACH payments for timely fund disbursement, addressing payment issues proactively.Maintain an organized vendor W-9 records repository for regulatory compliance and swift audit response.Financial Record Maintenance and Reporting:Contribute to month-end close with accurate and timely journal entries for financial record integrity.Conduct meticulous monthly GL reconciliations, promptly addressing discrepancies.Review and analyze monthly financial reports to provide valuable insights for strategic decision-making.Actively participate in annual internal audits, ensuring compliance and effective audit support. Compliance and Support:Adhere to GAAP standards in financial activities, stay updated on accounting standard changes and implement adjustments as needed.Provide ongoing technical support and training to team members, contributing to the continuous improvement of financial systems and procedures.Qualifications1 - 3 years of hands-on experience in accounts payable, ensuring accurate and timely financial transactionsAssociate or bachelor’s degree providing a solid foundation in financial principles and accounting practicesUnderstanding and application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) in daily accounting operationsStrong numerical aptitude, keen attention to detail, and proficiency in financial data analysisProficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word for effective financial analysis and communicationKnowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesSelf-motivated and collaborative with a passion for continuous improvement.Works well independently and in team settings, demonstrating adaptability and initiative in fast-paced environments.Maintains a diligent work ethic, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and timely delivery.Proactively identifies and resolves problems with strong attention to detail and analytical skills.Professionalism is consistently upheld, handling sensitive information with discretion and integrity.Physical Demands and Work EnvironmentThis role is onsite in our Downtown Seattle office.Duties are typically performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.Ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material are required.May occasionally need to lift items up to 20 lbs.CompensationThe compensation range for this role is $26 - $30 per hour and will be determined based on the candidate's experience, education, and skills.BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include:401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contributionMedical insuranceDental insuranceHealth Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contributionHealth Savings Account (HSA) with employer contributionHealthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)Life insuranceKPFF Paid Family LeaveShort-term and Long-term disability insurancePaid Holidays (including two Floating Holidays)Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)Subsidized ORCA bus/rail passKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerUnsolicited resumes and candidate profiles submitted by any third-party recruiting, external agencies, or individual to any employee of KPFF will be considered the property of KPFF. KPFF will not be obligated to pay a referral fee for the hiring of a candidate using an unsolicited resume or profile.We kindly ask that third-party recruiting and external agencies respect our process and refrain from submitting unsolicited resumes to our employees.

Our Benefits include:401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contributionMedical insuranceDental insuranceHealth Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contributionHealth Savings Account (HSA) with employer contributionHealthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)Life insuranceKPFF Paid Family LeaveShort-term and Long-term disability insurancePaid Holidays (including two Floating Holidays)Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)Subsidized ORCA bus/rail passKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerUnsolicited resumes and candidate profiles submitted by any third-party recruiting, external agencies, or individual to any employee of KPFF will be considered the property of KPFF. title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionAutoCAD Civil Engineering Drafting Internship - Future OpportunityKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic AutoCAD Drafting Interns. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job QualificationsKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. This is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work either full-time or part-time on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. AutoCAD Drafting Interns work in a close knit team environment in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. These teams contribute to the professional growth of our Interns by sharing professional experience.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Candidates should have excellent communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative, team environment. Seeking candidates who have a degree in computer drafting and design, or are currently pursuing their degree. High School Diploma or GED required. Some Civil CAD experience preferred. Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Company ProfileCompany offers an excellent benefits package.KPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Roadway Engineer (0-3 years)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. title: Modeling/Drafting - Structural Revit Modeler
description: DescriptionModeling/Drafting – Structural Revit ModelerKPFF St. Louis is looking for a capable and motivated Structural Revit Modeler to work in our growing St. Louis office. This is not a remote position.KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF employees are committed to the success of the client, and their reward is a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive and well-rounded benefits package.KPFF’s St. Louis office opened in 2002 and provides structural engineering services locally and nationally. With a staff of 35, our office culture is entrepreneurial and collaborative. We strive to incorporate our core values of Relationships, Stability, Passion, Trust, and Excellence in everything we do.Minimum Technical Requirements Proficiency with Revit Structure and AutoCAD 2018 or higher, with a thorough understanding of applications, tools, and function.  Revit family use.  Tagging and annotation.  Ability to read and understand architectural and structural drawings.  Understanding structural framing and elements of a building.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, light-gage metal, and masonry.  Ability to generate complete and finished drawings from marked prints, engineer notes, and written/verbal instructions.  Good communication and teamwork skills Job Responsibilities Develop engineers’ concepts and sketches into accurate parametric models and drawings.  Manipulate annotative and detail component families, updating tags, and maintenance of live schedules.  Maintenance of views associated with multiple linked Revit models.  Manage drawing issues and daily housekeeping in terms of both digital and hard copy project file storage. Qualities Be an active member of the design team, communicating and coordinating confidently, accurately, and professionally.  Have a positive and practical attitude towards problem solving and working as part of a team.  Use creative thinking to meet building design and drawing production challenges.  Possess strong detailing capabilities.  Have a desire to keep up with software and hardware innovations.  Be willing to work overtime as required.  Able to handle heavy workload with tight deadlines.  Comfortable with communicating with clients via phone, email, and in person, representing KPFF in a positive way. Additional Skills Microsoft Office experience  Bluebeam experience

title: Modeling / Drafting -- Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician - MicroStation
description: Description Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician (Special Projects - Seattle) KPFF Special Projects is seeking a talented and driven Civil/Structural Drafter, motivated to join a team environment in our Seattle office.As a civil/structural drafter, you will work within a team of engineers and drafters alike and become a vital key to producing construction documents that will become a part of our real-world infrastructure. Many of these projects will include civil site plans, bridges, retaining walls, underground structures, and marine structures such as piers, wharves, dolphins, floating structures, and ferry terminals.KPFF is a large, stable company with local control of all engineering and client decisions.The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Qualities Experience drafting in MicroStation and AutoCAD as well as setup of and compliance with various client or agency standards in MicroStation and AutoCAD.  Willingness to learn and become proficient in unfamiliar CAD software.  Good communication and teamwork skills.  Prepare plans, profiles, sections, and details from rough sketches, verbal instruction, and engineers redlines.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, masonry, and a basic understanding of the construction process.  Prepare final drawings ensuring that all work (line work, blocks, etc.) conforms to the applicable CAD standards. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience preferred  Proficiency in MicroStation V8i/Connect and AutoCAD  Proficiency in managing external references within MicroStation AND AutoCAD environments  Associate degree in computer-aided drafting, and/or equivalent experience and training About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, paid family leave, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineering Intern

description: Description Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Nashville Reports To: Nick DeBlasis, Associate/KPFF Nashville Team Leader Reporting Center:  Louisville, KY Position Location(s):  Nashville, TN Status:  Full-Time Summer Position (Temporary) Classification:  Non-Exempt Travel Required:  N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. title: Project Manager
description: DescriptionProject Manager – Industrial GroupKPFF is seeking a Project Manager to lead and oversee projects within our Industrial Group at our downtown Seattle office location. T he type and scope of the projects vary but typically involve manufacturing facilities and related infrastructure. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in project management and operations, collaborating with principals, project managers, and other external team members to drive the successful delivery of industrial projects for manufacturing and private-sector clients. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring projects are executed within scope, schedule, and budget, while also contributing to the growth and efficiency of the team.The ability to establish and maintain productive and professional relationships with members of the Industrial Group, other KPFF staff, clients, and subconsultants is vital to success in this position.We are committed to developing our staff and providing opportunities to pursue their passions in a supportive business environment. We’re a group focused on project leadership who work directly with high profile, nationwide clients, who are driving innovation in the US economy.Job OverviewWe are seeking a self-driven and proactive team leader who can effectively undertake a diverse range of responsibilities to ensure the successful execution of projects and the delivery of client and subconsultant deliverables. The ideal candidate will be adept at confidently handling tasks similar in nature to the followingResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Management: Lead and manage all phases of project delivery, from initial schematic design through construction support and project closeout.  Collaborate with and lead multi-disciplinary design teams to establish project goals, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop and execute project plans, budgets, and schedules.  Monitor project progress and identify and mitigate risks.  Oversee and manage the QA/QC processes related to project submissions.  Ensure the delivery of high-quality projects within scope and budget constraints. Client Engagement And Relationship Building Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with industrial clients, serving as the main point of contact.  Lead project meetings with team members and clients.  Understand client needs and objectives and align project strategies accordingly.  Communicate project progress, issues, and solutions effectively to clients.  Identify opportunities for additional services and client satisfaction. Financial Management Oversee project budgeting, cost tracking, and financial performance.  Review and approve change orders, amendments, and project expenditures.  Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and billing to clients. Team Collaboration And Leadership Foster a positive workplace culture within the Industrial Group.  Collaborate with project teams and provide leadership and guidance.  Mentor and develop junior staff members.  Contribute to the development of best practices and process improvements. Strategic Planning And Business Development Assist in developing business strategies and identifying growth opportunities.  Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends and potential clients.  Collaborate with leadership to create and execute business development initiatives. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in project management, engineering, or a related field.  At least 7 years of experience in engineering design, project management, construction management, or a combination of relevant experience.  Understanding of complex projects integrating architecture, structural, civil, mechanical, and electrical disciplines.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word and Excel.  Strong organizational and time management skills.  Excellent leadership and communication skills.  Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with team members, clients, and subconsultants. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in project management within the industrial sector.  Strong understanding of project finance and budgeting.  Proficiency in project management software and tools.  PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Benefits Benefits provided by KPFF include:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays  10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service.  10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members.  Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year.  Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust  and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.AboutWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: The Position Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Boise and the Treasure Valley over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who is dynamic – there’s nothing wrong with technical savvy, but technical can be trained. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day In The Life Might Include Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Idaho PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience
description: Position SummaryStructural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience DescriptionKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills  Minimum Qualifications   BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete  Steel or Wood Design  At least one year of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required   Preferred Qualifications   3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2348Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD - AutoCAD Drafter - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionEntry Level AutoCAD DrafterKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated entry level AutoCAD Drafters. We continuously accept and review applications for positions when they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job QualificationsThis is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. AutoCAD Drafters work in a close knit team environment with growth opportunity in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. Seeking candidates from entry level up to four years of CAD experience. High School Diploma or GED required. Associate’s Degree preferred. Civil CAD experience preferred.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Candidates will work on a wide variety of challenging projects with growth opportunities based upon their competency, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. title: Structural Engineer
description: KPFF Portland Structural is looking for Entry-Level Structural Engineers (0-3 years) who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about the freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a diverse spectrum of projects in locations around the globe: from mass timber buildings to complex, non-linear analyses of high-rise structures. We have all the benefits of a large, stable company but operate day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we are all about.We are a group of dedicated, friendly and hard-working engineers looking for exceptional engineers to join us. At KPFF you will be trusted to work individually and collaboratively in the design and construction process with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, support staff, and client teams for a wide array of intriguing projects.Our current projects include:AirportsArenas + StadiumsLong-Span StructuresBridgesGovernment FacilitiesCommercial DevelopmentsHigh-Rise StructuresMixed-Use DevelopmentsCorporate CampusesHealthcare + Medical FacilitiesEducation Facilities (K-12 & Higher Ed)Museum + Convention Centers In addition to being creative, proactive, and detail-oriented, the preferred candidate will have:MS or MEng degree (preferred)Strong verbal and written communication skills.To be considered, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave, and other benefits. U.S. work authorization required, we do not sponsor. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Structural Design Intern--Summer 2024
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including preliminary design reports, full project management, project budgeting, permitting coordination, and sub-consultant management. We act on behalf of the owner to ensure a smooth start, guided process, and successful project completion. Weexcel at creative engineering and incorporating design sustainability into projects by helping our clients make "green" choices. We have been in business since 1960 and have an excellent reputation, a great team and flexible working environment. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.Position DescriptionAs a structural engineering intern in our Orange County office, you will get the opportunity to gain some real world engineering experience on a wide range of project types and sizes and to learn skills to help take your future career where you want it to go. You will also get to work with some amazing people and learn from other engineers with a deep and diverse skill set while being actively engaged in a fun, collaborative office environment.Minimum Position Qualifications At least 3 years progress towards Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering with Structural emphasis or equivalent. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to function well in a team environment. E.I.T. certificate or previous intern experience preferred. Successful completion of classes in steel design, concrete design and structural analysis required. Classes in wood design and/or masonry design preferred. Familiarity with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California. Familiarity with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, RISA-3D, SAFE, Microsoft Office).

title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (Entry Level - 2 yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. We have all the benefits of a large, stable firm but none of the red tape that comes with it. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we're about. KPFF is experiencing solid growth and continues to innovate and adapt to better serve our clients. We are a group of dedicated, friendly, collaborative, hard-working engineers and are looking for exceptional engineers to join us.Position SummaryAs a Structural Project Engineer specializing in protective design, you will work individually and collaboratively in the design and analysis of federal and local government, infrastructure, and private 'high-risk' projects with an emphasis on blast engineering, physical security design, progressive collapse and hostile vehicle mitigation. You will work closely with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, security consultants, and client teams. The preferred candidate will have experience in dynamics, blast engineering, protective design consulting, and high-fidelity modeling, in addition to the following qualifications and skills: Master of Science Degree with emphasis in structural engineering  Up to 2 years of experience in structural/blast engineering  Advanced structural modeling  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Creative, proactive, and detail-oriented KPFF provides a wide range of personal and career benefits that accentuate our 'employee focused' company attitude including: An excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Competitive Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Relocation Benefits  Employer-paid engineering society membership  Employer contributed commuter benefit  Performance based bonus based on profitability and contributions of the employee to its success.  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting - Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 22 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers and drafters.Learn more about our company at our website: www.kpff.comJob DescriptionWe are seeking motivated Civil CAD Designers with AutoCAD Civil 3D experience, preferably in site development, to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to use your experience to play a key role in the production of civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D. You will collaborate with our team of engineers, drafters, and surveyors, guided by a Project Manager and with the support of other team members. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, who have effective technical and communication skills to work with internal teams and clients. You’ll collaborate with internal team members and be responsible for the overall presentation and drawing appearance.Our typical scope of services includes preparing civil engineering plans and technical specifications, grading plans, drainage plans, storm water quality design, sustainable design, utility improvements, roadway infrastructure design, and ADA code compliance assessments.As a Civil CAD Designer, you may be responsible for: Creating civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D  3D Modeling of civil engineering design for grading and utilities  Applying established CAD standards  Preparing and editing plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Maintaining organization of project drawing files  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Opportunity to train other team members in AutoCAD and Civil 3D Minimum Qualifications 3 years of relevant CAD experience, preferably in site development.  Good communication skills, and ability to function effectively in a team environment.  Basic knowledge of industry CAD standards and civil engineering plans.  Effective time management skills and the ability to concurrently manage multiple priorities.  Associate’s Degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting (CAD), or similar field.  Working knowledge of typical computer software programs used for civil engineering design (AutoCAD, Civil3D, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, etc.).  Willingness to mentor entry-level engineers, drafters and interns in AutoCAD.  Experience creating or modifying AutoCAD styles and LISP routines a plus. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical Insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Dental Insurance – with a no-premium option  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Comp Time Program  Flexible Working Hours  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates  Learn modeling software, Revit  Generate Construction Documents  Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards  Any and all other duties assigned by your Team Leader Qualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university -AND- with a structural engineering focus  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred  Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members  Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design  Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English  Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material  OUR TEAM MEMBERS Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Indianapolis office is located in the heart of downtown, right on Monument Circle, and close to many fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. title: Civil CAD Technician
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. We offer a non-bureaucratic environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, outstanding coworkers, and competitive pay and benefits. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the projects we work on and who we are as people:Our Civil Engineering team in Boise is seeking full-time Civil Drafters and CAD Technicians to support our group. We are looking for team members that will be responsible for supporting multiple projects and teams by creating, managing, updating, and maintaining a variety of drawings, with an eye for presentation and attention to detail. We want team members that are excited and interested in making a difference in the world and communities we live and work in, are effective communicators, and enjoy working on a team and with different people. Bring your attention to detail, enthusiasm, and creative skills to KPFF to make a difference to our team and projects.Responsibilities Creation of project drawings and exhibit deliverables  Applying established company, jurisdiction, and/or project CAD standards  Maintain organization of project drawing files  Prepare and edit plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Plotting and scanning of drawings  Complete drawings and project responsibilities within anticipated timeline  Attributes:  The ability to work both independently and as part of a team  Self-motivated, hardworking, dependable employee  Be detail oriented, organized and have good follow-through skills  Develop excellent working relationships with team members  Minimum Qualifications  0 – 2 years’ experience or completion of a CAD technical education program  Proficiency in AutoCAD and/or Microstation  Basic knowledge of Civil 3D, InRoads, and/or OpenRoads a plus  Our Company KPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to public agencies, architects, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 3 students for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Portland, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for people who want to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to inclusion and diversity in the workplace.

title: Survey - Land Surveyor - 0-3 Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionEntry Level Land SurveyorThe Civil Division of KPFF Los Angeles is actively hiring for the position of Entry Level Land Surveyor. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to work in the field learning and utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks Job DescriptionKPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth in a learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and multiple projects at once. This fast paced environment will provide opportunity to work with our staff of surveyors and engineers on designs that will include grading, utility, roadway, and drainage design requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate very effectively. Surveyors will have the opportunity to work in many unique and challenging environments.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering and surveying services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth from within a constantly learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and several projects at once. It’s a fast paced environment that will provide opportunity to work with our staff of civil engineers, structural engineers, and in-house surveyors on small and large design projects requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively. Our survey teams work directly with clients on a wide range of projects and are often viewed as the face of the company. This position provides opportunities to work in many unique and challenging environments. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Engineering-Structural- 1-5 yrs Experience (SD)
description: Engineering-Structural- 1-5 Yrs Experience (SD) DescriptionKPFF San Diego is looking to hire structural engineers to support the continuous growth of our office.Minimum Qualifications BS Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  1 year full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  Understanding of structural engineering mechanics and behaviors Highly Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree in Structural Engineering, or Civil/Architectural Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  PE Licensure  In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts:  Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome  Who has most influenced you and why?  If you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume and references (2-3). If you are a recent graduate, please also attach your transcript. Qualified applicants only. Company OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, contractors, and industry innovators to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with passion, integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF offers a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive, well-rounded benefits package that includes 401k matching, flex time and paid family leave.www.kpff.com

title: Civil AutoCAD Designer (6-20 Years)
description: DescriptionKPFF Lacey is looking for motivated and passionate civil designers who are eager to expand their Civil3D proficiency and develop civil engineering design skills. We are accepting applications to fill positions immediately. Applications should include a resume and cover letter.Job Qualifications Associate’s degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting, or similar field (preferred)  Civil design experience  AutoCAD and Civil 3D experience  Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essential  Competency, accountability, and personal commitment to deliver quality work to our clients Job DescriptionOur AutoCAD designers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. This position provides opportunities to work on a variety of projects for both public agencies and private developers which include: Commercial Site Development  Parks and Recreation Facilities  Multi-family / Residential Development  Water Systems  Sewer Lift Stations  Roadway Infrastructure  Municipal Institutions We Provide The Opportunity For Our Designers To Grow And Gain Valuable Engineering Knowledge To Advance Their Career As a Designer. We Look For Candidates Who Want To Be Challenged And Stretch Outside Their Comfort Zone. General Project Tasks That Our Designers Perform Are As Follows Support design engineers and project managers with drafting and design needs  Produce plans and exhibits  Work with other engineers to develop and revise drawings  Ensure project documents are complete, current, and meet our office standards Lacey Office CultureKPFF Lacey’s vision statement is to provide experiences that create a lasting positive impact on our people, clients, and community. We are passionate about providing a collaborative, playful, and positive environment for our employees. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a smal l office. We work in a fast-paced environment that will provide opportunities to work with our staff of civil engineers and surveyors on a variety of project types and sizes requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively.About KPFFWe believe that people are at their best when they have a purpose and are self-motivated from the core of their ideology. KPFF gives individuals the opportunity to pursue and develop an area of expertise and practice that follows their passion and improves our team and culture. We believein supporting these pursuits both professionally and personally. This belief is at the core of our employees and KPFF’s success. KPFF utilizes forefront, a program that provideslifelong career support in technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers a number of growth opportunities and social events.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, competitive rates, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, and much more.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. KPFF participates in the e-Verify program to determine the eligibility of our employees to work in the United States.
