title: Structural Investigator
description: DescriptionKPFF Consulting Engineers provides engineering services to private and public clients worldwide and is seeking a motivated person to provide structural investigation, material testing and special inspection services. Investigations, material testing and inspections services are complementary to KPFF's core structural engineering services and involve the use of a variety of technical equipment. You will work with a team of other structural investigators and structural engineers to provide structural investigative services on Kpff projects.Desired QualificationsThe ideal candidate will possess sufficient education and/or experience to seamlessly collaborate with KPFF's engineering staff to investigate structural systems, provide inspections, and immediately support as many of the job responsibilities listed as possible. Because this list is broad, KPFF will provide additional future training as needed.Minimum Qualifications Ability to read and understand construction plans and specifications.  Ability to understand and comply with safety standards and building codes.  Must possess a valid Oregon Driver’s License and have an acceptable driving record.  Must be able to pass a Federal background check.  High school diploma or GED plus a minimum of three (3) current special inspection qualifications (ICC or WABO) and two (2) years of special inspection experience. -OR-Associates Degree in an engineering-related field plus two (2) years of experience in engineering and/or construction inspection or EIT certification.-OR-Bachelor's Degree in science or engineering plus one year of experience in engineering or construction inspection. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Job Conditions & Physical Requirements Frequently outdoors and construction site visits in all weather conditions.  Work schedules are variable and may be project dependent.  Some work may be above ground, using elevated platforms, or in confined spaces.  Frequent lifting, walking on rough terrain, stooping, and bending is required.  Must be able to lift 30 pounds.  Work may involve occasional travel. Structural Investigation Responsibilities Conduct as-built structural surveys to map out existing structures.  Conduct steel corrosion surveys.  Collaborate with structural engineers to evaluate structural damage to existing structures.  Provide resistograph investigation of wood structures.  Utilize ground penetrating radar (GPR) to investigate reinforcing concrete, post-tensioned concrete and masonry.  Load test assemblies and components using hydraulics and load cells.  Work with state of the art software to document investigation results.  Utilize Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) to investigate concrete and steel components. Special Inspection Responsibilities Provide special inspections of structural steel construction, reinforced concrete construction, post-tensioned concrete construction, structural masonry construction, structural wood framing, proprietary anchor installations, and seismic anchorage of mechanical and electrical components.  Provide NDT of welds including magnetic particle, penetrant, and ultrasonic test methods.  Provide ASTM tests related to each field of special inspection.  AWS certified weld inspection. Compensation & BenefitsKPFF offers competitive salary and a generous benefits package. Please submit your resume through this website. No phone inquiries, please. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Bridge Engineer - 2-4 Years - Structural
description: DescriptionKPFF LA Structural has an opening for a Structural Engineer in our Los Angeles office. We are seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence and eager to develop design and project management skills. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work focuses on structural design on infrastructure projects, including bridges, waterfront infrastructure, and other horizontal construction projects on the West Coast region.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401(k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who receive their PE or SE at KPFF will receive a bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Licensed PE's and SE's receive a cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Qualifications Include B.S. in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  M.S in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  EIT is required  Concrete, steel, and timber coursework and /or design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic coursework and/or design experience  Familiarity with non-linear analysis  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  At least two years of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required  If you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes submitted elsewhere will not be considered.  Link to job posting:  https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2354 Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following:  Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Examples Of Projects Bridges  Wharves and Piers  Water Treatment Infrastructure  Physical Demands and Work Environment  Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated.  Our Employees Are valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural CAD/Drafter Technician
description: Description Structural CAD/Drafter Technician Role OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are actively looking for a meticulous and highly motivated Structural CAD/Drafter Technician to join our Bridge/and Marine Transit Consulting Group (MTCG) groups in our downtown Seattle location. You will play a pivotal role in our team, contributing to the creation of comprehensive construction documents utilizing CAD software in adherence to diverse agency standards. You will demonstrate a keen ability to interpret and translate complex structural and civil layouts, sections, and intricate details from initial rough sketches. Collaborating seamlessly with multiple engineering disciplines, you will actively participate in both small and large-scale projects, drawing on their expertise in general engineering design and construction, with a specific focus on Bridge and Marine structures. The role necessitates efficient task planning and prioritization, ensuring the timely and successful management of intricate, deadline-driven projects. Exceptional verbal and interpersonal communication skills are crucial for fostering a cohesive team environment. Proficiency in AutoCAD is a must, while experience with MicroStationV8i is highly desirable, underscoring the adaptability to various CAD software platforms.Responsibilities Utilize CAD software to develop comprehensive and accurate construction documents in compliance with relevant agency standards. Interpret and translate preliminary sketches into detailed structural Bridge and Marine layouts, sections, and specific project details. Coordinate and collaborate effectively with various engineering disciplines, contributing to the seamless execution of both small and large-scale projects. Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of general engineering design and construction principles, with a specialized focus on Bridge and Waterfront Marine structures. Efficiently manage and prioritize tasks, ensuring the timely completion of complex projects within strict deadlines. Cultivate and maintain strong verbal and interpersonal communication skills to facilitate seamless collaboration within the team and with external stakeholders.Qualifications Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a CAD Operator with proficiency in AutoCAD. Knowledgeable with MicroStation V8i is greatly desired. Experience with Project Wise, SharePoint, and C3D is a plus. CAD certification in Engineering/Construction technology or equivalent experience and training is desired.BenefitsBenefits provided by KPFF include: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions Medical insurance Dental insurance, with a no-premium option Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option Dependent care FSA option Employee Assistance Program Group life insurance Short-term disability insurance Long-term disability insurance Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays 10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service. 10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members. Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year. Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave Travel accident insurance Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Indianapolis
description: DescriptionSummer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF IndianapolisReports To: Mike Maxwell, Associate/KPFF Indianapolis Team LeaderReporting Center: Louisville, KYPosition Location(s): Indianapolis, INStatus: Full-Time Summer Position (Temporary)Classification: Non-ExemptTravel Required: N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. Incorporating our interns into an actual production schedule creates an environment where everyone, from principals to project engineers are ready to share their professional experience and work together as a team. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates  Learn modeling software, Revit  Generate Construction Documents  Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards  Any and all other duties assigned by the Supervisor Qualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- Currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university and with a structural engineering focus  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred  Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members  Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design  Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English  Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material OUR TEAM MEMBERSEmployees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Indianapolis office is located in the heart of downtown, right on Monument Circle, and close to many fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. title: Survey - Project Surveyor
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs a talented Project Surveyor. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East.Where We Stand Out We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more.  Opportunities to work on a wide variety of project types in unique and challenging environments.  Lifelong learning is emphasized to ensure we continue to deliver the highest quality of work for our clients.  Specialized training programs and technical seminars unite people in small groups to advance individual skillsets and delve further into navigating a successful career.  Utilization of cutting edge technology and the latest tools and equipment. Responsibilities Calculates and analyzes field boundary data, assists field survey crews on complex survey engagements, performs survey research.  Preparation of various survey deliverables such as ALTA’s, Subdivision Maps, Legal Descriptions, Construction Staking Calculations, and Condominium Plans.  Provide support to various Project Managers within the firm, provide coordination and support to the field crews, and work closely with Clients.  Deliver projects on time and within budget. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and give direction to field crews for completion of survey tasks  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. Our scope includes construction staking, ALTA land title surveys, boundary, topographic and aerial surveys, Condominium Plans, Vertical Airspace Maps, Parcel Maps, Tract Maps, legal descriptions and laser scanning services. Our team provides high quality surveying solutions to engineers, developers, architects, contractors, individuals, title companies, mortgage companies and public agencies.KPFF provides surveying, civil and structural engineering to architects, public agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has 25 offices across the US.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please apply via our website https://www.kpff.com/job-details/395/.

title: Structural Engineering Project Manager
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:We are looking for experienced structural engineers to partner with us to build our growing team. Our ideal candidate is collaborative, ambitious, smart, and entrepreneurial, with the drive to be a leader within our practice and the industry. A Day in the Life Might Include...  Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Protective Design Engineer - PDX (Entry Level - 2 yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. We have all the benefits of a large, stable firm but none of the red tape that comes with it. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we're about. KPFF is experiencing solid growth and continues to innovate and adapt to better serve our clients. We are a group of dedicated, friendly, collaborative, hard-working engineers and are looking for exceptional engineers to join us.Position SummaryAs a Structural Project Engineer specializing in protective design, you will work individually and collaboratively in the design and analysis of federal and local government, infrastructure, and private 'high-risk' projects with an emphasis on blast engineering, physical security design, progressive collapse and hostile vehicle mitigation. You will work closely with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, security consultants, and client teams.Preferred QualificationsThe preferred candidate will have experience in dynamics, blast engineering, protective design consulting, and high-fidelity modeling, in addition to the following qualifications and skills: Master of Science Degree with emphasis in structural engineering  Up to 2 years of experience in structural/blast engineering  Advanced structural modeling  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Creative, proactive, and detail-oriented KPFF provides a wide range of personal and career benefits that accentuate our 'employee focused' company attitude including: An excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Competitive Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Relocation Benefits  Employer-paid engineering society membership  Employer contributed commuter benefit  Performance based bonus based on profitability and contributions of the employee to its success.  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Surveyor
description: DescriptionAbout KPFFKPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering/land surveying firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design/survey challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession.KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers and surveyors abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development. Our associate Land Surveyors can create the department they envision. Clients, number of personnel, equipment, and types of surveys that they want to pursue are just a few of the decisions that they will make. KPFF Sacramento The KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.Job OverviewKPFF Sacramento has an opportunity for an experienced Land Surveyor with a strong focus on land development to train to become the department head. As a Land Surveyor, you will play a crucial role in supervising/conducting surveys and providing precise data for the planning, design, and development of various land development projects. We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is ready to take the next step in running their own survey department.Collaboration is at the heart of our work, and as a Land Surveyor, you will closely work with our skilled engineering teams, project managers, and clients to gather essential information for successful site development. You will also play a key role in analyzing survey data, performing complex calculations, and creating comprehensive reports, offering valuable insights that shape the direction of our projects. As well as business/client development.Key Responsibilities Supervise / conduct detailed land surveys using advanced instruments for accurate mapping  Supervise preparation of plats, legal descriptions, and topographic maps adhering to industry standards  Collaborate with engineering teams to gather essential data for site development projects  Supervise / perform construction staking and layout surveys for project development  Analyze survey data and create comprehensive reports  Lead and oversee surveying team members  Obtain necessary permits and approvals from local authorities  Stay updated on emerging surveying technologies and best practices  Analyze survey markets looking for new business opportunities. Requirements Land Surveyor in Training (LSIT) certification  At least ten years of survey experience in land and site development projects  Strong knowledge of land surveying techniques and practices  Proficiency in operating advanced surveying instruments and software  Familiarity with relevant laws, regulations, and standards  Effective communication and interpersonal abilities  Valid driver’s license Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Land Surveying, Geomatics, or Civil Engineering  Professional Land Surveyor (PLS) license or ability to obtain within six months  Project management skills  Experience using AutoCAD Civil 3D BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. title: Surveyor
description: DescriptionAbout KPFFKPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering/land surveying firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design/survey challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession.KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers and surveyors abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development. Our associate Land Surveyors can create the department they envision. Clients, number of personnel, equipment, and types of surveys that they want to pursue are just a few of the decisions that they will make. KPFF Sacramento The KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.Job OverviewKPFF Sacramento has an opportunity for an experienced Land Surveyor with a strong focus on land development to train to become the department head. As a Land Surveyor, you will play a crucial role in supervising/conducting surveys and providing precise data for the planning, design, and development of various land development projects. We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is ready to take the next step in running their own survey department.Collaboration is at the heart of our work, and as a Land Surveyor, you will closely work with our skilled engineering teams, project managers, and clients to gather essential information for successful site development. You will also play a key role in analyzing survey data, performing complex calculations, and creating comprehensive reports, offering valuable insights that shape the direction of our projects. As well as business/client development.Key Responsibilities Supervise / conduct detailed land surveys using advanced instruments for accurate mapping  Supervise preparation of plats, legal descriptions, and topographic maps adhering to industry standards  Collaborate with engineering teams to gather essential data for site development projects  Supervise / perform construction staking and layout surveys for project development  Analyze survey data and create comprehensive reports  Lead and oversee surveying team members  Obtain necessary permits and approvals from local authorities  Stay updated on emerging surveying technologies and best practices  Analyze survey markets looking for new business opportunities. Requirements Land Surveyor in Training (LSIT) certification  At least ten years of survey experience in land and site development projects  Strong knowledge of land surveying techniques and practices  Proficiency in operating advanced surveying instruments and software  Familiarity with relevant laws, regulations, and standards  Effective communication and interpersonal abilities  Valid driver’s license Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Land Surveying, Geomatics, or Civil Engineering  Professional Land Surveyor (PLS) license or ability to obtain within six months  Project management skills  Experience using AutoCAD Civil 3D BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include: 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contribution (regardless of employee contribution)  Medical insurance (two plans available to choose from)  Dental insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contribution  Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution  Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  Life insurance  KPFF Paid Family Leave  Short-term and Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating Holidays)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty) In addition, KPFF provides a bonus program for employees based on the profitability of their Reporting Center and the contributions of the employee to its success. .KPFF is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Civil AutoCAD Designer (3-6 Years)
description: DescriptionKPFF Lacey is looking for motivated and passionate civil designers who are eager to expand their Civil3D proficiency and develop civil engineering design skills. We are accepting applications to fill positions immediately. Applications should include a resume and cover letter.Job Qualifications Associate’s degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting, or similar field (preferred)  Civil design experience  AutoCAD and Civil 3D experience  Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essential  Competency, accountability, and personal commitment to deliver quality work to our clients Job DescriptionOur AutoCAD designers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. This position provides opportunities to work on a variety of projects for both public agencies and private developers which include: Commercial Site Development  Parks and Recreation Facilities  Multi-family / Residential Development  Water Systems  Sewer Lift Stations  Roadway Infrastructure  Municipal Institutions We Provide The Opportunity For Our Designers To Grow And Gain Valuable Engineering Knowledge To Advance Their Career As a Designer. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a smal l office. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers a number of growth opportunities and social events.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, competitive rates, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, and much more.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Eugene Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 1 student for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Eugene, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for someone who wants to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. title: Engineering-Structural 5+ Yrs. (Special Projects)
description: DescriptionStructural Engineer – KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time STRUCTURAL ENGINEER.The offices of KPFF’s Special Projects Group are seeking qualified Structural Engineers that are ready to take their career to the next level. The successful candidate(s) will have the opportunity to be directly involved in a wide variety of challenging projects including port developments, marine engineering, ferry terminals, shipyards, fish & wildlife facilities, naval facilities, small boat marinas, municipal structures, floating structures, and design-build infrastructure. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.Structural Engineers within KPFF’s Special Projects Group enjoy the freedom of being the prime consultant on most of our projects. We use a holistic approach to project management that requires you as the Structural Engineer to not just provide structural engineering services, but to SOLVE your client’s PROBLEM. This approach puts you in the role of project manager and allows you to see the big picture on every project. This is a rewarding and enjoyable place to be, giving you direct access to the client and owner.Ideal Qualifications Include BS in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  MS in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  PE is required, SE preferred  Concrete, steel, and timber design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic design experience  Familiarity with performance-based seismic design, non-linear push-over analysis, and soil-structure interaction analysis  Knowledge of ASCE 61-14, AASHTO, IBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI, and NDS  Proficiency in SAP2000, L-Pile, MS Excel, and VBA is preferred  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  An interest in working on a wide variety of non-building related project types KPFF's Special Projects Structural Group, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group in the Pacific Northwest and Long Beach California that provides project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Survey - Survey Crew Chief
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs an experienced, licensed Survey Project Manager. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF Consulting Engineers supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East. Where We Stand Out  We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more.  Opportunities to work on a wide variety of project types in unique and challenging environments.  Lifelong learning is emphasized to ensure we continue to deliver the highest quality of work for our clients.  Specialized training programs and technical seminars unite people in small groups to advance individual skillsets and delve further into navigating a successful career.  Utilization of cutting-edge technology and the latest tools and equipment. Responsibilities Under limited supervision - organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects for public and private clients.  Calculates and records field data and leads survey crew on complex survey engagements.  Proficiently performs training, data collection, and quality checks for survey field work.  Organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to work in the field utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. Our scope includes construction staking, ALTA land title surveys, boundary, topographic and aerial surveys, Condominium Plans, Vertical Airspace Maps, Parcel Maps, Tract Maps, legal descriptions and laser scanning services. title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (3+ yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. We have all the benefits of a large, stable firm but none of the red tape that comes with it. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we're about. KPFF is experiencing solid growth and continues to innovate and adapt to better serve our clients. We are a group of dedicated, friendly, collaborative, hard-working engineers and are looking for exceptional engineers to join us.Position SummaryAs a Structural Project Engineer specializing in protective design, you will work individually and collaboratively in the design and analysis of federal and local government, infrastructure, and private 'high-risk' projects with an emphasis on blast engineering, physical security design, progressive collapse and hostile vehicle mitigation. You will work closely with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, security consultants, and client teams.Preferred QualificationsThe preferred candidate will have experience in non-linear dynamic analysis methods, blast engineering, disproportionate collapse modeling, protective design consulting, and high-fidelity modeling, in addition to the following qualifications and skills: Master of Science Degree with focus in structural engineering  3+ years of experience in structural/blast engineering  Candidates with specialized seismic engineering/consulting experience will also be considered.  Advanced structural modeling  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Creative, proactive, and detail-oriented  Client-focused with consulting experience KPFF provides a wide range of personal and career benefits that accentuate our 'employee focused' company attitude including: An excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Competitive Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Relocation Benefits  Employer-paid engineering society membership  Employer contributed commuter benefit  Performance based bonus based on profitability and contributions of the employee to its success.  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Civil Engineering Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Civil Engineering Internship – 2024 We are on the search for three incredible people to join us for our Summer Internship program. Our standard summer internships run from May to August or June to September, depending on your school schedule. We are looking for students who want to be challenged, are ready to join a team, and dive into project work, problem solve and ask questions. Our teams of PE’s, EIT’s and Civil Designers are happy to show you the ropes and get you up to speed on Civil3D, which you will be using from day one. You will have opportunities to design, produce plans, research, and go on site visits. Additionally, you will have access to our monthly KPFF-U continuing education presentations, vendor lunch and learns, and our Intern training program.Our offices operate on a hybrid schedule with an expectation of 3 days a week in-office and the flexibility to work from home 2 days, but you are welcome to work in the office every day.Qualifications Currently enrolled in a BSCE program and at a junior or senior level with a focus in civil engineering Available for the entire 3-month duration Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective written and verbal communication Able to work effectively in a team environment and on an individual basis Strong organizational and time management abilitiesCompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in mid-January to schedule interviews, with the goal of finalizing internship decisions by the end of February. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.  All applications must be completed through this on-line process. [No phone inquiries, please]  KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering - Civil 3-5 Yrs. Exp
description: Description Civil Engineer –   KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time CIVIL ENGINEER with 3-5 years’ experience in our Seattle office. KPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil engineer in our Seattle office. We are a team of 20+ individuals seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work leans toward heavy civil, design-build transportation, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.Key Responsibilities (or) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Produce design and construction drawings incorporating information from project lead, research data and consultants for various projects including land development grading, utility, drainage, paving plans, etc.  Construction support, cost estimating, geotechnical coordination  Research materials and assemblies for design and construction drawings  Conduct site visits and assist with documenting findings  Interface and coordinate with clients  Perform analysis of Storm, water, and sewer systems  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team of engineers  Willingness to work on a variety of projects  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members Example Of Projects Ports  Dredging, Environmental Cleanup, and Marine Habitat Mitigation sites  Industrial Site Developments  Ferry Terminals  Shipyards  Industrial Stormwater Treatment  Fisheries Engineering  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Airports and Fixed Base Operator Developments  Design-Build Transportation Infrastructure Basic Qualifications Minimum of 3-5 years of civil design experience  B.S. in Civil Engineering  Advanced AutoCAD Civil 3D  ArcGIS, MicroStation and other engineering design software proficiency is a plus  Proficient in MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint  Strong knowledge of construction means, methods and techniques  Ability to prepare civil engineering documents for projects  Ability to read redlines and modify drawings accurately  Ability to work independently and in a team environment  Design experience related to civil infrastructure is required. Additional experience on waterfront and industrial site infrastructure is desirable About UsKPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil engineer in our Seattle office. We are a team of 20+ individuals seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work leans toward heavy civil, design-build transportation, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US with a focus on the West Coast and Pacific Northwest regions. We frequently function as prime consultant and are tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.Benefits / CompensationBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office, access to light rail within building) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.

title: Civil Project Manager
description: DescriptionCivil Project ManagerJob DescriptionWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!You will work within a fun, dynamic, and diverse team to produce deliverables for clients who represent a wide variety of industries. You will have the opportunity to manage projects from the beginning planning stages through construction documents, and support clients during design and construction. Project types vary from site development to utility infrastructure to regional stormwater facilities in the Pacific Northwest and beyond.The option for a hybrid work from home/office environment provides the best of both worlds. Our welcoming and newly renovated office offers collaboration space where you can brainstorm with your team and mentors, an individual workspace where you can dive deep into your design, and large kitchens where you can escape for some lively lunchtime conversation. Two years in a pandemic taught us the value of a flexible work environment and the importance of our time together. We will work with you to establish a home/office balance that addresses your individual scheduling needs. Use your KPFF subsidized ORCA pass to have light rail deliver you directly to our building, or for a sustainable Metro bus commute to our downtown office. To incorporate some exercise into your commute, join the many cyclists in our office and take advantage of bicycle storage and lockers on each floor.In your resume and/or cover letter please indicate how and where you obtained the qualifications we have outlined below. We look forward to getting to know you!Qualifications And Skills Bachelor’s Degree in civil (preferred) or environmental engineering.  Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certification.  Washington State Professional Engineer (PE) license in civil engineering (preferred).  5+ years of experience working under the supervision of a licensed professional civil engineer  Ability and experience to effectively lead and motivate a team to deliver projects  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Desire and ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Working knowledge of AutoCAD and Civil 3D.  Coursework and/or familiarity with stormwater hydrology modeling (preferred). Responsibilities And DutiesAlongside, and with the supervision of a principal and/or associate, you will: Manage and lead the technical and/or logistical elements of a project.  Engage with clients, contractors, and design team members to coordinate and facilitate effective design solutions.  Travel to project sites to observe existing conditions and construction activities.  Review and support team members with jurisdictional code and manual research to confirm design requirements.  Drive and present sustainable civil engineering solutions.  Perform and/or review calculations to support the design of stormwater conveyance, water quality, flow control, and green stormwater systems.  Perform and/or review vehicular turning studies using software such as AutoTurn.  Prepare and/or review project specifications for your project design work.  Prepare and/or present design reports and give design presentations.  Prepare and/or review drainage reports and feasibility studies.  Work with design and project engineers, and CAD staff to develop permit and construction plans that may include erosion control, site demolition, stormwater facility design, site utility design, pavement design, and site grading.  Help train and develop interns, design engineers, and project engineers.  Prepare proposals and scopes of work.  Develop relationships with clients and design team members. Salary And Benefits $87,500+ salary  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

description: Engineering-Structural-1-5 Yrs Experience-TX DescriptionThe KPFF San Diego office is accepting applications for talented structural engineers in our new Austin, TX office. title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level Design Engineer
description: DescriptionPosition SummaryKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills Minimum Qualifications BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete, Steel, or Wood Design  No full-time work experience is required Preferred Qualifications  3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures is preferred  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role is preferred  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2349Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. title: Structural Engineer Entry-Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Want to start your career at an engineering firm with diverse projects, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture? Consider KPFF! We are a national civil and structural firm designing some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front.We are looking for an entry-level structural engineer who enjoys working with teams to accomplish big goals. You’ll be a valued member of our team with training and development opportunities to grow your skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who doesn’t just have the technical skills to succeed, but also has the communication skills (listening, empathy, conveying ideas concisely) to work with internal teams and clients.A Day in the Life Might Include… Creating structural drawings supported by a calculation package  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Referring to applicable building codes for appropriate loads, analysis procedures, and requirements  Discussing the best load path for a safe and efficient building design with your project team  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Supporting a project manager to prepare, allocate, and track a project workplan and budget  Collaborating with architects, contractors, and others on your design team to solve problems and deliver a successful project Qualifications Strong communication skills  Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  EIT Certification  Previous internship experience is preferred Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce

title: Engineering-Civil Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionCivil Engineering InternshipKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are ready to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. Job responsibilities vary by groups, and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.KPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic civil interns. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. We typically hire interns during the summer, and begin reviewing resumes during the spring. Internship opportunities also arise during other times of the year, in which case we will review all applications. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire Civil interns who are Juniors or above, including students pursuing their master’s degree.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and document potential scope of work  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to learn and apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Construction / Project Management Internship
description: Description Construction Project Management – Internship (Special Projects)  Construction Project Management Intern  – KPFF Special Projects may be seeking a full-time CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGEMENT INTERN in our Seattle office.ResponsibilitiesKPFF may be seeking a motivated Junior or Senior level Construction Management, Project Management, Architectural or Engineering student for a summer internship in the Seattle Office of KPFF Special Projects.The Construction Project Management Summer Internship would be approximately 40 hours a week for up to 90 days. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual intern, but generally include the following: Assist with Construction Project Management tasks in the office and in the field. Perform office duties such as construction administration, assisting with reports, contract document management, cost estimating, scheduling, coordination of sub-consultant teams, coordination of testing and inspection resources. Assist with project site visits. The applicant may be required to navigate through a jobsite and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the jobsite.KPFF Special Projects’ Pacific Northwest offices are located in Westlake Tower in Seattle and along the Ruston Way Waterfront in Tacoma. These offices are part of a dynamic 110+ person group that provides planning, civil and structural engineering, machinery design, and project management services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Current Project Types And Potential Work Includes Container terminal design and construction support. Airport terminals and tenant improvements including infrastructure upgrades. Trails and public facility improvements. Roadway upgrades and utility installations. Transit Facilities.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Suite. Experience using BlueBeam Revu. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required. Expectation to function effectively as part of a team. Must demonstrate self-motivation and dependability. Ability to understand and follow directions. Good time management and organizational skills.Education And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors in Construction Management, Project Management, Architecture or Civil Engineering.With over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony.
