title: Bridge Engineering Internship
description: Description BRIDGE ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP DescriptionKPFF’s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Structural Engineering Interns for the Bridge/ Civil-Structural Group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF:We proudly take part in students’ educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job—we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are excited to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. We give interns real problems to solve and real designs to complete. Job responsibilities vary by group, and every intern walks away with real engineering experience and a unique story to tell.KPFF typically hires interns during the summer and begins reviewing resumes the fall prior. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire interns at certain levels in their college careers. Structural engineering interns are typically graduating undergraduate seniors or above (with 90+ credits).The Bridge/Civil-Structural Group consists of structural engineers working in on a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil projects such as, highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves. This internship would focus on bridge projects but may include opportunities to work on other types of projects in the group.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!Minimum Requirements Current enrollment in a BSCE/MSCE program  Completion of 90+ credits, including two or more design courses (concrete, steel, wood, or masonry), by the start of the 2024 summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong communicator and collaborator  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Ability to work in-person in our downtown Seattle office KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Civil Engineering Internship
description: Description Civil Engineering Internship About UsKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and have been in practice for over 60 years. We work with architects, developers, contractors, and public agencies. Join us to be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the sort of projects we work on and who we are as people:Job DescriptionWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!You will work within a fun, dynamic, and diverse team and will have the opportunity to engage on projects from the beginning planning stages through construction documents, and during construction. Civil engineering project types vary from site development to utility infrastructure to regional stormwater facilities in the Pacific Northwest and beyondOur welcoming and newly renovated Seattle office offers collaboration space where you can brainstorm with your team and mentors, an individual workspace where you can dive deep into your design, and large kitchens where you can escape for lively lunchtime conversation. Use your KPFF subsidized ORCA pass to have light rail deliver you directly to our building, or for a sustainable Metro bus commute to our downtown office. To incorporate some exercise into your commute, join the many cyclists in our office and take advantage of bicycle storage and lockers on each floor.When interning with us, you will go beyond getting a glimpse into your future civil engineering career. We will integrate you into our teams and we are excited to share our professional experience as we work on projects together. You will work on real problems to solve and designs to complete.In your resume and/or cover letter, please indicate how and where you obtained the qualifications we have outlined below. We look forward to getting to know you!Qualifications And Skills Current enrollment in a BSCE program  Completion of junior year by the start of the 2024 Summer internship  Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Effective written and verbal communication  Ability to work effectively in a team environment  Strong technical and organizational abilities Responsibilities And Duties Alongside and with the supervision of your teammates, you will:  Travel to project sites to observe existing conditions.  Research jurisdictional codes and manuals to determine design requirements.  Participate in brainstorming sessions about sustainable civil engineering solutions.  Perform calculations to support the design of stormwater conveyance, water quality, flow control, and green stormwater systems.  Perform vehicular turning studies using software such as AutoTurn.  Prepare exhibits for inclusion with reports and/or presentations.  Prepare drafts of drainage reports and feasibility studies.  Work with CAD staff to develop exhibits and progress design plans.  Attend site visits to observe construction of the systems we design. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Bridge Engineer - Entry Level - Structural
description: DescriptionKPFF LA Structural has an opening for a Structural Engineer in our Los Angeles office. We are seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence and eager to develop design and project management skills. This position will provide the opportunity to work for a variety of public and private clients on all types of projects through planning, design, permitting and construction. Our work focuses on structural design on infrastructure projects, including bridges, waterfront infrastructure, and other horizontal construction projects on the West Coast region.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who receive their PE or SE at KPFF will receive a bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Licensed PE's and SE's receive a cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! title: Engineering - Civil-0-2 Yrs Exp - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionEntry Level Civil EngineerKPFF is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic entry-level civil engineers to work in San Diego. We continuosly accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and transcripts (unofficial copies are fine).Job QualificationsIdeally, candidates should have some experience in site development, however more importantly we seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver the highest quality work to our clients.This position requires a B.S. degree or higher and preferably relevant internship experience and Engineer-in-Training (EIT) Certification.Excellent Communication And Teamwork Skills Are Essential.Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and envision potential scope of work requirements.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen.Ability to apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgement, independent decision making, and prolonged focus.Candidates will work on a wide variety of demanding projects with growth opportunities based upon their responsiveness, skills, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Civil Engineer Intern
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with architects, developers, contractors, and public clients to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including Preliminary Design Reports, Full Project Management, Project Budgeting, Permitting Coordination, and Subconsultant Management. In addition, we work on parks, trails, master planning, and include stormwater management and a sustainability focus in everything we do. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. We have a great group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.Founded in Seattle in 1960, KPFF Consulting Engineers is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm in a family-friendly, business casual environment. KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering-Structural-0-3 Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionKPFF Portland Structural is looking for Entry-Level Structural Engineers who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a diverse spectrum of projects in locations around the globe: from mass timber buildings to complex, non-linear analysis of high rise structures. We have all the benefits of a large, stable company but operate day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we are all about.We are a group of dedicated, friendly and hard-working engineers looking for exceptional engineers to join us. At KPFF you will be trusted to work individually and collaboratively in the design and construction process with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, support staff, and client teams for a wide array of intriguing projects.Our Current Projects Include Airports  Arenas + Stadiums  Long-Span Structures  Bridges  Government Facilities  Commercial Developments  High-Rise Structures  Mixed-Use Developments  Corporate Campuses  Healthcare + Medical Facilities  Education Facilities (K-12 & Higher Ed)  Museum + Convention Centers In addition to being creative, proactive and detail-oriented, the preferred candidate will have: Strong verbal and written communication skills.  MS or MEng degree (preferred) Candidates with an undergraduate degree may pursue a master’s degree and receive full tuition reimbursement. KPFF offers a flexible work schedule while pursuing your master’s degree.To be considered, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave and other benefits.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Structural 0-3
description: DescriptionThe Seattle, WA office of KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking qualified Structural Engineers that are ready to take their career to the next level. The successful candidate(s) will have the opportunity to be directly involved in a wide variety of challenging projects including port developments, marine engineering, ferry terminals, shipyards, fish & wildlife facilities, naval facilities, small boat marinas, municipal structures, floating structures, and design-build infrastructure. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.Structural Engineers within KPFF’s Special Projects Group enjoy the freedom of being the prime consultant on most of our projects. We use a holistic approach to project management that requires you as the Structural Engineer to not just provide structural engineering services, but to SOLVE your client’s PROBLEM. This approach puts you in the role of project manager and allows you to see the big picture on every project. This is a rewarding and enjoyable place to be, giving you direct access to the client and owner.Ideal Qualifications Include BS in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  MS in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  EIT is required  Concrete, steel, and timber coursework and/or design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic coursework and/or design experience  Familiarity with performance-based seismic design, non-linear push-over analysis, and soil-structure interaction analysis  Knowledge of ASCE 61-14, AASHTO, IBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI, and NDS  Proficiency in SAP2000, L-Pile, MS Excel, and VBA is preferred  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  An interest in working on a wide variety of non-building related project types KPFF's Special Projects Seattle office, located in the retail core of downtown Seattle, WA, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group that provides project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide,KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Engineering-Civil-0-2 Yrs. Exp. - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionFuture Opportunity – Entry Level Civil EngineerKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic entry-level civil engineers. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Application should include resume, cover letter, and transcripts (unofficial copies are fine).Job Qualifications Ideally, candidates should have some experience in site development, however more importantly we seek candidates who have the competency, attitude, and personal commitment to deliver the highest quality work to our clients.  This position requires a B.S. degree or higher and preferably relevant internship experience and Engineer-in-Training (EIT) Certification.  Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essential.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and envision potential scope of work requirements  Ability to set and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgement, independent decision making, and prolonged focus  Candidates will work on a wide variety of demanding projects with growth opportunities based upon their responsiveness, skills, attitude, and commitment. Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.Our engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. These teams work directly with our clients on some of the most challenging projects in the region. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Engineering-Structural- Internships (SD)
description: DescriptionCompany ProfileKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.We are accepting applications for our Summer 2024 program, with the possibility to continue through the year. KPFF offers our interns a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We are committed to teaching our interns how to become skilled engineers and will provide in house, hands-on training, mentorship, and opportunities to work on a variety of projects. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life, This position is flexible and depends on mutual scheduling needs as well as the individual's work performance. Interns will be entitled to paid holiday and personal/sick time off.Minimum QualificationsCurrent student who has completed as least 3 years of BS Degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering with an emphasis in structuresMinimum 3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s courseworkUnderstanding of structural engineering fundamentals (free body diagrams, P/V/M diagrams, etc.)Preferred Qualifications BS Degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering and in-process of obtaining Master’s degree in Civil/StructuralPrevious internship experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering roleCandidates with transcripts showing completed coursework in:Structural Statics and DynamicsSteel DesignConcrete DesignWood DesignSeismic Analysis and DesignIf you are interested in applying for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume, references and your transcript(s) . Qualified applicants only. No phone calls please.In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts:Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?Who has most influenced you and why?

title: Engineering - Civil Internship
description: Description Civil Engineer Intern–  KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time CIVIL ENGINEER INTERN in our Tacoma office. KPFF is seeking a motivated Junior or Senior level Civil Engineering student for a summer internship in the Tacoma Office of our Special Projects Group.ResponsibilitiesKPFF has devoted a great deal of time and resources into our intern program to create a “best in class” internship experience for students pursuing careers in the AEC industries. Over the past 10 years we’ve honed our summer intern program into an Internship Experience that incorporates structured cross-discipline engineering work with multiple relevant site visits, professional development and technical training opportunities, and social/networking events that facilitate collaboration and interpersonal sharing among interns and KPFF staff alike. The 2023 Civil Engineering Summer Internship being offered is approximately 40 hours a week for 2.5 to 4 months depending on candidate’s availability. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual intern, but generally include the following: Assist with Civil project design. Assist with project site visits. The applicant may be required to navigate through a jobsite and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the jobsite.KPFF's Special Projects Group Tacoma office is located along the Ruston Way Waterfront. This office is part of a dynamic 100+ person group that provides planning, civil and structural engineering, machinery design, and project management. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Current Project Types And Potential Work Includes Parks and Recreational Facility site development with emphasis on stormwater design. Ports; rail infrastructure, terminal operations buildings, wharf design, waterway dredging. Container terminal, ferry terminals, and marina infrastructure design and construction support.Job Skills & Abilities Guidelines Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Programs Computer Aided Drafting experience is desired (Autocad and/or Civil 3D) Strong written and verbal communication skills Functions effectively as part of a team Dependability Ability to understand and follow directions Good time management and organizational skillsEducation And/or ExperienceWorking towards Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering.About KpffWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF . KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.Reworked this in alignment with Tacoma projects.

title: Structural Engineer (Entry Level - 3 yrs)
description: DescriptionAbout KPFF San FranciscoKPFF San Francisco is a leading structural design firm that specializes in delivering innovative design solutions for a diverse portfolio of projects across various materials, including steel, concrete, wood (including CLT), masonry, light gauge metal, and FRP. We foster a collaborative and dynamic work environment, encouraging creativity and continuous professional development.Responsibilities Engage in design and analysis tasks under the guidance of experienced engineers.  Contribute to the creation of structural design drawings and BIM models for new and existing building projects.  Collaborate with project teams, including owners, architects, and contractors, to ensure successful project delivery.  Demonstrate a strong commitment to excellence and innovative problem-solving in all aspects of the job.  Maintain clear and effective communication through well-organized verbal and written interactions.  Embrace the iterative design process and actively participate in the integration of design and construction methodologies.  This position is primarily an in-person role, with a minimum expectation of four days per week working with the team in the San Francisco office. Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Structural or Civil Engineering.  E.I.T. certification preferred.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Revit experience is highly desirable.  Ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Strong technical and organizational abilities.  Strong self-motivation and a passion for achieving professional excellence.  Ability to think critically and creatively in developing structural solutions.  A proactive attitude towards teamwork, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. Benefits And CultureAt KPFF, we are dedicated to the growth and development of our team members. Our supportive work environment fosters a healthy work/life balance, allowing for personal and professional fulfillment. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and compensation for every hour worked. As a nationwide firm with global projects, an extensive presence across 27 U.S. offices, and professional registrations in all 50 states, KPFF provides ample opportunities for career advancement and global exposure. Our San Francisco office was founded in 1992 and is strongly established in the Bay Area and primarily focuses on local projects within California.BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include: 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contribution (regardless of employee contribution)  Medical insurance (two plans available to choose from)  Dental insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contribution  Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution  Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  Life insurance  KPFF Paid Family Leave  Short-term and Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating Holidays)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Bay Area Commuter Benefits Program (Commuter Check)  Engineering License fee renewals and financial support for PE/SE license applications and examinations. In addition, KPFF provides a bonus program for employees based on the profitability of their Reporting Center and the contributions of the employee to its success.Join our team and be a part of an organization that values your individual contributions and is committed to driving continuous quality improvement without the constraints of bureaucracy.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description: About KPFFKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. At KPFF, our purpose is to engineer opportunities. We focus on solving problems, delivering excellence, helping our communities, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, clients, and profession. We realize sustainable success at KPFF by respecting and empowering personal potential.Position OverviewWe are excited to welcome an Accounts Payable Specialist to our team in Seattle. The Accounts Payable Specialist will experience independence and autonomy in a stable environment at KPFF while enjoying the benefits of collaborating with a supportive accounting team. Monitoring and maintaining effective financial processes to support KPFF’s long-term growth will be an important focus of the Accounts Payable Specialist in addition to executing a variety of accounting duties. The ideal candidate is passionate about numbers and brings a positive and customer-focused attitude.ResponsibilitiesVendor Relations and Invoice Processing:Foster communication with the Controller and AP team for seamless collaboration on vendor relations and invoice processing.Ensure accurate A/P invoice and expense report processing with diligent discrepancy resolution.Efficiently manage check runs and ACH payments for timely fund disbursement, addressing payment issues proactively.Maintain an organized vendor W-9 records repository for regulatory compliance and swift audit response.Financial Record Maintenance and Reporting:Contribute to month-end close with accurate and timely journal entries for financial record integrity.Conduct meticulous monthly GL reconciliations, promptly addressing discrepancies.Review and analyze monthly financial reports to provide valuable insights for strategic decision-making.Actively participate in annual internal audits, ensuring compliance and effective audit support. Compliance and Support:Adhere to GAAP standards in financial activities, stay updated on accounting standard changes and implement adjustments as needed.Provide ongoing technical support and training to team members, contributing to the continuous improvement of financial systems and procedures.Qualifications1 - 3 years of hands-on experience in accounts payable, ensuring accurate and timely financial transactionsAssociate or bachelor’s degree providing a solid foundation in financial principles and accounting practicesUnderstanding and application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) in daily accounting operationsStrong numerical aptitude, keen attention to detail, and proficiency in financial data analysisProficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word for effective financial analysis and communicationKnowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesSelf-motivated and collaborative with a passion for continuous improvement.Works well independently and in team settings, demonstrating adaptability and initiative in fast-paced environments.Maintains a diligent work ethic, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and timely delivery.Proactively identifies and resolves problems with strong attention to detail and analytical skills.Professionalism is consistently upheld, handling sensitive information with discretion and integrity.Physical Demands and Work EnvironmentThis role is onsite in our Downtown Seattle office.Duties are typically performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.Ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material are required.May occasionally need to lift items up to 20 lbs.CompensationThe compensation range for this role is $26 - $30 per hour and will be determined based on the candidate's experience, education, and skills.BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include:401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contributionMedical insuranceDental insuranceHealth Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contributionHealth Savings Account (HSA) with employer contributionHealthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)Life insuranceKPFF Paid Family LeaveShort-term and Long-term disability insurancePaid Holidays (including two Floating Holidays)Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)Subsidized ORCA bus/rail passKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerUnsolicited resumes and candidate profiles submitted by any third-party recruiting, external agencies, or individual to any employee of KPFF will be considered the property of KPFF. KPFF will not be obligated to pay a referral fee for the hiring of a candidate using an unsolicited resume or profile.We kindly ask that third-party recruiting and external agencies respect our process and refrain from submitting unsolicited resumes to our employees.

title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD Internship - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionAutoCAD Civil Engineering Drafting Internship - Future OpportunityKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic AutoCAD Drafting Interns. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job QualificationsKPFF proudly takes part in students’ educational and professional development. This is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work either full-time or part-time on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. AutoCAD Drafting Interns work in a close knit team environment in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. These teams contribute to the professional growth of our Interns by sharing professional experience.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Candidates should have excellent communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative, team environment. Seeking candidates who have a degree in computer drafting and design, or are currently pursuing their degree. High School Diploma or GED required. Some Civil CAD experience preferred. Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Company ProfileCompany offers an excellent benefits package.KPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Roadway Engineer (0-3 years)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to make a positive impact on Idaho's transportation infrastructure!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do. We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: www.kpff.comWhat We’re Looking ForKPFF’s Mountain West Transportation Team is located Boise, Idaho. We are seeking a Roadway Engineer with 0 to 4 years of experience designing roadway projects. This position will provide opportunities to: Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams while developing project management capabilities  Work on interesting and diverse projects  Engage with clients  Build our business in Idaho We are passionate about developing great engineers and project managers and do so by offering a variety of experiences, including with mentorship and coaching. Join us and become part of a team that works on transformative projects with exceptional clients. The Position You will work in a fun and dynamic team to produce a range of deliverables from planning studies to construction documents and provide support to our clients during construction. Our group’s projects are primarily in the public works sector, with a broad civil engineering skillset required to design grading, drainage, utilities, paving, and horizontal control. Experience in road and/or utility infrastructure is a plus.Qualifications 0-4 years of experience, focused on transportation design  B.S. in Civil Engineering  EIT Certification or PE License  Familiarity with AutoCAD Civil 3D and/or MicroStation, InRoads, and OpenRoads  Ability to work both independently and collaboratively  Effective written and verbal communication  Strong technical and organizational abilities  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Civil Engineering Internship
description: DescriptionResponsibilitiesKPFF is seeking a motivated Civil Engineering student pursuing their BSCE to work as an engineering technician in the KPFF Lacey office. The position being offered is approximately 40 hours a week for 2.5 to 4 months depending on candidate’s availability. Job responsibilities will vary by project and individual, but generally include the following: Assist with Civil site development and transportation projects, including quantity take-off calculations, design layout, AutoCAD drafting and assistance on survey crews.  Assist in office duties such as making copies, assisting with reports, and permit applications.  The applicant may be required to navigate through a job site and must comply with all Company and Site safety requirements in the office and on the job site. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Minimum QualificationsNonePreferred RequirementsWorking towards bachelor’s in civil engineering.Job Qualifications Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Programs.  Computer Aided Drafting experience is desired (AutoCAD and Civil 3D).  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Functions effectively as part of a team.  Dependability  Ability to understand and follow directions.  Good time management and organizational skills. Lacey Office CultureKPFF Lacey’s vision statement is to provide experiences that create a lasting positive impact on our people, clients, and community. We are passionate about providing a collaborative, playful, and positive environment for our employees. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a small office. We work in a fast-paced environment that will provide opportunities to work with our staff of civil engineers and surveyors on a variety of project types and sizes requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively.About KPFFWe believe that people are at their best when they have a purpose and are self-motivated from the core of their ideology. KPFF gives individuals the opportunity to pursue and develop an area of expertise and practice that follows their passion and improves our team and culture. We believein supporting these pursuits both professionally and personally. This belief is at the core of our employees and KPFF’s success. KPFF utilizes forefront, a program that provideslifelong career support in technical development, project management, professional practice improvement, business development, and personal improvement.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers a number of growth opportunities and social events.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, competitive rates, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, and much more.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. KPFF participates in the E-Verify program to determine the eligibility of our employees to work in the United States.

title: Transportation Engineering Internship
description: Description TRANSPORTATION ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP  MUST APPLY ON-LINE TO BE CONSIDERED One of the largest and most diverse and respected national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers is growing in Spokane! We are seeking a Summer 2024 intern for our transportation team. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF: .DescriptionThe KPFF Spokane transportation team is collaborating with fantastic clients on rewarding projects that are transforming and improving our community!KPFF’s internship program is a quality experience where you will engage with project teams to work on public projects and gain valuable experience and knowledge directly from engineering professionals.Our diverse array of transportation projects includes all types of roadways and pathways, transit, bridge, and aviation. Transportation planning and design projects routinely employ civil engineering disciplines, including transportation geometrics, stormwater hydrology and hydraulics, and utilities. We pride ourselves on providing creative solutions that endure the test of time.We are passionate about developing great engineers and do so by offering a variety of opportunities, experiences and mentoring.We are proud to support engineers beginning their professional career.Join us for an exciting and valuable summer experience!Minimum Qualifications Current enrollment in a BSCE program Completion of junior year by the start of 2024 summer internship Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals Effective written and verbal communication Ability to work effectively in a team environment Strong technical and organizational abilitiesKPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who is dynamic – there’s nothing wrong with technical savvy, but technical can be trained. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day in the Life Might Include… Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  Master’s degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Utah PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting - Structural Revit Modeler
description: DescriptionModeling/Drafting – Structural Revit ModelerKPFF St. Louis is looking for a capable and motivated Structural Revit Modeler to work in our growing St. Louis office. This is not a remote position.KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF employees are committed to the success of the client, and their reward is a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive and well-rounded benefits package.KPFF’s St. Louis office opened in 2002 and provides structural engineering services locally and nationally. With a staff of 35, our office culture is entrepreneurial and collaborative. We strive to incorporate our core values of Relationships, Stability, Passion, Trust, and Excellence in everything we do.Minimum Technical Requirements Proficiency with Revit Structure and AutoCAD 2018 or higher, with a thorough understanding of applications, tools, and function.  Revit family use.  Tagging and annotation.  Ability to read and understand architectural and structural drawings.  Understanding structural framing and elements of a building.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, light-gage metal, and masonry.  Ability to generate complete and finished drawings from marked prints, engineer notes, and written/verbal instructions.  Good communication and teamwork skills Job Responsibilities Develop engineers’ concepts and sketches into accurate parametric models and drawings.  Manipulate annotative and detail component families, updating tags, and maintenance of live schedules.  Maintenance of views associated with multiple linked Revit models.  Manage drawing issues and daily housekeeping in terms of both digital and hard copy project file storage. Qualities Be an active member of the design team, communicating and coordinating confidently, accurately, and professionally.  Have a positive and practical attitude towards problem solving and working as part of a team.  Use creative thinking to meet building design and drawing production challenges.  Possess strong detailing capabilities.  Have a desire to keep up with software and hardware innovations.  Be willing to work overtime as required.  Able to handle heavy workload with tight deadlines.  Comfortable with communicating with clients via phone, email, and in person, representing KPFF in a positive way. Additional Skills Microsoft Office experience  Bluebeam experience

title: Modeling / Drafting -- Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician - MicroStation
description: Description Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician (Special Projects - Seattle) KPFF Special Projects is seeking a talented and driven Civil/Structural Drafter, motivated to join a team environment in our Seattle office.As a civil/structural drafter, you will work within a team of engineers and drafters alike and become a vital key to producing construction documents that will become a part of our real-world infrastructure. Many of these projects will include civil site plans, bridges, retaining walls, underground structures, and marine structures such as piers, wharves, dolphins, floating structures, and ferry terminals.KPFF is a large, stable company with local control of all engineering and client decisions.The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Qualities Experience drafting in MicroStation and AutoCAD as well as setup of and compliance with various client or agency standards in MicroStation and AutoCAD.  Willingness to learn and become proficient in unfamiliar CAD software.  Good communication and teamwork skills.  Prepare plans, profiles, sections, and details from rough sketches, verbal instruction, and engineers redlines.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, masonry, and a basic understanding of the construction process.  Prepare final drawings ensuring that all work (line work, blocks, etc.) conforms to the applicable CAD standards. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience preferred  Proficiency in MicroStation V8i/Connect and AutoCAD  Proficiency in managing external references within MicroStation AND AutoCAD environments  Associate degree in computer-aided drafting, and/or equivalent experience and training About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, paid family leave, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineering Intern
description: DescriptionKPFF offers an internship program designed to provide qualified candidates with an opportunity to learn the day-to-day knowledge and skills necessary to become a structural engineer. Internships also provide KPFF with the opportunity to get to know potential future KPFF employees. In the KPFF Portland office, many internships turn into full-time engineering positions.Our interns gain valuable consulting experience ranging from structural engineering design tasks, drawing coordination tasks, construction site visits, and construction administration services. An intern's job duties will vary by team, but every intern will work alongside experienced structural engineers committed to developing future engineers.Qualifications Strong desire to be a structural engineer upon completion of their education.  Completed a Bachelor of Science degree in civil engineering with emphasis in structural engineering and continuing on for a Master of Science degree in structural engineering (or similar). Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Strong grasp of basic engineering fundamentals.  Effective written and verbal communication.  Strong technical and organizational abilities.  Strong research and information gathering skills.  Application Instructions To be considered for an internship position, please submit your application online and include a cover letter and resume. Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave and other benefits; however, we do not provide accommodations.This opportunity will require an in-office presence and will not be a remote internship.KPFF is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Nashville
description: Description Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Nashville Reports To: Nick DeBlasis, Associate/KPFF Nashville Team Leader Reporting Center:  Louisville, KY Position Location(s):  Nashville, TN Status:  Full-Time Summer Position (Temporary) Classification:  Non-Exempt Travel Required:  N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. Incorporating our interns into an actual production schedule creates an environment where everyone, from principals to project engineers, are ready to share their professional experience and work together as a team. Job responsibilities vary by group and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates Learn modeling software, Revit Generate Construction Documents Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards Any and all other duties assigned by your Team Leader orQualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university -AND- with a structural engineering focus Valid US Driver’s License Reliable transportationRequired Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work Logical and analytical thinker Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material OUR TEAM MEMBERS Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Indianapolis office is located in the heart of downtown, right on Monument Circle, and close to many fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: 2024 Engineering Internship/Co-Op – Junior Year +
description: DescriptionKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into a job; we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are ready to share their professionals experience as they work on projects together. Job responsibilities may vary, but each intern walks away with a unique story to tell. We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!About KPFFKPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession. KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development.About KPFF SacramentoThe KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.We provide engineering services to both private and public sectors with projects in a vast market sector including Commercial, Retail, Mixed-Use, Hospitality, Multi-Family Housing, Parks & Recreational Facilities, Health Care, K-12 Schools, Higher Education, Military, Transportation, and Public Agencies.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Project Manager
description: DescriptionProject Manager – Industrial GroupKPFF is seeking a Project Manager to lead and oversee projects within our Industrial Group at our downtown Seattle office location. T he type and scope of the projects vary but typically involve manufacturing facilities and related infrastructure. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in project management and operations, collaborating with principals, project managers, and other external team members to drive the successful delivery of industrial projects for manufacturing and private-sector clients. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring projects are executed within scope, schedule, and budget, while also contributing to the growth and efficiency of the team.The ability to establish and maintain productive and professional relationships with members of the Industrial Group, other KPFF staff, clients, and subconsultants is vital to success in this position.We are committed to developing our staff and providing opportunities to pursue their passions in a supportive business environment. We’re a group focused on project leadership who work directly with high profile, nationwide clients, who are driving innovation in the US economy.Job OverviewWe are seeking a self-driven and proactive team leader who can effectively undertake a diverse range of responsibilities to ensure the successful execution of projects and the delivery of client and subconsultant deliverables. The ideal candidate will be adept at confidently handling tasks similar in nature to the followingResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Management: Lead and manage all phases of project delivery, from initial schematic design through construction support and project closeout.  Collaborate with and lead multi-disciplinary design teams to establish project goals, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop and execute project plans, budgets, and schedules.  Monitor project progress and identify and mitigate risks.  Oversee and manage the QA/QC processes related to project submissions.  Ensure the delivery of high-quality projects within scope and budget constraints. Client Engagement And Relationship Building Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with industrial clients, serving as the main point of contact.  Lead project meetings with team members and clients.  Understand client needs and objectives and align project strategies accordingly.  Communicate project progress, issues, and solutions effectively to clients.  Identify opportunities for additional services and client satisfaction. Financial Management Oversee project budgeting, cost tracking, and financial performance.  Review and approve change orders, amendments, and project expenditures.  Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and billing to clients. Team Collaboration And Leadership Foster a positive workplace culture within the Industrial Group.  Collaborate with project teams and provide leadership and guidance.  Mentor and develop junior staff members.  Contribute to the development of best practices and process improvements. Strategic Planning And Business Development Assist in developing business strategies and identifying growth opportunities.  Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends and potential clients.  Collaborate with leadership to create and execute business development initiatives. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in project management, engineering, or a related field.  At least 7 years of experience in engineering design, project management, construction management, or a combination of relevant experience.  Understanding of complex projects integrating architecture, structural, civil, mechanical, and electrical disciplines.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word and Excel.  Strong organizational and time management skills.  Excellent leadership and communication skills.  Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with team members, clients, and subconsultants. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in project management within the industrial sector.  Strong understanding of project finance and budgeting.  Proficiency in project management software and tools.  PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Benefits Benefits provided by KPFF include:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays  10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service.  10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members.  Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year.  Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
