title: Structural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience
description: Position SummaryStructural Engineer - Design Engineer 1-2 Years Experience DescriptionKPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.BenefitsKPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including: Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan  Dental Insurance  7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year  2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals  2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members  KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution  KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period  40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday  Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM  Those who earn their CA PE or SE while working for LA Structural receive a licensing bonus in addition to testing fee reimbursement  Monthly cell phone stipend  Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses  Semi-annual Bonuses  Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun! Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor  Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Solid technical skills  Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving  Excellent research and information gathering skills  Minimum Qualifications   BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)  Transcripts must show completed courses in: Concrete  Steel or Wood Design  At least one year of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required   Preferred Qualifications   3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework  Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures  Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in: Structural Design  Steel or Wood Design  Concrete  Seismic  Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role  EIT Certification Application ProcessIf you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.Link to job posting: https://phe.tbe.taleo.net/phe01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=KPFF_2&cws=64&rid=2348Transcripts must be provided prior to an interview. Cover letter is preferable and should address the following: Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?  Who has most influenced you and why? Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.  Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.  May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.  Duties require in-person attendance, Monday through Friday, during our business hours of 8 AM to 5 PM at our office in Downtown Los Angeles for the training period.  Following a satisfactory training period, a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. Our EmployeesAre valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. title: Structural Engineer
description: KPFF Portland Structural is looking for Entry-Level Structural Engineers (0-3 years) who are motivated and have a desire for growth.KPFF is about the freedom to work on what inspires you. title: Structural Design Intern--Summer 2024
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including preliminary design reports, full project management, project budgeting, permitting coordination, and sub-consultant management. Familiarity with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of major building projects located in California. Familiarity with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, RISA-3D, SAFE, Microsoft Office).

title: Modeling/Drafting - Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 22 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers and drafters.Learn more about our company at our website: www.kpff.comJob DescriptionWe are seeking motivated Civil CAD Designers with AutoCAD Civil 3D experience, preferably in site development, to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to use your experience to play a key role in the production of civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D. You will collaborate with our team of engineers, drafters, and surveyors, guided by a Project Manager and with the support of other team members. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, who have effective technical and communication skills to work with internal teams and clients. You’ll collaborate with internal team members and be responsible for the overall presentation and drawing appearance.Our typical scope of services includes preparing civil engineering plans and technical specifications, grading plans, drainage plans, storm water quality design, sustainable design, utility improvements, roadway infrastructure design, and ADA code compliance assessments.As a Civil CAD Designer, you may be responsible for: Creating civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D  3D Modeling of civil engineering design for grading and utilities  Applying established CAD standards  Preparing and editing plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Maintaining organization of project drawing files  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Opportunity to train other team members in AutoCAD and Civil 3D Minimum Qualifications 3 years of relevant CAD experience, preferably in site development.  Good communication skills, and ability to function effectively in a team environment.  Basic knowledge of industry CAD standards and civil engineering plans.  Effective time management skills and the ability to concurrently manage multiple priorities.  Associate’s Degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting (CAD), or similar field.  Working knowledge of typical computer software programs used for civil engineering design (AutoCAD, Civil3D, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, etc.).  Willingness to mentor entry-level engineers, drafters and interns in AutoCAD.  Experience creating or modifying AutoCAD styles and LISP routines a plus. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. title: Civil CAD Technician
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. We offer a non-bureaucratic environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, outstanding coworkers, and competitive pay and benefits. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the projects we work on and who we are as people:Our Civil Engineering team in Boise is seeking full-time Civil Drafters and CAD Technicians to support our group. We are looking for team members that will be responsible for supporting multiple projects and teams by creating, managing, updating, and maintaining a variety of drawings, with an eye for presentation and attention to detail. We want team members that are excited and interested in making a difference in the world and communities we live and work in, are effective communicators, and enjoy working on a team and with different people. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?
description: DescriptionJoin a Structural Engineering Firm that Puts People First.Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits. Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Super Keeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Greater Indianapolis Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Indianapolis office who desires to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Indiana and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat.Why KPFF?KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,400+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “ Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”.Why you will LOVE KPFF GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications More than 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in IN or nearby surrounding states  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion Office EnvironmentWe are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our Firm ProfileKPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “ forefront”. title: Summer 2024 Internship/Co-Op KPFF Cincinnati
description: DescriptionOPEN POSITION: STRUCTURAL ENGINEERING INTERNReports To: Rick Wheeler, KPFF Cincinnati Team LeaderReporting Center: Louisville, KYPosition Location(s): Cincinnati, OHStatus: Temporary (Full and Part-Time Positions Available)Classification: Non-ExemptTravel Required: N/APosition SummaryKPFF proudly takes part in students' educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job; we place them in the middle of it. Incorporating our interns into actual production schedules creates an environment where everyone, from principals to project engineers, is ready to share their professional experience and work together as a team. Job responsibilities vary by group and each intern walks away with a unique story to tell.We are passionate about developing great engineers. Careers at KPFF are driven by individual accomplishments and successful projects. That means your dedication, attitude, and talent drives your professional growth. We invest time in our interns to develop them into future full-time employees. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!This position requires excellent communication and time management skills. The ability to accept constructive feedback is key as is the confidence to reach out for assistance when needed. Interns should be eager and passionate, ready to learn and grow.Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with Team Leader and other Teammates  Learn modeling software, Revit  Generate construction documents  Compliance with OSHA Safety Standards  Any and all other duties assigned by the Supervisor Qualifications Minimum High School Diploma -AND- Currently enrolled in either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a major in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering from an accredited college or university  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals  Coursework in concrete, masonry, steel, or wood design is preferred  Ability to work effectively in a team environment, including the ability to communicate succinctly with various team members  Strong technical skills in structural analysis and design  Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)  Ability to read, write and converse fluently in English  Ability to plan, document, and organize tasks and deliverables so that other team members can clearly interpret your schedule and work  Logical and analytical thinker  Excellent research skills and the ability to independently learn new material SCHEDULE Flexible hours to accommodate school schedules: both full-time and part-time positions are available  May be asked to work beyond scheduled hours if nearing a deadline so long as it doesn’t interfere with school schedules or prior commitments OUR TEAM MEMBERSEmployees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Louisville office is located in the heart of downtown, close to The Kentucky Center for the arts, and many other fantastic event venues and eateries. We are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions while working in a warm and friendly environment. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 3 students for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Portland, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for people who want to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to inclusion and diversity in the workplace.

title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?
description: Description Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky? Join a Structural Engineering Firm that Puts People First. Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits. STRUCTURAL ENGINEER: Stuck and Looking for Sky? KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Superkeeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Kentuckiana Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Louisville office who is desiring to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Part of the position includes the completing of calculations and analysis for concrete, hot-rolled steel, cold-formed steel, wood, masonry structures; preparation of proposals, creating comprehensive scopes of work, project schedules, budgets; obtaining information and resolving design issues with our clients; coordination with construction support on responses to RFIs, submittal reviews, construction site visits, design revisions, management of change efforts; use computer software and structural analysis software to prepare engineering and design documents. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Kentucky and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat. Why KPFF? KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,300+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”. Why you will LOVE KPFF  GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications Minimum 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Architectural Engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in KY and/or IN  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Experience in softwares such as: Revit, AutoCAD, BlueBeam, ETabs, Ram Elements, Ram Structural Systems, SAP2000, CSI CAFÉ, MathCAD  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion  Physical Demands  Maintaining the same position for several hours  Moving through office or site visits  Travel, up to 10% required for site visits and client meetings  Operate a computer, calculator, and various other essential office tools  Kneeling, climbing, crawling, squatting, reaching  Lifting and moving up to 50 pounds Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Office Environment We are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions. Our Firm Profile KPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. The firm encourages innovation and continuous quality improvement in our work that is unencumbered by bureaucratic behavior.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity EmployerLearn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our website at

title: Survey - Land Surveyor - 0-3 Yrs. Exp.
description: DescriptionEntry Level Land SurveyorThe Civil Division of KPFF Los Angeles is actively hiring for the position of Entry Level Land Surveyor. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to work in the field learning and utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks Job DescriptionKPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth in a learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and multiple projects at once. This fast paced environment will provide opportunity to work with our staff of surveyors and engineers on designs that will include grading, utility, roadway, and drainage design requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate very effectively. Surveyors will have the opportunity to work in many unique and challenging environments.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering and surveying services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Lacey, Portland, Eugene, Boise, Sacramento, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Long Beach, Pasadena, Irvine, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, St. Louis, and New York.KPFF provides immense opportunity for professional growth from within a constantly learning and teaching environment focused on excellence. We work on many types of projects and several projects at once. It’s a fast paced environment that will provide opportunity to work with our staff of civil engineers, structural engineers, and in-house surveyors on small and large design projects requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively. Our survey teams work directly with clients on a wide range of projects and are often viewed as the face of the company. This position provides opportunities to work in many unique and challenging environments. We promote decision-making at the level closest to the issue in order to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients, and to promote professional growth for our staff.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

License in Washington (preferred)AutoCAD and Civil 3D experience Knowledge of codes, regulations, and standards applicable to the design and construction of major site development projects in WashingtonExcellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essentialCompetency, accountability, and personal commitment to deliver quality work to our clientsJob DescriptionOur engineers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. We encourage decision-making at the closest level to the issue to most efficiently and effectively serve our clients and promote professional growth for our staff. This position provides opportunities to work on a variety of projects for both public agencies and private developers which include:Commercial Site DevelopmentParks and Recreation FacilitiesMulti-family / Residential DevelopmentWater SystemsSewer Lift Stations Roadway InfrastructureMunicipal InstitutionsWe Provide The Opportunity For Our Engineers To Take Part In All Aspects Of The Design Process And Look For Candidates Who Want To Be Challenged And Stretch Outside Their Comfort Zone. title: Structural Investigator
description: DescriptionKPFF Consulting Engineers provides engineering services to private and public clients worldwide and is seeking a motivated person to provide structural investigation, material testing and special inspection services. Investigations, material testing and inspections services are complementary to KPFF's core structural engineering services and involve the use of a variety of technical equipment. You will work with a team of other structural investigators and structural engineers to provide structural investigative services on Kpff projects.Desired QualificationsThe ideal candidate will possess sufficient education and/or experience to seamlessly collaborate with KPFF's engineering staff to investigate structural systems, provide inspections, and immediately support as many of the job responsibilities listed as possible. Because this list is broad, KPFF will provide additional future training as needed.Minimum Qualifications Ability to read and understand construction plans and specifications.  Ability to understand and comply with safety standards and building codes.  Must possess a valid Oregon Driver’s License and have an acceptable driving record.  Must be able to pass a Federal background check.  High school diploma or GED plus a minimum of three (3) current special inspection qualifications (ICC or WABO) and two (2) years of special inspection experience. -OR-Associates Degree in an engineering-related field plus two (2) years of experience in engineering and/or construction inspection or EIT certification.-OR-Bachelor's Degree in science or engineering plus one year of experience in engineering or construction inspection. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Job Conditions & Physical Requirements Frequently outdoors and construction site visits in all weather conditions.  Work schedules are variable and may be project dependent.  Some work may be above ground, using elevated platforms, or in confined spaces.  Frequent lifting, walking on rough terrain, stooping, and bending is required.  Must be able to lift 30 pounds.  Work may involve occasional travel. Structural Investigation Responsibilities Conduct as-built structural surveys to map out existing structures.  Conduct steel corrosion surveys.  Collaborate with structural engineers to evaluate structural damage to existing structures.  Provide resistograph investigation of wood structures.  Utilize ground penetrating radar (GPR) to investigate reinforcing concrete, post-tensioned concrete and masonry.  Load test assemblies and components using hydraulics and load cells.  Work with state of the art software to document investigation results.  Utilize Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) to investigate concrete and steel components. Special Inspection Responsibilities Provide special inspections of structural steel construction, reinforced concrete construction, post-tensioned concrete construction, structural masonry construction, structural wood framing, proprietary anchor installations, and seismic anchorage of mechanical and electrical components.  Provide NDT of welds including magnetic particle, penetrant, and ultrasonic test methods.  Provide ASTM tests related to each field of special inspection.  AWS certified weld inspection. Compensation & BenefitsKPFF offers competitive salary and a generous benefits package. Please submit your resume through this website. No phone inquiries, please. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Bridge Engineer - 2-4 Years - Structural
description: DescriptionKPFF LA Structural has an opening for a Structural Engineer in our Los Angeles office. Qualifications Include B.S. in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  M.S in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  EIT is required  Concrete, steel, and timber coursework and /or design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic coursework and/or design experience  Familiarity with non-linear analysis  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  At least two years of full-time experience as a structural DE or equivalent is required  If you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes submitted elsewhere will not be considered. Following a satisfactory training period a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week in the office may be accommodated. title: Structural CAD/Drafter Technician
description: Description Structural CAD/Drafter Technician Role OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are actively looking for a meticulous and highly motivated Structural CAD/Drafter Technician to join our Bridge/and Marine Transit Consulting Group (MTCG) groups in our downtown Seattle location. You will play a pivotal role in our team, contributing to the creation of comprehensive construction documents utilizing CAD software in adherence to diverse agency standards. You will demonstrate a keen ability to interpret and translate complex structural and civil layouts, sections, and intricate details from initial rough sketches. Collaborating seamlessly with multiple engineering disciplines, you will actively participate in both small and large-scale projects, drawing on their expertise in general engineering design and construction, with a specific focus on Bridge and Marine structures. The role necessitates efficient task planning and prioritization, ensuring the timely and successful management of intricate, deadline-driven projects. Exceptional verbal and interpersonal communication skills are crucial for fostering a cohesive team environment. Proficiency in AutoCAD is a must, while experience with MicroStationV8i is highly desirable, underscoring the adaptability to various CAD software platforms.Responsibilities Utilize CAD software to develop comprehensive and accurate construction documents in compliance with relevant agency standards. Interpret and translate preliminary sketches into detailed structural Bridge and Marine layouts, sections, and specific project details. Coordinate and collaborate effectively with various engineering disciplines, contributing to the seamless execution of both small and large-scale projects. Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of general engineering design and construction principles, with a specialized focus on Bridge and Waterfront Marine structures. Efficiently manage and prioritize tasks, ensuring the timely completion of complex projects within strict deadlines. Cultivate and maintain strong verbal and interpersonal communication skills to facilitate seamless collaboration within the team and with external stakeholders.Qualifications Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a CAD Operator with proficiency in AutoCAD. Knowledgeable with MicroStation V8i is greatly desired. Experience with Project Wise, SharePoint, and C3D is a plus. CAD certification in Engineering/Construction technology or equivalent experience and training is desired.BenefitsBenefits provided by KPFF include: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions Medical insurance Dental insurance, with a no-premium option Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option Dependent care FSA option Employee Assistance Program Group life insurance Short-term disability insurance Long-term disability insurance Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays 10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service. 10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members. Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year. Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave Travel accident insurance Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Survey - Project Surveyor
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs a talented Project Surveyor. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East.Where We Stand Out We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more. Preparation of various survey deliverables such as ALTA’s, Subdivision Maps, Legal Descriptions, Construction Staking Calculations, and Condominium Plans. description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. title: Surveyor
description: DescriptionAbout KPFFKPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering/land surveying firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design/survey challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession.KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers and surveyors abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development. Our associate Land Surveyors can create the department they envision. Clients, number of personnel, equipment, and types of surveys that they want to pursue are just a few of the decisions that they will make. KPFF Sacramento The KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.Job OverviewKPFF Sacramento has an opportunity for an experienced Land Surveyor with a strong focus on land development to train to become the department head. As a Land Surveyor, you will play a crucial role in supervising/conducting surveys and providing precise data for the planning, design, and development of various land development projects. We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is ready to take the next step in running their own survey department.Collaboration is at the heart of our work, and as a Land Surveyor, you will closely work with our skilled engineering teams, project managers, and clients to gather essential information for successful site development. You will also play a key role in analyzing survey data, performing complex calculations, and creating comprehensive reports, offering valuable insights that shape the direction of our projects. As well as business/client development.Key Responsibilities Supervise / conduct detailed land surveys using advanced instruments for accurate mapping  Supervise preparation of plats, legal descriptions, and topographic maps adhering to industry standards  Collaborate with engineering teams to gather essential data for site development projects  Supervise / perform construction staking and layout surveys for project development  Analyze survey data and create comprehensive reports  Lead and oversee surveying team members  Obtain necessary permits and approvals from local authorities  Stay updated on emerging surveying technologies and best practices  Analyze survey markets looking for new business opportunities. Requirements Land Surveyor in Training (LSIT) certification  At least ten years of survey experience in land and site development projects  Strong knowledge of land surveying techniques and practices  Proficiency in operating advanced surveying instruments and software  Familiarity with relevant laws, regulations, and standards  Effective communication and interpersonal abilities  Valid driver’s license Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Land Surveying, Geomatics, or Civil Engineering  Professional Land Surveyor (PLS) license or ability to obtain within six months  Project management skills  Experience using AutoCAD Civil 3D BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include: 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contribution (regardless of employee contribution)  Medical insurance (two plans available to choose from)  Dental insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contribution  Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution  Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  Life insurance  KPFF Paid Family Leave  Short-term and Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating Holidays)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty) In addition, KPFF provides a bonus program for employees based on the profitability of their Reporting Center and the contributions of the employee to its success. .KPFF is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Structural Engineer (3-6 Years Experience)
description: Structural Engineer (3-6 Years Experience) Description About KPFF KPFF is a multi-office, multi-discipline engineering firm. We’re driven by a commitment to our core values of Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion; defining our professional practice, how we are organized, and our commitment to our clients and employees. For more than 60 years, KPFF has provided creative, practical solutions for projects of all kinds, scales, and industries. We approach every design challenge to fulfill our passion for solving problems, delivering excellence, and enabling the growth and creativity of our people, partners, and profession.KPFF is a growing company with 1,300 employees in 25 offices located nationwide. Our decentralized approach empowers each office to proactively pursue clients and projects that align with their unique strengths and contribute to their overall success. This organizational structure not only offers engineers abundant flexibility but also opens a world of opportunities to foster professional growth and development. KPFF Sacramento The KPFF Sacramento office is located in Roseville, just 18 miles from Downtown Sacramento. Roseville’s affordability, parks, and school systems make it a highly desirable place to live and helped land it in the top 50 U.S. cities to live and retire in. Roseville neighborhoods range from historic to new construction homes and there are more than 80 parks and recreation facilities throughout the city.We provide engineering services to both private and public sectors with projects in a vast market sector including; Commercial, Retail, Mixed-Use, Hospitality, Melti-Family Housing, Parks & Recreational Facilities, Health Care, K-12 Schools, Higher Education, Military, Transportation, and Public Agencies.The scope of our services may include preliminary design, structural analysis, and calculations, Building Information Modeling (BIM), seismic and wind design, foundation design, retrofit and rehabilitation, construction support, value engineering, peer review, research and innovation, client and stakeholder communication, and project management.Job OverviewAs an experienced Structural Engineer at KPFF, you will play a pivotal role in designing, analyzing, and ensuring the stability, integrity, and safety of our projects. Your experience, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills will contribute to the successful execution of our diverse portfolio of projects. You'll collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams and provide your expertise throughout all project phases.Key Responsibilities Perform structural analysis and calculations to ensure designs adhere to relevant codes and regulations.  Design and develop structural plans, drawings, and specifications for a wide range of projects, considering factors like loading conditions, material properties, and environmental considerations.  Collaborate with architects, project managers, and other engineering disciplines to develop integrated and innovative solutions.  Conduct site visits and assessments to evaluate existing structures and identify potential design challenges.  Prepare comprehensive engineering reports, technical documents, and presentations for both internal teams and clients.  Utilize computer-aided design (CAD) software and other relevant tools to produce accurate and detailed structural designs.  Provide mentorship and guidance to junior engineers and drafters, fostering their professional development within the team. Requirements Bachelor's in Civil or Structural Engineering  3-6 years of proven experience in structural engineering within building design and consulting  Strong proficiency in structural analysis software (e.g., Risa, RAM, ETABS) and CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit).  In-depth knowledge of relevant design codes and standards (e.g., ACI, AISC, ASCE).  Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to adapt to changing project requirements.  Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate within a team and engage with clients.  Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.  Experience with sustainable and seismic design principles is a plus. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in Structural Engineering or related field.  Professional Engineer (PE) license in California  Experience with dynamic analysis and advanced finite element modeling.  Familiarity with sustainable design practices and LEED certification.  Knowledge of local permitting processes and agencies in California.  Exposure to a variety of project types, such as façade engineering, earthquake engineering, cold-formed steel design, or specialty structures.  Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to propose innovative solutions.  Experience with AutoDesk, building information modeling (BIM), and related software. Physical Demands And Work Environment Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time while working on a computer, reviewing plans, or conducting site visits.  Ability to move around client and work sites, climb ladders, and traverse uneven terrain.  Ability to lift up to 15 pounds of equipment or materials. BenefitsWe are passionate about supporting our employees through flexible and comprehensive Benefits. Our Benefits include: 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer contribution (regardless of employee contribution)  Medical insurance (two plans available to choose from)  Dental insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) with employer contribution  Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution  Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  Life insurance  KPFF Paid Family Leave  Short-term and Long-term disability insurance  Paid holidays (including two floating Holidays)  Paid time off (vacation, sick, jury duty) In addition, KPFF provides a bonus program for employees based on the profitability of their Reporting Center and the contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Civil AutoCAD Designer (3-6 Years)
description: DescriptionKPFF Lacey is looking for motivated and passionate civil designers who are eager to expand their Civil3D proficiency and develop civil engineering design skills. We are accepting applications to fill positions immediately. Applications should include a resume and cover letter.Job Qualifications Associate’s degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting, or similar field (preferred)  Civil design experience  AutoCAD and Civil 3D experience  Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaborative skills are essential  Competency, accountability, and personal commitment to deliver quality work to our clients Job DescriptionOur AutoCAD designers work in dynamic teams with open communication and strong support from senior-level mentors. This position provides opportunities to work on a variety of projects for both public agencies and private developers which include: Commercial Site Development  Parks and Recreation Facilities  Multi-family / Residential Development  Water Systems  Sewer Lift Stations  Roadway Infrastructure  Municipal Institutions We Provide The Opportunity For Our Designers To Grow And Gain Valuable Engineering Knowledge To Advance Their Career As a Designer. We Look For Candidates Who Want To Be Challenged And Stretch Outside Their Comfort Zone. General Project Tasks That Our Designers Perform Are As Follows Support design engineers and project managers with drafting and design needs  Produce plans and exhibits  Work with other engineers to develop and revise drawings  Ensure project documents are complete, current, and meet our office standards Lacey Office CultureKPFF Lacey’s vision statement is to provide experiences that create a lasting positive impact on our people, clients, and community. We are passionate about providing a collaborative, playful, and positive environment for our employees. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions. Our nearly 40-person office has the benefit of having the resources of a 1,400+ person company, with the closeness of a smal l office. We work in a fast-paced environment that will provide opportunities to work with our staff of civil engineers and surveyors on a variety of project types and sizes requiring the ability to think on your feet and communicate effectively.About KPFFWe believe that people are at their best when they have a purpose and are self-motivated from the core of their ideology. KPFF gives individuals the opportunity to pursue and develop an area of expertise and practice that follows their passion and improves our team and culture. We believein supporting these pursuits both professionally and personally. This belief is at the core of our employees and KPFF’s success. title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Eugene Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 1 student for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Eugene, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). title: Engineering-Structural 5+ Yrs. (Special Projects)
description: DescriptionStructural Engineer – KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time STRUCTURAL ENGINEER.The offices of KPFF’s Special Projects Group are seeking qualified Structural Engineers that are ready to take their career to the next level. The successful candidate(s) will have the opportunity to be directly involved in a wide variety of challenging projects including port developments, marine engineering, ferry terminals, shipyards, fish & wildlife facilities, naval facilities, small boat marinas, municipal structures, floating structures, and design-build infrastructure. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.Structural Engineers within KPFF’s Special Projects Group enjoy the freedom of being the prime consultant on most of our projects. We use a holistic approach to project management that requires you as the Structural Engineer to not just provide structural engineering services, but to SOLVE your client’s PROBLEM. This approach puts you in the role of project manager and allows you to see the big picture on every project. This is a rewarding and enjoyable place to be, giving you direct access to the client and owner.Ideal Qualifications Include BS in Civil Engineering (with a structural emphasis)  MS in Civil Engineering preferred (with a structural emphasis)  PE is required, SE preferred  Concrete, steel, and timber design experience  Pre-stressed concrete and seismic design experience  Familiarity with performance-based seismic design, non-linear push-over analysis, and soil-structure interaction analysis  Knowledge of ASCE 61-14, AASHTO, IBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI, and NDS  Proficiency in SAP2000, L-Pile, MS Excel, and VBA is preferred  Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members  An interest in working on a wide variety of non-building related project types KPFF's Special Projects Structural Group, is part of a dynamic 120+ person group in the Pacific Northwest and Long Beach California that provides project management, planning, civil & structural engineering, mechanical engineering, and machinery design. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development.Typical Project Types Include Transportation Infrastructure  Ports  Ferry Terminals  Industrial Developments  Shipyards  Cruise Terminals  Small Boat Harbors and Marinas  Railway Infrastructure  Stormwater Management  Fisheries Engineering  Airports About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFF is an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, structural, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Survey - Survey Crew Chief
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs an experienced, licensed Survey Project Manager. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF Consulting Engineers supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East. Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more. Responsibilities Under limited supervision - organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects for public and private clients.  Calculates and records field data and leads survey crew on complex survey engagements.  Proficiently performs training, data collection, and quality checks for survey field work.  Organizes, manages and directs field survey crew in completing boundary, topographic, ALTA, right of way, construction staking, and subdivision projects. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to work in the field utilizing fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying to make precise survey measurements of potentially large tracts of land operating surveying instruments  Carry surveying instruments to, from, and in the field  Establish and maintain friendly, business-like relations with those contacted in the course of work  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus to complete surveying tasks KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (3+ yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. We have all the benefits of a large, stable firm but none of the red tape that comes with it. Providing first-class service to our clients is what we're about. KPFF is experiencing solid growth and continues to innovate and adapt to better serve our clients. We are a group of dedicated, friendly, collaborative, hard-working engineers and are looking for exceptional engineers to join us.Position SummaryAs a Structural Project Engineer specializing in protective design, you will work individually and collaboratively in the design and analysis of federal and local government, infrastructure, and private 'high-risk' projects with an emphasis on blast engineering, physical security design, progressive collapse and hostile vehicle mitigation. You will work closely with talented engineers, BIM/CAD technicians, architects, project managers, contractors, security consultants, and client teams.Preferred QualificationsThe preferred candidate will have experience in non-linear dynamic analysis methods, blast engineering, disproportionate collapse modeling, protective design consulting, and high-fidelity modeling, in addition to the following qualifications and skills: Master of Science Degree with focus in structural engineering  3+ years of experience in structural/blast engineering  Candidates with specialized seismic engineering/consulting experience will also be considered.  Advanced structural modeling  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Creative, proactive, and detail-oriented  Client-focused with consulting experience KPFF provides a wide range of personal and career benefits that accentuate our 'employee focused' company attitude including: An excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Competitive Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Relocation Benefits  Employer-paid engineering society membership  Employer contributed commuter benefit  Performance based bonus based on profitability and contributions of the employee to its success.  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Engineering - Experienced Civil Engineer - Ongoing Opportunity
description: Engineering - Experienced Civil Engineer - Ongoing Opportunity DescriptionFuture Opportunity - Experienced Civil EngineerKPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic experienced civil engineers. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Applications should include resume and cover letter.Job QualificationsCandidates must have at least five years’ experience in site development, plus engineering, project management, and planning experience.This position requires a B.S. degree or higher, a California P.E. license, and a minimum of five years of experience. We require experience with sustainable design practices, meeting Low Impact Development (LID) and Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) goals, and proven ability to prepare SUSMPs, SWPPPs, and WQMPs.Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and envision potential scope of work requirementsAbility to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen.Ability t o apply established engineering principles to solve problems and/or overcome obstacles using sound judgement, independent decision making, and prolonged focusSuccessful candidates should be able to demonstrate the ability to focus on client satisfaction, possess high-level communication and interpersonal skills with an interest in training, developing, and supporting staff, and have experience working in a cooperative team environment.Candidates will work on a wide variety of interesting and collaborative projects with substantial growth opportunity.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Civil Engineering Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Civil Engineering Internship – 2024 We are on the search for three incredible people to join us for our Summer Internship program. Our standard summer internships run from May to August or June to September, depending on your school schedule. We are looking for students who want to be challenged, are ready to join a team, and dive into project work, problem solve and ask questions. Our teams of PE’s, EIT’s and Civil Designers are happy to show you the ropes and get you up to speed on Civil3D, which you will be using from day one. You will have opportunities to design, produce plans, research, and go on site visits. Additionally, you will have access to our monthly KPFF-U continuing education presentations, vendor lunch and learns, and our Intern training program.Our offices operate on a hybrid schedule with an expectation of 3 days a week in-office and the flexibility to work from home 2 days, but you are welcome to work in the office every day.Qualifications Currently enrolled in a BSCE program and at a junior or senior level with a focus in civil engineering Available for the entire 3-month duration Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective written and verbal communication Able to work effectively in a team environment and on an individual basis Strong organizational and time management abilitiesCompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in mid-January to schedule interviews, with the goal of finalizing internship decisions by the end of February. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.  All applications must be completed through this on-line process. [No phone inquiries, please]  KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace.

title: Engineering - Civil 3-5 Yrs. Exp
description: Description Civil Engineer –   KPFF’s Special Projects Group is seeking a full-time CIVIL ENGINEER with 3-5 years’ experience in our Seattle office. KPFF’s Special Projects Group has an opening for a civil engineer in our Seattle office. We are a team of 20+ individuals seeking a highly motivated person with a passion for engineering excellence.
