title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We are looking for someone who is dynamic – there’s nothing wrong with technical savvy, but technical can be trained. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day in the Life Might Include… Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in structures  Master’s degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Utah PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting - Structural Revit Modeler
description: DescriptionModeling/Drafting – Structural Revit ModelerKPFF St. Louis is looking for a capable and motivated Structural Revit Modeler to work in our growing St. Louis office. This is not a remote position.KPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with architects, developers, and contractors to realize our clients’ vision for a successful project. If you want to know why we are an industry leader, the answer is simple: our people and our clients. We work with world-class professionals, and they trust us to get the job done. In response to that trust, we hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the client.KPFF employees are committed to the success of the client, and their reward is a work environment that fosters innovation and the exchange of ideas without the limitations of hierarchy. This flat structure is the basis for our unique approach to building vibrant relationships with our clients and each other. We also acknowledge the need for a balanced integration of work and life and offer a competitive and well-rounded benefits package.KPFF’s St. Louis office opened in 2002 and provides structural engineering services locally and nationally. With a staff of 35, our office culture is entrepreneurial and collaborative. We strive to incorporate our core values of Relationships, Stability, Passion, Trust, and Excellence in everything we do.Minimum Technical Requirements Proficiency with Revit Structure and AutoCAD 2018 or higher, with a thorough understanding of applications, tools, and function.  Revit family use.  Tagging and annotation.  Ability to read and understand architectural and structural drawings.  Understanding structural framing and elements of a building.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, light-gage metal, and masonry.  Ability to generate complete and finished drawings from marked prints, engineer notes, and written/verbal instructions.  Good communication and teamwork skills Job Responsibilities Develop engineers’ concepts and sketches into accurate parametric models and drawings.  Manipulate annotative and detail component families, updating tags, and maintenance of live schedules.  Maintenance of views associated with multiple linked Revit models.  Manage drawing issues and daily housekeeping in terms of both digital and hard copy project file storage. Qualities Be an active member of the design team, communicating and coordinating confidently, accurately, and professionally.  Have a positive and practical attitude towards problem solving and working as part of a team.  Use creative thinking to meet building design and drawing production challenges.  Possess strong detailing capabilities.  Have a desire to keep up with software and hardware innovations.  Be willing to work overtime as required.  Able to handle heavy workload with tight deadlines.  Comfortable with communicating with clients via phone, email, and in person, representing KPFF in a positive way. Additional Skills Microsoft Office experience  Bluebeam experience

title: Modeling / Drafting -- Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician - MicroStation
description: Description Civil/Structural CAD Drafter/Technician (Special Projects - Seattle) KPFF Special Projects is seeking a talented and driven Civil/Structural Drafter, motivated to join a team environment in our Seattle office.As a civil/structural drafter, you will work within a team of engineers and drafters alike and become a vital key to producing construction documents that will become a part of our real-world infrastructure. Many of these projects will include civil site plans, bridges, retaining walls, underground structures, and marine structures such as piers, wharves, dolphins, floating structures, and ferry terminals.KPFF is a large, stable company with local control of all engineering and client decisions.The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Qualities Experience drafting in MicroStation and AutoCAD as well as setup of and compliance with various client or agency standards in MicroStation and AutoCAD.  Willingness to learn and become proficient in unfamiliar CAD software.  Good communication and teamwork skills.  Prepare plans, profiles, sections, and details from rough sketches, verbal instruction, and engineers redlines.  Structural drafting experience in concrete, steel, wood, masonry, and a basic understanding of the construction process.  Prepare final drawings ensuring that all work (line work, blocks, etc.) conforms to the applicable CAD standards. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience preferred  Proficiency in MicroStation V8i/Connect and AutoCAD  Proficiency in managing external references within MicroStation AND AutoCAD environments  Associate degree in computer-aided drafting, and/or equivalent experience and training About UsWith over 1,250 employees nationwide, KPFFis an engineering-focused company that is organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF. KPFF Special Projects  – We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of certain projects, which require unique management and technical skills. The KPFF Special Projects Group was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. Special Projects has offices located in Seattle & Tacoma, WA and Long Beach, CA, with a total staff size of 120+ people.Our work generally leans toward heavy civil, transportation, rail, bridge, industrial and waterfront infrastructure throughout the US. We are frequently tasked with solving unusual, multi-discipline challenges that require an innovative and team-oriented approach.We also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships.BenefitsBenefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, paid family leave, a subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass (Seattle office) and paid jury duty. We also provide an excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest by clicking on the “Apply” button below.Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Structural Engineering Intern

Please note we offer competitive compensation, paid holiday, paid sick leave and other benefits; however, we do not provide accommodations.This opportunity will require an in-office presence and will not be a remote internship.KPFF is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Project Manager
description: DescriptionProject Manager – Industrial GroupKPFF is seeking a Project Manager to lead and oversee projects within our Industrial Group at our downtown Seattle office location. T he type and scope of the projects vary but typically involve manufacturing facilities and related infrastructure. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in project management and operations, collaborating with principals, project managers, and other external team members to drive the successful delivery of industrial projects for manufacturing and private-sector clients. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring projects are executed within scope, schedule, and budget, while also contributing to the growth and efficiency of the team.The ability to establish and maintain productive and professional relationships with members of the Industrial Group, other KPFF staff, clients, and subconsultants is vital to success in this position.We are committed to developing our staff and providing opportunities to pursue their passions in a supportive business environment. We’re a group focused on project leadership who work directly with high profile, nationwide clients, who are driving innovation in the US economy.Job OverviewWe are seeking a self-driven and proactive team leader who can effectively undertake a diverse range of responsibilities to ensure the successful execution of projects and the delivery of client and subconsultant deliverables. The ideal candidate will be adept at confidently handling tasks similar in nature to the followingResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Management: Lead and manage all phases of project delivery, from initial schematic design through construction support and project closeout.  Collaborate with and lead multi-disciplinary design teams to establish project goals, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop and execute project plans, budgets, and schedules.  Monitor project progress and identify and mitigate risks.  Oversee and manage the QA/QC processes related to project submissions.  Ensure the delivery of high-quality projects within scope and budget constraints. Client Engagement And Relationship Building Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with industrial clients, serving as the main point of contact.  Lead project meetings with team members and clients.  Understand client needs and objectives and align project strategies accordingly.  Communicate project progress, issues, and solutions effectively to clients.  Identify opportunities for additional services and client satisfaction. Financial Management Oversee project budgeting, cost tracking, and financial performance.  Review and approve change orders, amendments, and project expenditures.  Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and billing to clients. Team Collaboration And Leadership Foster a positive workplace culture within the Industrial Group.  Collaborate with project teams and provide leadership and guidance.  Mentor and develop junior staff members.  Contribute to the development of best practices and process improvements. Strategic Planning And Business Development Assist in developing business strategies and identifying growth opportunities.  Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends and potential clients.  Collaborate with leadership to create and execute business development initiatives. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in project management, engineering, or a related field.  At least 7 years of experience in engineering design, project management, construction management, or a combination of relevant experience.  Understanding of complex projects integrating architecture, structural, civil, mechanical, and electrical disciplines.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Word and Excel.  Strong organizational and time management skills.  Excellent leadership and communication skills.  Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with team members, clients, and subconsultants. Preferred Qualifications Proven experience in project management within the industrial sector.  Strong understanding of project finance and budgeting.  Proficiency in project management software and tools.  PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Benefits Benefits provided by KPFF include:  An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions  Medical insurance  Dental insurance, with a no-premium option  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group life insurance  Short-term disability insurance  Long-term disability insurance  Seven paid holidays and two floating holidays  10 vacation days annually, which increases with years of service.  10 days of personal and sick time to care for yourself and family members.  Up to one-week (five business days) paid jury duty per year.  Six weeks of supplemental paid family leave  Travel accident insurance  Subsidized ORCA bus/rail pass  Performance-based bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Structural Engineer (PE)
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust  and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.AboutWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on: The Position Looking for a firm where you can take your career to the next level? KPFF is a nationally respected engineering firm with diverse projects, coaching opportunities, a tight-knit team, and an engaging company culture. We have designed some of the most iconic structures in Boise and the Treasure Valley over the last 20 years – now we’re looking for a Project Engineer to join us in this new chapter.You’ll be a valued member of our team with opportunities to grow your technical skillset and take on increasing project responsibilities. We need a strong communicator who is hungry to take advantage of coaching and professional development.A Day In The Life Might Include Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in structures)  Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering is strongly preferred  Approximately four (4) years of previous experience in structural engineering  Idaho PE license (or ability to get one in 6 months) is strongly preferred  Strong communication skills  Our Team KPFF Boise is a dedicated team of innovative engineers who care deeply about the local community and the impact we have on it. Since 1960, KPFF has provided sustainable, state-of-the-art contributions to the built environment. We operate daily with the foundation of our core values: Relationships, Excellence, Passion, Stability, and Trust.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked. Benefits include medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Modeling/Drafting-Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D) - Ongoing Opportunity
description: DescriptionFuture Opportunity – Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)KPFF Los Angeles is always on the lookout for motivated and energetic Civil CAD Designers who are proficient in Civil 3D software. We continuously accept applications and review candidates for positions as they become available. Applications should include resume, cover letter, and sample of work if possible.Job DescriptionKPFF Consulting Engineers is hiring a motivated Civil CAD Designer who is proficient in Civil 3D software. This is an opportunity for a dynamic candidate to work on a wide variety of intriguing projects throughout the local area, while expanding their technical knowledge and experience. Civil 3D Designers work in a close knit team environment with growth opportunity in a rapidly expanding entrepreneurial company. Company offers an excellent benefits package.QualificationsCandidates should have excellent communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative, team environment. Candidates should have three to five years of Civil 3D experience. Associate’s Degree preferred. BIM experience is a plus.Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer viewing a screen using Autodesk® AutoCAD® [, Civil 3D®,] and other design-related software.Ability to learn new tasks, maintain focus, understand and absorb instructions, and complete tasks independently.Applicants must be willing to undergo a test to demonstrate level of CAD knowledge and ability.Candidates will work on a wide variety of interesting projects with growth opportunities based upon their skills, attitude, and commitment.Company ProfileKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural and civil engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has offices in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Diego, Irvine, St. Louis, Tacoma, Sacramento, Eugene, Long Beach, Boise, New York, Lacey, Chicago, Louisville, Washington, DC, Salt Lake City, Spokane, and Des Moines.KPFF's civil engineering staff accomplishes projects for site development, parks, and recreation facilities and the improvements to existing city streets, urban arterials, and highways. Scope of services may include site planning, environmental analysis, storm drainage studies, wetlands enhancement, permit coordination, and design of site grading, drainage, storm detention, utilities, access roads, parking facilities, and public street improvements.In addition to typical site development engineering, our civil group serves as a prime consultant to government clients for management and design of transportation, waterfront, site improvements, and major utility projects.KPFF offers excellent benefits including medical and life insurance, vacation/sick/holiday pay, three percent 401k contributions with no matching requirements, bonus compensation, flexible work schedule, career development programs, and much more.KPFF Consulting Engineers is an Equal Opportunity Employer.For more information on the Company, please visit our web site at http://www.kpff.comTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via our website.No phone calls and no recruiters please.

title: Structural Design Intern--Summer 2024
description: DescriptionCompany InformationOne of the largest and most diverse national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering design including preliminary design reports, full project management, project budgeting, permitting coordination, and sub-consultant management. title: Protective Design Engineer - SF (Entry Level - 2 yrs)

title: Modeling/Drafting - Civil CAD Designer (Civil 3D)
description: DescriptionCompany InformationKPFF is an industry leader in Civil and Structural engineering and has been in practice for over 60 years. We work with public agencies, developers, contractors, and architects providing Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Project Management and Surveying services.We offer a collaborative environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, competitive pay, and benefits. We are committed to doing excellent work and providing a supportive business environment. We hire people who are creative, highly skilled, and who approach each job with integrity and in the best interest of the project.We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support. Trust, relationships, and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our success depends on trustworthy team members who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.KPFF is a large, stable company with over 1,300 employees in 22 offices located nationwide. We are decentralized, so each office has the freedom to pursue the clients and type of work that makes their office successful. This type of structure provides a lot of flexibility and opportunity for engineers and drafters.Learn more about our company at our website: www.kpff.comJob DescriptionWe are seeking motivated Civil CAD Designers with AutoCAD Civil 3D experience, preferably in site development, to join our growing team. You’ll have the opportunity to use your experience to play a key role in the production of civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D. You will collaborate with our team of engineers, drafters, and surveyors, guided by a Project Manager and with the support of other team members. Our commitment to training and development will allow you to grow in your career and take on new responsibilities.We are looking for team members who are passionate about making an impact in their work and community, who have effective technical and communication skills to work with internal teams and clients. You’ll collaborate with internal team members and be responsible for the overall presentation and drawing appearance.Our typical scope of services includes preparing civil engineering plans and technical specifications, grading plans, drainage plans, storm water quality design, sustainable design, utility improvements, roadway infrastructure design, and ADA code compliance assessments.As a Civil CAD Designer, you may be responsible for: Creating civil engineering plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D  3D Modeling of civil engineering design for grading and utilities  Applying established CAD standards  Preparing and editing plans, profiles, sections and details from rough sketches, redline mark-ups, and verbal instruction from team members  Presentation and overall drawing appearance  Maintaining organization of project drawing files  Coordinating with engineers and team members  Opportunity to train other team members in AutoCAD and Civil 3D Minimum Qualifications 3 years of relevant CAD experience, preferably in site development.  Good communication skills, and ability to function effectively in a team environment.  Basic knowledge of industry CAD standards and civil engineering plans.  Effective time management skills and the ability to concurrently manage multiple priorities.  Associate’s Degree or certificate in Civil Design Technology, Computer-Aided Drafting (CAD), or similar field.  Working knowledge of typical computer software programs used for civil engineering design (AutoCAD, Civil3D, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, etc.).  Willingness to mentor entry-level engineers, drafters and interns in AutoCAD.  Experience creating or modifying AutoCAD styles and LISP routines a plus. BenefitsBenefits Provided by KPFF: An excellent 401K retirement savings plan with employer contributions.  Medical Insurance  Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) option  Health Savings Account (HSA) option with employer contribution  Dental Insurance – with a no-premium option  Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) option  Dependent Care FSA option  Employee Assistance Program  Group Life Insurance  Short-Term Disability Insurance  Long-Term Disability Insurance  Paid Holidays (including two floating holidays of choice)  Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, jury duty)  Comp Time Program  Flexible Working Hours  Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Travel Accident Insurance  Performance based Bonus program based upon the profitability of the business unit and contributions of the employee to its success. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Civil CAD Technician
description: DescriptionJob DescriptionKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients. We offer a non-bureaucratic environment with opportunity for growth, a great working atmosphere, outstanding coworkers, and competitive pay and benefits. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about the projects we work on and who we are as people:Our Civil Engineering team in Boise is seeking full-time Civil Drafters and CAD Technicians to support our group. We are looking for team members that will be responsible for supporting multiple projects and teams by creating, managing, updating, and maintaining a variety of drawings, with an eye for presentation and attention to detail. We want team members that are excited and interested in making a difference in the world and communities we live and work in, are effective communicators, and enjoy working on a team and with different people. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?
description: DescriptionJoin a Structural Engineering Firm that Puts People First.Re-imagine your structural engineering journey at a firm that embraces individual passions, has an inclusive culture, is nurturing to your professional growth, and gives back to the community. Oh, and we also have some pretty sweet benefits. Structural Engineer: Stuck and Looking for Sky?KPFF Is Seeking a Structural Engineering Super Keeper Who Wants To Make An Impact On The Greater Indianapolis Skyline And Is Experiencing Any/all The Following Circumstances You desire to join a team where you feel respected, accepted, and inspired.  You are at a firm that says they nurture your growth and success but don’t live up to this promise.  You want to make a larger impact in your office & community with opportunities to give back. Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Indianapolis office who desires to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Indiana and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat.Why KPFF?KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,400+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “ Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”.Why you will LOVE KPFF GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications More than 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in IN or nearby surrounding states  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion Office EnvironmentWe are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.Our Firm ProfileKPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “ forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. The firm encourages innovation and continuous quality improvement in our work that is unencumbered by bureaucratic behavior.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity EmployerLearn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our website at

title: Land Survey Intern - 2024
description: Description Portland Civil + Survey  Land Surveying Internship – 2024 We are seeking 3 students for a Summer internship position with our Survey Group in Portland, which runs May-August or June-September (depending on the student’s school schedule). We are looking for people who want to be challenged -- you will work on real projects starting on day one! You will have opportunities to work on a crew out in the field and assist our Survey Office Technicians with CAD, performing a variety of tasks and drawing from the experience and resources of all the professionals in the firm.Qualifications Minimum 16 years old Available to work full-time (40 hours per week; Monday-Friday) Pay = $23/hour Effective communication skills and able to work effectively in a team environment Able to lift up to 70 lbs. Able to stand or walk for several hours (may occasionally encounter challenging terrain)We plan to review resumes and contact qualified applicants in early February to schedule virtual interviews, with the goal to finalize the internship decisions by mid-March. To be considered for this paid internship, please include a cover letter with your resume.CompanyKPFF is a collaborative and creative team of civil and structural engineers and surveyors that thrive on designing innovative solutions for projects of all scales. KPFF is a leader in sustainable design, providing our clients with visionary, environmentally sensitive and technically advanced services. Our company is large (1,300+ employees across 22 offices), but each office is self-directed and has its own unique culture and specialties.KPFF is nimble and operates day-to-day with the flexibility of a small firm. We have a talented group of collaborative and dedicated engineers in a family-friendly, business casual environment.The Portland Civil + Survey office (including Eugene and Washington DC staff) consists of 102 employees including 40 PEs and 3 PLSs. Note: 25% of our staff are former interns. Our core Civil practice focuses on site development, public utility and roadway infrastructure, parks and trails, and innovative stormwater management. Our Survey team focuses on boundary staking, topo surveying, construction layout, drone missions, and building inspections. We work on many different and exciting design projects including education and healthcare facilities, national parks, cultural centers, zoos and museums, as well as government and international facilities. We believe in encouraging personal and professional growth, and we work hard at providing a solid structure with minimal organizational restrictions.KPFF is more than just the work we do, we are the relationships we build, both with our clients and with our co-workers. To foster those relationships and build up our employees, KPFF offers several growth opportunities and social events. With monthly lunchtime learning opportunities, outside speakers, and structured growth programs, employees are offered the opportunity to grow and expand their knowledge. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to inclusion and diversity in the workplace.

Position OverviewKPFF is eager to meet you: we are seeking a hungry, humble, & smart Structural Engineer for our Louisville office who is desiring to make a difference on numerous healthcare, industrial, commercial, hospitality, and housing projects. Part of the position includes the completing of calculations and analysis for concrete, hot-rolled steel, cold-formed steel, wood, masonry structures; preparation of proposals, creating comprehensive scopes of work, project schedules, budgets; obtaining information and resolving design issues with our clients; coordination with construction support on responses to RFIs, submittal reviews, construction site visits, design revisions, management of change efforts; use computer software and structural analysis software to prepare engineering and design documents. Our current Structural Engineers work on both new construction and adaptive reuse projects, in Kentucky and coast-to-coast. We go where our client relationships go, so long as our people are in the driver’s seat. Why KPFF? KPFF is a unique structural engineering company that re-imagines the way we work together. We value our people over all else and have created an inclusive space where one can feel inspired and motivated.Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility for families and encourages a positive work/life balance. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay you for every hour you work. KPFF is a global firm with more than 20 offices, 1,300+ employees, and collective professional registrations in all 50 states.Our purpose is to engineer opportunities for fine Engineers to accomplish their career goals. At our core, we are “Building Relationships and our Community with Engineering Excellence”. Why you will LOVE KPFF  GENEROUS TIME OFF  Fun friendly culture  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Healthcare (medical, dental, long and short-term)  Company-paid family leave  401(k) savings (KPFF contributes 3% of annual salary)  Flexible schedule  Stipends for education and training  Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Fun monthly office-wide activities  Nationwide network  Community involvement opportunities Qualifications Minimum 4 years of structural engineering experience  Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Architectural Engineering  Possession of a Professional Engineer (PE) License in KY and/or IN  Have a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Have command over developing construction documents and leading or being part of a team to complete the project.  Have a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite  Ability to navigate through Revit and implement corrections, annotate, etc.  Experience in softwares such as: Revit, AutoCAD, BlueBeam, ETabs, Ram Elements, Ram Structural Systems, SAP2000, CSI CAFÉ, MathCAD  Valid US Driver’s License  Reliable transportation Required Skills Can prepare and negotiate design contracts, evaluate/assess/manage risk  Has the self-awareness to ask for help when needed and listen with a curious, open mind; has strong emotional intelligence.  Can mentor team members and engage in the overall leadership of the office to propel a growth strategy  Can oversee projects from proposal to completion; has a proficient understanding of load path, whole building systems, mechanics of building materials, etc.  Delivers excellence in communication and construction documents, and enjoys being part of a team to complete the project  Has a strong grasp of the Construction Administration process and best practices. To Succeed At KPFF You Are self-motivated and strive for excellence in all aspects: for yourself and others  Have effective organizational skills and exemplary verbal and written communication skills, focused on relationship building inside and outside of the company  Consistently think beyond rote training to design structural solutions thoughtfully and creatively  Display a desire for growth and welcome advancement opportunities  Welcome the collaborative and iterative process that comes with designing world-class buildings  Embody KPFF’s core values: Excellence, Trust, Relationships, Stability, and Passion  Physical Demands  Maintaining the same position for several hours  Moving through office or site visits  Travel, up to 10% required for site visits and client meetings  Operate a computer, calculator, and various other essential office tools  Kneeling, climbing, crawling, squatting, reaching  Lifting and moving up to 50 pounds Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Office Environment We are a laid-back, diverse, hard-working, and professional team of experts. While flexibility and communication are key to succeeding at KPFF, we are all accountable to each other and are constantly pursuing ways to improve.Employees are valued and empowered, collaborative and team-oriented, innovative in their approach, and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive, and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions. Our Firm Profile KPFF is a progressive structural and civil engineering firm that designs state-of-the-art solutions for a wide range of projects. For over 60 years, KPFF has provided sustainable, high-value contributions to the built environment. We collaborate with our clients, utilizing the advantages of VDC with BIM tools as a way of visualizing, coordinating, and tracking systems. Our focus is to provide engineering solutions to building infrastructure problems, whatever they are, rather than put limits on what we’re capable of providing.At KPFF our purpose is to engineer opportunities. That is why we created a training and engineering philosophy called “forefront”. Your experience starts the day you walk in the door and continues as a career-long effort, focusing on the advancement and growth of the entire team. Learning is a cycle, not a race to the finish line. In one way or another everyone becomes both a teacher and mentor for others as they continue to expand their own skills and drive the KPFF experience. The firm encourages innovation and continuous quality improvement in our work that is unencumbered by bureaucratic behavior.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity EmployerLearn more about KPFF Consulting Engineers by visiting our website at

title: Structural Investigator
description: DescriptionKPFF Consulting Engineers provides engineering services to private and public clients worldwide and is seeking a motivated person to provide structural investigation, material testing and special inspection services. Investigations, material testing and inspections services are complementary to KPFF's core structural engineering services and involve the use of a variety of technical equipment. You will work with a team of other structural investigators and structural engineers to provide structural investigative services on Kpff projects.Desired QualificationsThe ideal candidate will possess sufficient education and/or experience to seamlessly collaborate with KPFF's engineering staff to investigate structural systems, provide inspections, and immediately support as many of the job responsibilities listed as possible. Because this list is broad, KPFF will provide additional future training as needed.Minimum Qualifications Ability to read and understand construction plans and specifications.  Ability to understand and comply with safety standards and building codes.  Must possess a valid Oregon Driver’s License and have an acceptable driving record.  Must be able to pass a Federal background check.  High school diploma or GED plus a minimum of three (3) current special inspection qualifications (ICC or WABO) and two (2) years of special inspection experience. -OR-Associates Degree in an engineering-related field plus two (2) years of experience in engineering and/or construction inspection or EIT certification.-OR-Bachelor's Degree in science or engineering plus one year of experience in engineering or construction inspection. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Job Conditions & Physical Requirements Frequently outdoors and construction site visits in all weather conditions.  Work schedules are variable and may be project dependent.  Some work may be above ground, using elevated platforms, or in confined spaces.  Frequent lifting, walking on rough terrain, stooping, and bending is required.  Must be able to lift 30 pounds.  Work may involve occasional travel. Structural Investigation Responsibilities Conduct as-built structural surveys to map out existing structures.  Conduct steel corrosion surveys.  Collaborate with structural engineers to evaluate structural damage to existing structures.  Provide resistograph investigation of wood structures.  Utilize ground penetrating radar (GPR) to investigate reinforcing concrete, post-tensioned concrete and masonry.  Load test assemblies and components using hydraulics and load cells.  Work with state of the art software to document investigation results.  Utilize Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) to investigate concrete and steel components. Special Inspection Responsibilities Provide special inspections of structural steel construction, reinforced concrete construction, post-tensioned concrete construction, structural masonry construction, structural wood framing, proprietary anchor installations, and seismic anchorage of mechanical and electrical components.  Provide NDT of welds including magnetic particle, penetrant, and ultrasonic test methods.  Provide ASTM tests related to each field of special inspection.  AWS certified weld inspection. Compensation & BenefitsKPFF offers competitive salary and a generous benefits package. Please submit your resume through this website. No phone inquiries, please. KPFF is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Structural CAD/Drafter Technician
description: Description Structural CAD/Drafter Technician Role OverviewKPFF has been an industry leader in civil and structural engineering for over 60 years, working with world-class architects, public agencies, and contractors to realize our clients' vision for successful projects.We are actively looking for a meticulous and highly motivated Structural CAD/Drafter Technician to join our Bridge/and Marine Transit Consulting Group (MTCG) groups in our downtown Seattle location. You will play a pivotal role in our team, contributing to the creation of comprehensive construction documents utilizing CAD software in adherence to diverse agency standards. You will demonstrate a keen ability to interpret and translate complex structural and civil layouts, sections, and intricate details from initial rough sketches. Collaborating seamlessly with multiple engineering disciplines, you will actively participate in both small and large-scale projects, drawing on their expertise in general engineering design and construction, with a specific focus on Bridge and Marine structures. The role necessitates efficient task planning and prioritization, ensuring the timely and successful management of intricate, deadline-driven projects. Exceptional verbal and interpersonal communication skills are crucial for fostering a cohesive team environment. Proficiency in AutoCAD is a must, while experience with MicroStationV8i is highly desirable, underscoring the adaptability to various CAD software platforms.Responsibilities Utilize CAD software to develop comprehensive and accurate construction documents in compliance with relevant agency standards. Interpret and translate preliminary sketches into detailed structural Bridge and Marine layouts, sections, and specific project details. Coordinate and collaborate effectively with various engineering disciplines, contributing to the seamless execution of both small and large-scale projects. Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of general engineering design and construction principles, with a specialized focus on Bridge and Waterfront Marine structures. Efficiently manage and prioritize tasks, ensuring the timely completion of complex projects within strict deadlines. title: Summer 2024 Internship Opportunity - KPFF Indianapolis

They are reliable, trustworthy, and open with a high level of integrity. title: Survey - Project Surveyor
description: DescriptionDynamic and friendly Survey and Civil Engineering office needs a talented Project Surveyor. Established in Los Angeles in 1968, KPFF supports the most exciting projects that define the region, and reshape numerous neighborhoods and communities, from the beaches on the Westside to the deserts in the East.Where We Stand Out We pay you for every hour you work and encourage work life integration.  Generous benefits including a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, KPFF Paid Family Leave, Short and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Paid Time Off & Holidays and more.  Opportunities to work on a wide variety of project types in unique and challenging environments.  Lifelong learning is emphasized to ensure we continue to deliver the highest quality of work for our clients.  Specialized training programs and technical seminars unite people in small groups to advance individual skillsets and delve further into navigating a successful career.  Utilization of cutting edge technology and the latest tools and equipment. Responsibilities Calculates and analyzes field boundary data, assists field survey crews on complex survey engagements, performs survey research.  Preparation of various survey deliverables such as ALTA’s, Subdivision Maps, Legal Descriptions, Construction Staking Calculations, and Condominium Plans.  Provide support to various Project Managers within the firm, provide coordination and support to the field crews, and work closely with Clients.  Deliver projects on time and within budget. Qualifications California P.L.S. license preferred.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment working in multidisciplinary teams.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Demonstrated knowledge and application of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of surveying and possess knowledge of related fields and areas of operation which affect, or are affected by own area of expertise.  Ability to visit job sites to inspect existing conditions and give direction to field crews for completion of survey tasks  Ability to sit and/or stand for prolonged periods of time at a desk working on a computer and viewing a screen  Ability to utilize sound judgment, independent decision making, and prolonged focus KPFF’s surveying team provides land surveying and mapping for projects of all sizes throughout Southern California. Our scope includes construction staking, ALTA land title surveys, boundary, topographic and aerial surveys, Condominium Plans, Vertical Airspace Maps, Parcel Maps, Tract Maps, legal descriptions and laser scanning services. Our team provides high quality surveying solutions to engineers, developers, architects, contractors, individuals, title companies, mortgage companies and public agencies.KPFF provides surveying, civil and structural engineering to architects, public agencies, developers, and contractors for projects with a wide range of functions. Established in 1960, KPFF has 25 offices across the US.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please apply via our website https://www.kpff.com/job-details/395/.

title: Structural Engineering Project Manager
description: DescriptionAbout UsWork with us, not for us. Let’s partner together to create our future built environment!KPFF is an engineering-focused company organized around the philosophy that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company. Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on passionate, trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.We focus on long-term stability and prudent growth by building lasting relationships, maintaining an excellent reputation, helping improve our profession, helping our clients to succeed, and providing increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.Who We’re Looking ForWe also like to have fun and give back to our community! Social events and community outreach activities are an important part of who we are and help to strengthen our relationships. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about us and the projects we work on:We are looking for experienced structural engineers to partner with us to build our growing team. Our ideal candidate is collaborative, ambitious, smart, and entrepreneurial, with the drive to be a leader within our practice and the industry. A Day in the Life Might Include...  Proactively collaborating with architects, contractors, and other design team members to solve problems and deliver a successful project to the owner  Developing a project workplan, budget, and proposal  Creating structural drawings and calculation packages  Developing a structural model using computer-aided design software (Revit, AutoCAD, RAM, etc.)  Strategizing with project teams for sustainable and efficient design  Visiting a construction site and writing an observation report  Participating in an office training session on effective communication, project management, or another applicable topic Our TeamOur Salt Lake City office opened in 2017 to better service owners, architects, and contractors along the Wasatch Front. We are a growing engineering practice that is part of a reputable multidisciplinary firm. Although we are part of a nationwide firm, at KPFF we believe that decisions should be made at the level closest to the issue, unencumbered by bureaucratic policies or practices.Our work includes a broad portfolio of projects using all types of materials and cutting-edge technologies, including performance-based design, nonlinear analysis, and parametric modeling. From the LDS Conference Center to Trolley Square, KPFF has been honored to play a part in designing some of the most iconic spaces in Salt Lake City. Come help us write the next chapter!Our CompanyKPFF Consulting Engineers provides structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. KPFF is a nationwide firm with more than 20 offices and 1,200 employees. Our supportive and fun work environment allows for flexibility and encourages work/life harmony. We offer generous benefits, a competitive salary, and pay for every hour worked.Benefits include professional development, medical, dental (option), life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, family leave, paid holidays, vacation and sick time. We also provide an excellent 401k retirement savings plan with employer contributions. Additionally, KPFF provides a bonus program for its employees based upon the profitability of their Reporting Center and contributions of the employee to its success.KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

title: Protective Design Engineer - PDX (Entry Level - 2 yrs)
description: DescriptionKPFF is about freedom to work on what inspires you. Our engineers work on a vast spectrum of projects that are located around the globe, providing them a challenging work environment with support to focus on specific areas of expertise. Coaching, development, and career path guidance  Leadership Opportunities  Project and Office Diversity  Community involvement opportunities KPFF is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.
